loans.name: Ngone

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five members of the Daradji association, led by Ngone S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“ Context : This business is located in the village of Yoff, and it is initiated by a group of senior citizens in order to occupy themselves and contribute to the well-being of the local villagers by addressing the current scarcity of cooking gas in Senegal.

Objectives: To establish a cooking gas supply store in order to help solve the problem of the lack of cooking gas in the village of Yoff.

Business activities: These consist of purchasing cooking gas from wholesale suppliers and reselling it to the villagers of Yoff.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte du Projet: Ce projet se situe dans l’éco village de Yoff il est initié par des personnes du troisième âge qui pour s’occuper,et vouloir contribuer à la satisfaction des populations vu les punéries momentané de gaz au Sénégal .

Objectifs du Prêt : Installer un magasin d’approvisionnement da gaz afin d’aider à régler les problèmes de manque de gaz dans le village de Yoff.

Activités : Elle consiste à acheter du gaz chez les commerçants grossistes et le revendre aux populations de Yoff . »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of cooking gas; transportation to village for retail sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five women of the Jappoo association, led by Rose N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“This business is located in the village of Yoff. It is managed by a group of highly motivated people who are active in the local trading business. The Jappoo group’s objective is to improve the living conditions of its members, to have the financial means to provide for their children’s education and health care … [We seek] the financial means which will allow us to buy cloth in countries such as Mali and Mauritania, and resell it in Dakar and in the other big cities of the country.”

Original French business description:

«Présentation du contexte du projet : Le projet se situ dans l’éco village de yoff. Il regroupe des personnes animées de bonne volonté qui s’activent dans les activités commerciales

- Objectif du prêt : Le groupement Jappoo a pour objectif, d’améliorer les conditions de vie des ses membres ; - de pouvoir avoir les moins d’assurer la scolarité de leurs enfant et de leurs prise en charge médicales.

-Activités : Comment comptez-vous les mener afin de pouvoir rembourser le prêt sans aucune difficulté : Notre activité principale est : le commerce ; il s’agit de trouver les moyens financiers nous permettant de pouvoir acheter des tissus dans les pays comme le Mali, La Mauritanie etc.…. Et les revendre à Dakar et les autre grandes villes du pays.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of Bassin and Batik cloth from neighboring countries and transportation to market in Dakar

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet’s husband died of cancer and she must support her 3 children. Duy, the eldest, and Cam Vy, her second, stopped going to school. They were very short of money as Duy had to work as a day laborer to earn money to pay for their father's treatment. Cam Vy helps her mother make pudding, sweet soup, and stewed fruit to sell at a small market. Do, the youngest, is in grade 9.

Tuyet has a small hut with a clay floor. She has only 2000 square meters for growing rice. Mrs Tuyet has repaid her second loan of $50. Tuyet’s family income has increased $1.8/person/month. Her average income is now $11.5 person/month. Now, she want to borrow $75 for her sweet soup business, and for growing rice.

loans.use: Selling sweet soup and stewed fruit

texts.en:
This 51-year-old woman has run this business for 2 years.
Ayna is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. She is settled in  Kayidish village and is married and has 2 children.
In the beginning of her business Anya borrowed loan $400 and bought 2 calves.She likes animals and enjoys looking after the calves.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 bull-calves to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy different varieties of bead materials for her beadwork business

texts.en:
Damet has had his own auto-repair business since 2001.
With this business he has been able to provide his children with an education.
He wishes to see his children successfully finish their education and ensure an opportunity for them for a better future.
This 33-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 he purchased paint and other materials.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts. He wants to offer better services to his customers and increase the number of his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charity would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her beadwork business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Narumu would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Faith Naserian would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Munyenye Ntusero leng’irra would like to buy different varieties of beadwork materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tumpeyia Kutata would like to buy two steers for fattening.

texts.en:
Metleb is 38 years old, married has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region, Kayidish village.
His business involves supplying milk in the village. He has been in this business for 2 years. He has a dairy cow, which provides his income. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow. 
Metleb plans to expand the dairy farming because he provides for his family by selling milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lasai would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nkaanka Ene Meeli would like to buy 5 steers for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teleyio Turere would like to buy different varieties of beads materials for her business.

loans.name: Shakhmurad

texts.en:
29-year-old Shakhmurad is a very active and responsible man. 2 years ago he decided to start a small grocery store.
He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has a child.
Having borrowed $400 he bought foodstuffs.
He believes that his business will be a success.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his grocery store and to buy more foodstuffs to offer to his clients and in this way increase his income.

loans.use: To expand the area of his grocery store

texts.en:
Fizuli has run this business for 2 years.
He is 54, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region Kayidish village.He is married and has 2 children.
Fizuli breeds cows and buffalo.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $600 and bought a buffalo.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow.

Fikret is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. 
He has had his business for 5 years.In the beginning of his business he borrowed $600 and bought 6 sheep.
You can see in the picture that he enjoys looking after the sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a horse.
Fikret is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region Kurdmahmudlu  village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.name: Sura

texts.en:
Sura is a very active and responsible person. 4 years ago she decided to start her own business.
Sura is 30 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. She is married and has a child.
This business has allowed her family to have a better income.
Having borrowed $400 she bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of her store.

loans.use: To expand the area of her store

texts.en:
Rose is married but has no children. Her business includes clothing making and designing. She has been in the business since 1990.

This is her second loan from PEMCI, but 1st applied for with Kiva. The 1st Loan of $150 was repaid successfully.

With the help of the first loan, Rose was able to enlarge her business and as a result she needs a second loan so as to meet the increased demand. She also distributes school uniforms to the local schools in her community. With the help of a second loan from PEMCI, Rose intends to increase her stock and make more profits to enable her open a tailoring school as there is none in her home area.

Rose is providing an important service in meeting the clothing and uniform needs of her local community. By buying from her instead of traveling to the nearby towns, the schools and the community are able to save on time and money. Well worth the support of Kiva.

Shola is married and has 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village.
Having borrowed $400 she bought 2 calves.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
This 47-year-old woman has run this business for 5 years.
She is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person.

Isaac is married with four children, all in primary school. In 1996, he started his business which includes selling second-hand clothes. He gets the clothes from Nairobi.

Isaac completed his first loan with Pemci of $159 successfully. He is a committed member of his community-based development group which mobilizes the community for poverty eradication. Through his business, he has been able to sustain his family, buy himself a piece of land, and contribute to the group. He has also gained knowledge and skills. With this second loan of $375 he plans to increase his stock further to take advantage of the growth in his business.

Isaac has a very progressive mind and his success will be an encouragement to his local community, especially the youth and numerous school leavers/dropouts. We believe that by working with individuals like Isaac, Pemci can use them as a development catalyst, thus achieving one of our key goals. Well worth the support of Kiva.

Arif is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Dilagar village. He is married and has 2 children.
He borrowed $600 in order to buy new sort seedlings.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer.

Zipporah is married with nine children, all in school. She completed her first loan of $159 with PEMCI successfully. She is the secretary and a very active member of Tumaini self-help group which is a member of Pemci. She has done a lot to build her team by bringing cohesiveness to the group.

Zipporah ensures that members repay their loans in a timely fashion in order not to jeopardize the group's position. Her business mainly involves selling fish in the local community market. She has been in the business for a number of years and through it, she has been able to help her husband by paying school fees for their 9 children.

With the help of this 2nd loan from PEMCI (1st with Kiva) Zipporah intents to increase her fish stock and to act as a distributor to other small traders. She has been an inspiration to the women in her community through her hard work and determination.

Brictor is about 65, married with eleven children, five of them still in school. She is a peasant with no formal training but has experience in guidance and counseling. She is also an active member of a community-based organization: Korisai.

Brictor is a very active member of Jairos Muungano Self-Help Group, registered with PEMCI. Her 1st loan of $150 was repaid in a timely fashion. With the 2nd loan she has applied for, she plans to increase the stock in her business so as to improve her income levels. With her fish mongering business, she is able to supplement the food of the local community whose diets mainly consist of carbohydrates (sorghum and cassava).

At her age, Brictor is a good role model to the rest of the women who should be engaged economically.

Terlan is 46 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ehmedbeyli village. He is married and has 2 children.
He has a lot of customers because his meat is always fresh.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to build a butcher shop. He plans to improve his business to increase the number of his customers in order to have a better income.
Terlan has been in this business for 4 years.

Tarana has 5 years of experience in this business. 
She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Alkhanli  village. She is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 she bought a meaty bull-calf.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.

Beatrice is a member of Esenyi women's group which is registered with Pemci. This group is composed mainly of people living with HIV/AIDS. It is one of the various groups forming a community-based organization that is supporting and empowering AIDS victims in the area. (PEMCI does not discriminate against people affected by HIV/AIDS; we encourage them to seek financial support that would enable them be active members of their communities rather than depending on hand-outs.)

Beatrice is married with eleven children. She started her business in 1999. With the first loan of $150 from PEMCI, she was able to uplift her business which enabled her complete the small house where she now lives.

As a fishmonger, Beatrice is able to supplement the nutritional needs of the members of her local group and the community at large. She is also a role model to others affected by the AIDS scourge. Well worth Kiva’s support.

Adalat is a father of 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village.
He has been engaged in this business since 2004. Having borrowed $400 he started this business.
He bought tea-pots, chairs, tables. His tea-house is a small and he wants to expand the area of his tea-house.
This 36-year-old man needs a loan of $800 to repair a tea-house.

Y. Erkin is married and has three children. He has dedicated his life to his family business – livestock. He has more than 10 years of experience in this activity. It helps him to feed his family and to help his elder son to study at the Agrarian Institute. Since his business is a sole source of their family income, Erkin would like to expand it (to purchase more hogs). Erkin is also reconstructing their house and homestead. There will be a place not only for his family, but enough place in the yard for his farm.

This young man is 32 years old.He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.
Eldaniz is the sole breadwinner in his family.
In the beginning of his business he did work in home repairs. He did not have enough tools. Then he decided to borrow $600 and bought the necessary tools.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to purchase building materials.
Eldaniz has run this business for 4 years.

N.  Muzaffar is an youngest son of his parents. He already has a family and two children. Muzaffar is a hard working guy. His elder brothers and sisters have their own families and live separately. Muzaffar lives with his parents and has to work a lot and make enough money for his big family. He has been engaged in livestock breeding for over 5 years. He already has experience in receiving loans. Muzaffar used his first loan for fodder. He will use the next loan to purchase two hogs. Muzaffar invests all the profit he makes back into his business.

Margaret is a mother of three children, two boys and a girl. She started her business in 1993 with a capital of five thousand shillings obtained from her husband. Her business includes buying new clothes in bulk and selling them retail. She also buys and sells kerosene. Her clients are mainly people from the neighbouring country of Uganda as her business is situated right at the border, within Malaba township.

With the loan applied for, she plans to increase her stocks of kerosene to meet the ever growing demand from Uganda. (Kerosene prices are lower in Kenya than in Uganda.)

Margaret is an enterprising young woman and worthy of support from Kiva. Note that within the larger East African Community, cross border trade is encouraged as a way of supporting regional trade and growth.

Tariyel has his own grocery store. He has run this business for 2 years. 
Having borrowed $700 he bought foodstuffs. This business has allowed his family to have a better income.
He is very optimistic that his business will succeed.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a refrigerator.
Tariyel is 37 years old, a father of 2 children and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village.

Yulduz lives in village where everyone is engaged in greenhouse-gardening. Yulduz grows saplings and sells them at the market. She has been engaged in this activity for over 8 years. Yulduz says if she had enough capital, she could construct a bigger greenhouse and install better heating. Currently she can only grow young plants in spring. 
Besides, Yulduz has two hogs. She used her fist loan for purchasing one of them and for fodder. Her current request is for reconstructing her greenhouse and the next loan she plans to use for improving its heating system.

Agnes is a single mother of four, three working on their O levels and one in primary school--a very heavy responsibility indeed for a single mother.

Agnes started her business in 1997 with capital from her brothers. Her business is located at the border thus her customers are mostly people from across the border.

Agnes' business is doing well and has enabled her to educate her children. With the $150 from PEMCI, she intents to expand her business. Worth supporting!

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
This 36-year-old man is a miller. He has run this business for 5 years. Elbrus works hard for the success of his children. With this business he meets the needs of his family.
Elbrus is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Mahmudlu  village. He is married and has 3 children.
Having borrowed $600 he bought wheat. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the spare parts for the mill.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for  his mill

texts.en:
Meshuge is a 68 years old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. She is married and has 3 children.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $600 to buy a meaty calf.
The second loan of $800 she spent to buy 2 calves and a heifer. 
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

John is married with three children, all in primary school. He completed his secondary schooling but has not undertaken any formal training.

John started his business in 1999 and meanwhile has employed seven people who work hand-in-hand with him. His business is doing well since it’s located on a busy street. Through his business, he has been able to provide for his family and also provide employment to other people.

With this loan of $450 from PEMCI, John intents to increase his stock and improve his bakery. His clients come from as far as Uganda. The demand for his products is high and we are confident of his ability to service the loan. Worthy of support from Kiva partners.

Kamran is a member of the Hunter Society. He has a hunting dog. This clever dog helps him to hunt.
In the beginning of his business he did not have a dog and it was a big problem for him.
One day he decided to borrow $400 and bought the hunting dog.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a fowling-piece, which is a light shotgun for shooting birds and small animals.Kamran has been in this business for 4 years. He has a license for hunting.
Kamran is 57, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Mahmudlu village He is married and has 2 children.

Mrs Ngoc divorced her husband because he was often drunk and he often hit her. After her divorce, Mrs Ngoc has supported her 4 children. She is very hard working; all her children were young at the time. Mrs Ngoc does not have any land and only a small hut. She sells soft drinks and rice pancakes near the bus station.

Now, two of the children have opened a small tailor shop. She wants to borrow $100 for expanding her sales and to improve her sons' tailor shop. She has repaid 2 loans already, which allowed their income to increase from $8 to a total of $10/person/month.

Fred is a married man with three children who all depend on him. He currently specializes in selling sugar cane, mainly to school children. This small loan will enable him uplift his business.

Fred also plans to diversify into kiosk business to sell sweets and other small kiosk items prefered by school children. We are proud to be associated with this humble beginning and our desire is to see Fred established as a businessman. Well worthy of our support.

This 37-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.
Azer has run this business for 8 years. This car is his own.
He transports loads in his own car.
Having borrowed $600 he bought 2 wheels and 1 accumulator. Now he needs a loan of $800 to repair his car.

This 44-year-old man has 4 years of experience in this business.
Having borrowed $400 he bought fruits.
This business allows him to support his family.
Now he needs a loan of $900 to buy  more agricultural products.
He is optimistic that his business will allow him to help with family expenses.
Rauf is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is marriedand has 3 children.

Sahaddin has 4 years of experience in this business. He has his own cafe. He has many regular clients.He is very communicative person.
Sahaddin is a very good kabob maker.He is 42 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He married and has 3 children.
This business allows Sahaddin to support his family.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy equipment his for cafe.

This 37-year-old woman has 2 years of experience in this business.With this business she meets the needs of her family.
In the beginning of her business Semnara borrowed  $400 and bought 2 calves. Now she requests a loan of $1000 to buy a cow.
Semnara is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the  Fizuli region, Kayidish village. She is  married and has a child.

Rashid is a 36 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.
He has been in this business for 4 years.
He sells cabbages out of his own car.
Having borrowed $400 he started his business.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a new car.
This business allows his family to have a better income.
In order to transport the cabbages he wants to buy a new car, because with his own car to sell the cabbages is uncomfortable.

Zamil is a professional carpenter.
He has run this business for 4 years. He has his own workshop.This business helps to him to cover his family expenses.
Having borrowed $400 he bought raw material.
He saved money and started buying his own personal tools.
He wants to increase the quality of his products.
Zamil has steady clients who order products every day. Now he wants to borrow $1000 to buy a polishing bench.
Zamil has a lot of orders but he doesn't have enough capital to satisfy his clients' needs.
This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region. Ehmedbeyli village. He is married and has a child.

Burzu is a very strong and hard-working person. 4 years ago he started his own business.
He decided to open a cafe in order to support his family.
He wants to improve his business and gain a lot of customers.
Having borrowed $600 he increased food products in order to ensure good service to his clients.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy a stove.
Burzu is 43 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Behmenli village.

loans.name: Ehsen

texts.en:
Ehsen has 4 years of experience in this business. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Mahmudlu village. He is married and has 2 children.
In the beginning of his business he did not have enough money to improve his business.
One day he borrowed $400 and bought equipment for changing tires.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy other equipment to service all types of cars.
This would enable him to improve his busines, increase profits and meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy the equipment for repairing tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her mobile phone and accessories dealership

texts.en: Hello, my name is Martha. My primary activity is making and selling reed baskets. I have been doing this type of work from my home for several years. I have a good client base, and to me, the most important thing is to be able to help my family and generate an income to cover my family’s expenses. My children also help me during their free time.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ondina Margarita

texts.en: Hello, my name is Ondina, and my primary activity is commerce. I own a small grocery store, called “El Milagro” (The Miracle) located in my home. I have been working at this type of job for several years, and it generates income so that I can contribute to covering my family’s expenses. Thanks to this business, I have been able to make some improvements around my house, and this motivates me to keep moving forward.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, butter, flour, dairy products, rice, soft drinks, soap, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ondina

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Orlandina. My occupation is the selling of used clothing and the framing of photographs and paintings. I've been in this line of work for some years now. With the income I've been able to help cover family expenses. Thanks to this business we have improved our family income and achieved a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Orlandina, mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa usada y enmarcado de de fotografia y cuadros decorativos, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de activida, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, gracias a este negocio hemos mejorado nuestro ingreso familiar logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Buy American-style clothing and molding for picture framing.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Maria De Los Milagro

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria de los Milagros. I have been running a small business out of my home for two years, selling used clothing. Hoping to increase my family income, I currently need to provide a little more to my customers, since demand has grown and I don't have the selection to satisfy my clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Maria de los Milagros, mi Actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio en mi casa de habitación de venta de ropa usada, tengo 2 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos familiares, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas ya que la demanda ha crecido y no cuento con el capital para satisfacer mis cliente, necesito mas variedad.

loans.use: Buy a bundle of used clothing and baby clothing.

loans.name: Yovanni Omar

texts.en:
My name is Yovanni Omar S., and I have dedicated myself to the sale of office and school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, chalk and chalk boards, erasers, glue, paper, crayons, markers, staples, staplers and folders. I have been running my business for four years. My son helps me tend to clients. My business is located near the center of the capital and is close to various institutes, private businesses and government buildings. My goal is to increase my inventory and my sales, and with the earning I can feed my family and give my son a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Yovanni Omar S. me dedico a la venta de productos para oficinas y para escuelas como ser cuadernos, lapices tinta y grafito, borradores, papel bond, reglas, engrapadoras, carpetas, marcadores, colores, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, mi ventas son muy buenas ya que estoy ubicado en el centro de la capital y cerca de mi negocio hay varios institutos, empresas privadas y gubernamentales, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mejor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mi hijo.

loans.use: Buy office supplies like notebooks, pencils, chalk and chalk boards, erasers, glue, paper, crayons, markers, staples, staplers, folders, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.en:
My name is Juana V.. I have dedicated myself to selling baby clothes; I also sell plates and cups. I've been running my business for two years. I sell my products at private offices and government buildings, so I have good clients. My goal is to increase my inventory, and with my extra earnings I plan to remodel my house and take care of family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juana V. me dedico a la venta de ropa para bebe, tambien vendo platos y vasos, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en oficinas privadas y gubernamentales, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion asi mismo mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: Buy baby clothing and accessories, plates, cups, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: German

texts.en:
Mr. Lopez is a married father of four, and two of his children work for him at his carpentry shop. The loan will be used to buy tools like hammers, electric saws, etc. that will allow him to complete clients' orders faster and at a higher quality. Another part he plans to invest on reparing his workshop and enlarging it a little, which will allow him to hire another assistant. This is important because it would generate a source of employment in a country where the unemployment rate is very high.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. L. es casado y padre de 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales laboran con el en su taller de carpintería, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas (Martillo, sierras eléctricas, etc.) que le permitirán entregar los pedidos de los clientes en menos tiempo y a la vez con una mayor calidad. Otra parte del crédito la piensa invertir en el acondicionamiento de su taller, piensa agrandarlo un poco y contratar los servicios de otro ayudante, lo cual es muy importante ya que generaría una fuente de empleo en un país donde el índice de desempleo es muy alto.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy tools (hammer, electric saws, etc.) that will permit Mr. Lopez to complete clients' orders faster and at a higher quality at his workshop.

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
My name is Danila A. R., and I have dedicate myself to the production of men's and women's clothing, curtains and tablecloths for three years. My clients are excellent; they like my sowing and also the quality of the fabrics I use to make clothing. My goal is to increase my inventory of fabrics to have a greater variety, so I can make different types of suits and dresses for my clients. With the extra earnings, I can feed my family, give my daughter a good education and can buy another sowing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Danila A. R. me dedico a la produccion de ropa para dama y caballero, cortinas y manteles, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que les gusta como costuro y tambien por la calidad de las telas que utilizo para hacer la ropa. mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de telas para tener una mayor variedad y asi poder hacer diferentes tipos de trajes para mis clientes, con la ganancia que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia, darle un buen estudio a mi hija y poder comprarme otra maquina de costurar.

loans.use: Buy sowing supplies and accessories like fabric, thread, sowing machine belts, an iron, pins, soap to mark the clothing, etc.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.en:
In Mérida, in the state of Yucatán, Juan Manuel has been selling clothing for nine years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while he realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop location and establish himself in Mérida’s market. He is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has been able to show the fruits of his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman.

Juan Manuel needs a loan of $475, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Mérida del estado de Yucatán, desde hace nueve años Juan Manuel se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó vendiendo entre conocidos y amigos, y después de un tiempo se dio cuenta de que tenía muchos clientes, así fue como se decidió a rentar un local y establecerse en el mercado de Mérida. Él es un hombre emprendedor con muchos deseos de superación, su negocio ha podido dar frutos y desea crecer como empresario.

Juan Manuel necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que planea invertir en mercancía para ofrecer un mejor servicio y variedad a sus clientes. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, hoy es tu oportunidad de ayudar, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his clothing shop

texts.en:
Olga Lidia is a very dynamic woman, enterprising, and responsible. She is married and has two young daughters, 6 and 8 years of age. When her second daughter was born, the family expenses grew and her husband Moisés’ salary was no longer sufficient. She decided to start selling cosmetics, which she has been doing for six years. Her orders and number of clients have grown substantially.

Now Olga requires a loan in the amount of $250, which she plans to invest in buying cosmetics to cover the orders from her clients and to continue growing her business. Olga needs your help. She and your family are sincerely thankful to you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga Lidia es una mujer muy activa, emprendedora y responsable, ella es casada, tiene dos pequeñas hijas de 6 y 8 años de edad. Cuando nació su segunda hija, los gastos familiares se incrementaron, el salario de Moisés, su esposo, se volvió insuficiente y ella tomó la decisión de iniciar con la venta de cosméticos, ya son seis años de esto, los pedidos y sus clientes se han multiplicado.

Ahora Olga requiere de un crédito por la cantidad de $250 dólares que planea invertir en la compra de cosméticos para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, Olga necesita de tu ayuda, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.en:
My name is Maria S. and I have dedicated myself to the sale of all types of undergarments for men, women and children for the past four years. My clients are excellent; they like the quality of my product and, above all, the price. My goal is to increase my inventory so I can have more sales, and with the extra earnings I can remodel my house and put in a little shop with shelfs and a display window and run my business from there. The money will also help me feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria S. me dedico a la venta de todo tipo de ropa interior para dama, caballero y niños, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto y sobre todo el precio de venta. mi meta es increntar mis inventarios para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion para hacer una pequeña tienda para vender mi producto, comprar una vitrina y estantes, tambien alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: Buy undergarments for men, women and children.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
My name is Perla V. and I have dedicated myself to the selling of women's dress shoes and tennis shoes for around two years. My clients are excellent, and I also sell my product to little schoolgirls. My goal is to increase my inventory so I can sell more of my product, and with the extra earning I can feed my family and give my children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Perla V. me dedico a la venta de zapatos y tennis para dama, tengo mi negocio hace unmos 2 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que mi producto lo vendo para jovencitas que asisten al colegio, mi meta es incremetar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de mi producto y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darles estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: Buy women's dress shoes and tennis shoes.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
Gabriela began selling cosmetics because of her family’s economic need and also because she enjoys sales. Gabriela is married and has one 12 year-old son and one10 year-old daughter. Her husband is a waiter, however his salary isn’t enough to cover all the family’s expenses. Therefore, Gabriela began her sales two years ago. In order to cover the orders from her clients and to offer better service, Gabriela needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use toward those ends.

It has been difficult for Gabriela and her family to overcome obstacles to her children having a better education and a better life, but Gabriela is willing to work harder for this each day. Your generosity could be of great help to this family, and they would be very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La necesidad económica de la familia y el gusto por las ventas hicieron que Gabriela se dedicara a la venta de cosméticos, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años y una hija de 10. Su esposo es mesero, sin embargo, el salario que recibe no alcanza a cubrir todos los gastos de su familia y hace dos años Gabriela comenzó con las ventas. Para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio Gabriela necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará con este fin.

Ha sido difícil para Gabriela y su familia superar todos los obstáculos para que sus hijas puedan tener una buena educación y una mejor vida, pero Gabriela está dispuesta a seguir esforzándose cada día más. Tú generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Emilia began selling fruits and vegetables 30 years ago. She began as a street vendor, but when she became a widow and had four children to provide for, she got a place in the market to be able to increase her sales and her income. She has had to work very hard in order to get ahead because she wants to offer her children a better quality of life. Now she needs a loan of $475, which she will use to buy inventory to stock her business.

The challenges that life has given Emilia have not been easy, but she knows that with strength of family and your help, they can be overcome. You can be an important part of Emilia’s and her family’s achievements. Today is the time to help, you can do it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 30 años Emilia se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, inició con la venta ambulante de estos producto, pero al quedar viuda con cuatro hijos que sostener, consiguió un local en el mercado para poder incrementar sus ventas y su ingreso, ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos porque quiere ofrecerles una mejor calidad vida. Ahora ella necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio.

No han sido fáciles los retos que la vida le ha dado a Emilia, pero ella sabe que con la unión familiar y tu ayuda pueden ser superados, tú puedes ser parte importante de los logros de Emilia y su familia, hoy es momento de ayudar, tú puedes hacerlo.

Nidia is from Mérida, in the state of Yucatán. She is married and has a 13 year-old daughter and a 15 year-old son. A lack of economic resources motivated Nidia to sell cosmetics. Her husband Roberto’s income as a farm worker is not enough to sustain the family. Nidia’s number of clients has multiplied and she has put much effort into making this business show results. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to fill the orders she has.

You can help this family. Nidia wants her children to continue studying and she works arduously so that this can be a reality. She and her family need your support, they sincerely appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Nidia es originaria de Mérida, del estado de Yucatán. Es casada y tiene una hija de 13 años y un hijo de 15. La falta de recursos económicos impulsó a Nidia a vender cosméticos, debido a que el ingreso que Roberto, su esposo, recibe como empleado en una granja es insuficiente para el sustento de su familia. Los clientes que Nidia tiene se han multiplicado y ella ha puesto mucho empeño en que este negocio le de frutos, por lo que ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizara para surtir los pedidos que tiene.

Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, Nidia quiere que sus hijos continúen estudiando, y trabaja arduamente para que esto pueda ser real, ella y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en:
Rosa María is married and has a 14 year-old daughter. She has been selling clothes for 35 years, and she has worked hard to help her family and to be able to offer a better quality of life to her daughter. Lately she has gone through some economic problems and wants to continue selling her products. She needs a loan of in the amount of $250, which she plans to invest in buying inventory. She is sure she can make it with her business, which is why she plans to repay the loan over a period of three to six months.

Your generosity and collaboration can help this family get ahead. Today is the time to help someone who really needs it. María needs your support, don’t let this moment go by, decide to help her out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa María es casada y tiene una hija de 14 años, desde hace 35 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, y se ha esforzado mucho para ayudar a su familia y poder ofrecerle una vida de calida a su hija. Últimamente atraviesa por problemas económicos y quiere continuar con la venta de sus productos, ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que planea invertir en la compra de mercancía, ella confía en salir adelante con su negocio, por lo que planea devolver el préstamo en un lapso de tres a seis meses.

Tú generosidad y cariño puedes hacer que esta familia pueda salir adelante, hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, María necesita de tu apoyo, no dejes pasar este momento y decídete.

loans.use: To buy inventory for clothing sales

texts.en:
Nelly is 21, she is a single mom with two kids. The only income she can get to support her family and to pay for her house is by selling shoes. She is an enterprising young woman and she is completely devoted to her work; the well being of her two children is very important and this is why she works so hard every single day. To expand her business and be able to meet her clients' demands, Norma needs a $250 loan.

It is in your hands to help Norma and her children get ahead; she will put her best effort and is confident she will be able to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months. Don't hesitate any longer, her family and her need you.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Nelly tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos pequeños hijos, la venta de zapatos representa el único sustento para su familia y para el pago de su casa. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se dedica por completo a su trabajo, para ella es muy importante el bienestar de sus hijos y es por eso que se esfuerza tanto cada día. Para hacer crecer su negocio y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, Norma necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará con este fin.

En tus manos está el poder ayudar a Norma a sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella dará su mayor esfuerzo y confía en devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. No lo dudes más, ella y su familia te necesitan.

Verónica is 26 years old and has 2 small children. Because of her marriage break-up and the lack of sufficient income to support her family, Verónica began to sell shoes through catalogs. This work is very important for her because she can get ahead with her family. Now, Verónica needs a $250 loan to supply the demand of her clients and to make her business grow. This way, she'll be able to support her family.

Vero trusts the people who help those in need. She is willing to work very hard to improve the well-being of her family and her business. It is the moment to help, she is sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Verónica tiene 26 años de edad, y es madre de dos pequeños hijos, la ruptura de su matrimonio y la falta de recursos necesarios para el sostén de su familia hizo que Vero comenzara con la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Para ella es muy necesario su trabajo, pues gracias a el pueden salir adelante con su familia. Ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares para surtir pedidos de sus clientes y poder hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera apoyar a su familia.

Vero confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita. Ella está dispuesta a trabajar arduamente para mejorar el bienestar de su familia y de su negocio. Es momento de ayudar, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

Silvia began selling accessories for babies 6 years ago, because sometimes her husband's business didn't do so well, and he couldn't bring home enough money to cover all the family's expenses. She has 2 daughters who are in University and she would like to see them finish their studies. The income Silvia earns goes to her daughters' University expenses. Now, she needs a $250 loan, which she'll use to buy more merchandise, offer her clients more variety, and to generate more income.

You can help this family assisting the growth of Silvia's business. Be an important part of her and her family's achievements. They need your support and love and are sincerely thankful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Silvia inició con la venta de accesorios para bebé desde hace seis años, porque a su esposo en ocasiones no le iba bien con su negocio, y no conseguía los recursos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Ella tiene dos hijas que actualmente estudian en la universidad, Silvia desea que ellas puedan terminar sus estudios y el ingreso que ella obtiene de sus ventas lo utilizan con este fin. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares con los que incrementará sus productos, para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad y obtener mayores ingresos.

Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, puedes colaborar al crecimiento de este negocio, sé parte importante en los logros de Silvia y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu apoyo y cariño y agradecen sinceramente tu generosidad

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

texts.en:
4 years ago, Maria Rafaela started to sell natural products because her husband had to retire, and the pension he was receiving was very low. This caused serious economic problems for them, and María's income became very important: it is now their means of support. Now, she needs a $250 loan to buy merchandise and make her business grow.

María has worked very hard to help with the family's expenses. She is a very active and responsible woman, and is certain that she will be able to return the loan within 3 to 6 months. She is thankful for your sincere support. Helping her is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Hace cuatro años que Maria Rafaela inició con la venta de productos naturistas, fue cuando su esposo se quedó sin trabajo, por ser una persona mayor, lo jubilaron y la baja pensión que recibía, hizo que su hogar tuviera serios problemas económicos. Fue así como el ingreso que Maria recibía por la venta de sus productos se volvió muy importante, pues este representa el sostén para su familia. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que planea utilizar en compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

La señora Maria ha trabajado muy duro para poder contribuir con los gastos familiares, ella es una mujer muy activa y responsable y confía en devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses, y agradece sinceramente tu apoyo, en tus manos está el ayudar, hazlo.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

texts.en:
Laura Alicia is a young woman. She is single and has two sons. She used to work at a factory, but that way she had to be away from her sons for long periods of time and her income was very low; this is why Laura decided to start selling shoes. This activity has allowed her to take care of her sons and to earn a higher income. Laura is a very active woman and lately, she has seen an increase in her number of clients. Laura needs a $200 loan to keep pace with the growing demand and to grow as a micro entrepreneur.

One of her sons has started school and her expenditures have increased. She is willing to work very hard to get her family ahead and you can help Laura with this. With your support, she will be able to achieve great things. She and her family will be thankful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Laura Alicia es una mujer joven que tiene dos hijos, ella es soltera y anteriormente laboraba en una fábrica, pero tenía que dejar a sus hijos por mucho tiempo y el ingreso que le retribuían era muy bajo, fue así como se decidió a vender zapatos, esta actividad le ha permitido cuidar a sus hijos y obtener un mayor ingreso. Laura es una mujer muy activa, y el número D. sus clientes se ha incrementado últimamente, ella necesita D. un crédito por la cantidad D. $ 200 dólares que utilizara para cubrir los pedidos D. sus clientes y para crecer como microempresaria.

Uno D. sus hijos ya empezó la escuela y los gastos para Laura se han aumentado, ella está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para poder sacar adelante a su familia, tú puedes ayudar a Laura, con tu apoyo ella podrá hacer grandes cosas, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Seven years ago, María Teresa's husband lost his job and because there was a lack of employment in the country, it was very hard for him to find a new one. They have 3 children, 2 of which were attending high school, but they didn't have the means to continue their education. María then decided to open a workshop and become a seamstress. She began to post a few ads around and that's how she started to have clients. Her family was able to make ends meet. She was then able to buy an industrial sewing machine ad now she sews school and secretary uniforms. The number of clients increased so she had hire someone to help her with work.

María Teresa needs a $200 loan to buy rolls of fabric to make summer clothes, and she wishes to see her business grow. You can be an important part and contribute to the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Hace siete años, el esposo de la señora Maria Teresa se quedó sin trabajo y debido a la falta de empleo del país le fue muy difícil conseguir un lugar para laborar, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la preparatoria y no contaban con recursos para pagar sus colegiaturas. Ante esta situación Maria inició su negocio como costurera, comenzó colocando anuncios en las colonias y así obtuvo clientes, de esta manera fue como su familia logró salir adelante. Después le fue posible comprar una máquina de coser industrial y ahora cose uniformes escolares y secretariales, y debido a la gran demanda consiguió a una persona que le ayude a maquilar.

Maria Teresa necesita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizara para la compra de rollos de tela para maquilar ropa de verano, ella tiene enormes deseos de crecer. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental y contribuir con el crecimiento de este negocio.

Two years ago, Patricia began to sell home decoration products so she could support her family, since her husband's income was not enough to cover the family's expenditures. Patricia is a hard-working and active woman, and she would like to offer her children a better quality of life. One of her daughters is currently attending college, so Patricia's income goes to her college expenses.

Lately, Patricia has seen an increase in her number of clients, and she needs a $200 loan to buy merchandise so she can provide a greater variety of products for her clients. It is in your hands to help Patricia, don't hesitate any longer, she'll be sincerely thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Patricia inició con la venta de productos decorativos para el hogar desde hace dos años, como una manera de apoyar a su familia porque el ingreso que recibía su esposo resultaba insuficiente para todos los gastos familiares. Patricia es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, y quiere ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, actualmente una de sus hijas estudia en la universidad y con el ingreso que Paty obtiene le ayuda a pagar sus colegiaturas.

Últimamente se han incrementado los clientes de Patricia y ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 dólares que planea utilizar para la compra de mercancía, y poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. En tus manos está el poder ayudar, no lo dudes más, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
It has been 15 years since Maricela began selling groceries and hardware. She is single and has two children. She saw the necessity of starting her own business so she could take care of her children and to earn what she would need to support her family. She began with three crates of sodas and very few products, but her business has been growing. She now needs a loan of $250, which she will use to buy more products to offer a better variety to her clients and make her business grow.

Maricela has experienced difficulties, but with the help of her sons she has been able to overcome them. Now they need your help. Your generosity can contribute to the growth of this business and improve life for Maricela and her family. Don’t spend more time thinking about it, decide to help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años que la señora Maricela se dedica a las ventas de abarrotes, ella es soltera y tiene a su cargo a dos hijos, se vio en la necesidad de crear su propio negocio para no descuidar a sus hijos, y poder obtener los recursos que necesita para el sostén de su familia, ella inició con tres cajas de refresco y muy pocos productos, pero su negocio ha ido creciendo y actualmente requiere de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleara en la compra de más productos para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Maricela ha pasado pruebas difíciles pero con la ayuda de sus hijos ha podido superarlas, ahora ellos necesitan de tu apoyo, tu generosidad puede contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y para mejorar la vida de Maricela y su familia, no lo pienses más, y decídete a ayudar.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

texts.en:
Leticia is married and has two small children. Two years ago her husband lost his job and the expenses began to accumulate. This motivated Leticia to begin selling hamburgers and sweets from her home. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to buy a grill that she needs to make her hamburgers. This will help her to increase her sales and offer better service to her customers.

One of her children suffers from bronchial asthma and the medication he needs is expensive. Leticia is willing to work as hard as she can in order to help her son. You can contribute to Leticia’s being able to continue to work. This family needs your generosity, help them out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Leticia es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, hace dos años su esposo se quedó sin empleo y los gastos se empezaron a acumular, esto motivó a Leticia para empezar con la venta de hamburguesas y dulces en su propio domicilio. Ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizara para la compra de una parrilla que requiere para la elaboración de sus hamburguesas, esto le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Uno de sus hijos padece asma bronquial y el medicamento que necesita es caro, Leticia esta dispuesta a esforzarse lo necesario para poder ayudar a su hijo. Tú puedes contribuir a que Leticia siga trabajando, esta familia necesita de tu generosidad, ayúdalos.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Lidia Maricela

texts.en:
Lidia Maricela is the single mother of a small child. She studied design and sewing and started out working for someone else. However, in order to take care of her son, she got together the money to buy a sewing machine and opened her own business. She now has three industrial sewing machines and requires the help of another person in order to make school uniforms. Lidia’s business has grown, as has her number of clients. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $925, which she will use to buy rolls of fabric to make sports uniforms.

Become an important part of the growth of this business. Lidia has worked hard for what she has and now she needs your collaboration. You can do it, have no doubt.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia Maricela es madre soltera de un pequeño hijo, ella estudio diseño y costura e inició trabajando para alguien más, pero para no descuidar a su hijo, juntó dinero para comprarse una máquina de coser y así poder abrir su propio negocio, ahora ya son tres las máquinas industriales que tiene y requiere de la ayuda de otra persona para la elaboración de uniformes escolares. El negocio de Lidia ha crecido y sus clientes, ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $925 dólares que empleara en la compra de rollos de tela para la elaboración de uniformes deportivos.

Conviértete en parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Lidia se ha esforzado mucho para que esto pueda ser real, ahora necesita de tu colaboración, tú puedes hacerlo, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make sports uniforms

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Doris Patricia

texts.en: Hello, my name is Doris, and my primary activity is the small grocery store I run from my house. I have been working at this type for job for several years, and the income it generates helps me be able to cover my household expenses. Most importantly, working at home allows me to take care of my children. Recently, sales have increased, and I need to stock my inventory so that I can offer a variety of products to my customers.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, butter, rice, ice, soap, disposable diapers, dairy products and deli meats, etc.

texts.en:
Anibal is married and has two girls. One of them is two-and-a-half years old and the other is three months. He began in the business of selling chicken four years ago. With time he has begun to offer a larger variety of foods, though his main product continues to be roasted chicken. The reason he started working in this was that his father died and at that point he had to take charge of the business. Also, he was newly married and had to take care of his wife and his mother. Anibal is from San Juanito in Chihuahua, and he and his wife work together to tend the business.

Little by little the business has been growing and this is why Anibal is requesting a loan of $1,200.00. He will remodel his store and buy a bigger roaster, which will help him to keep pace with the growing demand and provide better service to his customers. Anibal hopes to improve his business each day so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family and education for his little girls. He offers to repay this loan over a period of 6 to 12 months and is counting on your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Anibal es un hombre casado y tiene 2 niñas, una de ellas de 2 años y medio y la otra de 3 meses. Se inició en el negocio de la venta de pollo hace cuatro años y con el tiempo empezó a ofrecer mayor variedad de comidas, manteniendo su principal producto la venta de pollo asado. El motivo de emprender en este negocio fue debido a que su padre falleció y en ese momento el tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio, además de que en ese momento el se había casado recientemente y tuvo que ver por su esposa y su madre. Anibal es originario de San Juanito en Chihuahua, y junto con su esposa atienden el negocio.

Poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y por ello es que Anibal esta solicitando de un préstamo de US $ 1,200 para remodelar su local y comprar un asador más grande que le permita cubrir la demanda creciente con la que cuenta y brindar mejor servicio a su clientela. Anibal espera mejorar cada día con su negocio y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y educación a sus pequeñas niñas. Él ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y cuenta con su ayuda.

loans.name: Jesús Elías

texts.en:
Jesús lives in San Juanito, Chihuahua and has an electronics and appliances repair business. He is married and has 4 children, who are 26, 23, 17, and 9 years old, and whom he has to provide for and give an education to, so that they can have a better future. His wife works as a hair stylist, since both of them have to work to provide for the family. He began his business due to the fact that he couldn’t find work. Because of this, he rented a small shop space and began fixing appliances. Little by little, he began to fix a variety of appliances and electronics and since demand for his work has grown, he now also buys and sells some of these items.

Jesús is requesting a loan of $475 to buy inventory to continue growing his business. He also wants to buy replacement parts that will serve to repair appliances and electronics. He expects to pay back the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months and he needs your support to maintain and continue his growth and to realize his dream of seeing his four children educated so that they can live a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús vive en San Juanito, Chihuahua, y tiene el negocio de arreglo de aparatos electrónicos. Esta casado y tiene 4 hijos de 26 años, 23 años, 17 años y el menor de 9 años, a quienes tiene que mantener y darles educación para que tengan un mejor futuro. La esposa de Jesús trabaja como estilista, ya que ambos tienen que trabajar para poder con la manutención de su familia, él empezó con su negocio debido a que no encontraba trabajo, por lo que, lo primero que hizo fue rentar un pequeño local y arreglando aparatos electrodomésticos pequeños y poco a poco empezó a arreglar diversos tipos de aparatos eléctricos y como fue incrementándose su demanda actualmente también compra y vende algunos de estos aparatos.

Jesús esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para comprar mercancía y continuar incrementando su negocio y también invertir parte del préstamo en comprar piezas que le sirvan para poder reparar estos artículos. Espera pagar el crédito en un período de 3 a 6 meses y necesita de su apoyo para poder mantener, continuar su crecimiento y realizar sus sueños de ver educados a sus 4 hijos llevando una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy inventory and repair parts for electronics and appliances

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is married and has two children; one is 5 years old and the youngest is 6 months old. His wife is a teacher. Ismael is in the business of making furniture, which is a family tradition. His grandfather started making furniture, and it has been passed down through the generations, continuing with his father and now with Ismael. The need for a source of income, and the fact that he liked learning this occupation, were what motivated Ismael to dedicate himself to this livelihood, in addition to the need to help out with family expenses. He makes all kind of furniture and has a lot of knowledge about this trade since he began in 1997.

Ismael is in need of a loan of $750.00 to buy tools that will allow him to improve the quality of his work and help him to increase his production, and therefore improve his business and number of clients. Ismael promises to pay back the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. He is very excited to know that people with good hearts will help him improve his situation and that of his family and he is grateful to you all.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ismael esta casado y tiene dos hijos uno de 5 años y el menor de 6 meses de edad, su esposa trabaja de maestra. El negocio de Ismael es la elaboración de muebles, el cual es una herencia familiar, ya que su familia conocía este oficio desde su abuelo y se mantuvo en generaciones, continuando con su padre y ahora Ismael. La necesidad de tener un ingreso y el gusto que tenía por aprender este oficio fue lo que llevo a Ismael a dedicarse a este oficio sumando la necesidad de colaborar en los gastos familiares. Los muebles que elabora son de todo tipo y tiene mucho conocimiento de este oficio debido a que empezó en el en 1,997.

Ismael esta requiriendo de un préstamo por US $ 750 para la compra de herramientas que le permitan mejorar aún la calidad de los trabajos que realiza e incrementar su producción, por ende su negocio y clientes. Ismael promete pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses y esta muy emocionado por saber que personas de buen corazón lo van a ayudar a mejorar su situación y la de su familia y se los agradece.

loans.use: To buy tools for his carpentry shop

loans.name: José Luís

texts.en:
José Luís is from Michoacán. He is married and has 3 children, who are 22, 17, and 15 years old. He moved to San Juanito, Chihuahua due to the fact that he was very poor and didn’t have a job. He was invited to move to a different city and he accepted, since he didn’t have much education and he needed to work in order to feed his family. His wife works as a store manager and José Luís began working as an assistant in a carpentry shop with some friends. However, he was paid very little for his work. Since he was doing all the work, he saved up the small amount he was able to and opened his own business. It grew, little by little, and he was able to improve his situation.

Now José Luís is requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to buy materials to make furniture, and wood, which is the raw material for the furniture. During the last four years, the work he does has been in high demand by the people who visit the Tarahumara Mountains in Chihuahua. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. He knows that with it his business will continue to grow and he will be able to give an education to his children. José Luís hopes for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

José Luís es originario de Michoacán, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos de 22 años, 17 años y el menor de 15 años, se mudo a San Juanito, Chihuahua, debido a que era muy pobre y no tenía trabajo, así que lo invitaron a cambiarse de ciudad y él acepto, ya que como José Luís no tenía estudios y necesitaba trabajar para poder darles de comer a su familia. Su esposa trabaja como encargada de una tienda y José Luís empezó como ayudante en un taller de carpintería con unos compañeros pero le pagaban muy poco por sus trabajos siendo él quien hacía todo el trabajo, entonces con lo poco que pudo ahorrar abrió su propio negocio el cual fue creciendo poco a poco y mejorando su situación.

Ahora José Luís esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,200 para comprar materiales para la elaboración de muebles y madera que es su materia prima en los mismos, ya que el trabajo que realiza desde ya hace cuatro años es muy demandado por las personas que visitan la sierra taraumara en Chihuahua. Este préstamo lo pagará en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses y sabe que con él podrá seguir continuar creciendo y brindarles educación a sus hijos, José Luís espera de su apoyo.

loans.use: To buy materials for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Gladiz Isabel

texts.en: My name is Gladiz Isabel and my primary activity is commerce. I have a grocery store in my home in the center of my community. I have been doing this type of work for several years, and it generates income to cover my family expenses and other commitments I have to my providers. My business is very important to me since I use the profits earned to pay for my children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages, coffee, sugar, butter, candy, rice, dairy products, deli meats and soap.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.en:
María is separated from her husband and cares for five children, who are 28, 27, 22, 18, and 8 years old. She began with her business when she separated from her husband because her children were studying and she didn’t have any way to continue educating them. It was for them that she decided to open a small business with the help of one of her children, who had begun working and was able to give her his small savings so that she could rent a shop where she could sell sweets. Little by little, things went well and her business began to grow. At the request of her clients, she began selling more things for children’s parties, like disposable items, piñatas, etc.

María is requesting a lon of $925.00 in order to buy inventory and stock her business, which is growing. This way she can satisfy her clients and keep them. She offers to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. María hopes for your collaboration and support so that she can continue supporting her five children and give them an education. She is grateful to everyone for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta separada de su esposo y tiene a su cargo 5 hijos de 28 años, 27 años, 22 años, 18 años y 8 años; Ella empezó con el negocio cuando se separo de su esposo debido a que sus hijos estaban estudiando y no tenía los medio para continuar educándolos por ello es que decidió abrir un pequeño negocio con ayuda de uno de sus hijos el cual empezó a trabajar y le dio un pequeño ahorro que tenía para poder rentar un local en donde ella pudiera vender dulces. Poco a poco con el tiempo le fue yendo bien y su negocio comenzó a crecer y a pedido de sus clientes ella fue vendiendo más artículos que iban de acuerdo a fiestas infantiles como artículos desechables, piñatas, etc.

María esta solicitando un crédito de US $ 925 para comprar mercancía y surtir su negocio que va creciendo y así satisfacer a sus clientes y mantenerlos, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. María espera su colaboración y apoyo para poder seguir manteniendo a sus 5 hijos y brindarles educación, ella agradece a todas las personas por su ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Yohilda

texts.en:
Yohilda is married and has three children who are 15, 14, and 9 years old and are studying. She began her business because her husband’s income wasn’t sufficient to support and educate their three children. Since the children are growing, the family’s expenses are increasing. So, four years ago she decided to sell chicken. Over time, her customers began wanting her to sell pork, so she began selling pork as well. From experience she knows that there are periods when demand for meat sales increase and times when it decreases. Since people don’t eat meat right now, during Holy Week, she saw the opportunity to sell seafood and therefore not lose her customers.

Yohilda is requesting a loan of $425 to buy seafood for the period of Holy Week. She offers to pay it back over a period of 6 to 12 months. She hopes for your help soon, since the holiday period is very near and she wants to be ready to attend to her customers and satisfy the demand. Yohilda is very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Yohilda esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15 años, 14 años y 9 años que se encuentran estudiando. Empezó con su negocio debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes para mantener y educar a sus 3 hijos, quienes van creciendo y por lo tanto sus gastos se incrementan, por lo que decidió 4 años atrás a vender pollos, con el tiempo sus clientes le fueron demandando la venta de puerco y ella entonces también incursionó en la venta de puerco, así ella con la experiencia que tiene sabe en que temporadas se incrementa más sus ventas de las carnes que vende por lo que ahora en semana santa la gente no come carne, vio la oportunidad de vender mariscos y así no perder a sus clientes y satisfacerlos.

Yohilda esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 425 para la compra de mariscos para esta temporada, monto que ofrece pagar en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, espera su pronto apoyo, ya que la temporada esta muy cerca de empezar y quisiera estar lista para atender y satisfacer su demanda. Yohilda está muy agradecida por su apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase seafood for her restaurant

loans.name: Grime Pastora

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Grime Pastora, I am a merchant and I have a small grocery store in my home. I have several years of experience running my business, which creates enough income to cover family expenses and other obligations. At this moment, I need to stock a little more in order to offer a wider variety of products to my customers as these types of businesses attract more costumers when there is more to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre es Grime Pastora, soy comerciante, tengo una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitacion, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis cliente ya que estos negocios atraen mas la clientela cuanta se ven mas surtidos.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, rice, sugar, butter, sodas, flour, sausages, juices, sweets, whole milk and other items.

loans.name: Melbin Homar

texts.en:
My name is Melvin Homar, I work primarily as a merchant and I have a store from which I sell plastics items and various other items.
