I have several years experience in my business, which creates enough earnings to cover family expenses and other obligations I have with my suppliers. The location of my store is strategic because many people circulate in the area but because of a lack of capital, I am unable to stock my business to offer a wider variety of products to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Melvin Homar, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de plasticos y achineraia, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con proveedores, la ubicación de mi negocio es estrategica ya que a diario circula muchas personas y por falta de capital no me es posible surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a los clientes.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, bathroom sandals, women's shoes, various plastic products and popular Medinas

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
My name is Maria S. and I sell new clothing for men and women such as dresses, blouses, shirts, dress-shirts, underwear, bras, and socks. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel because they know I sell my products for a reasonable price. My goal is to increase my stock and to have higher sales and with the additional earnings I can help feed my family and to give a good education to my children who are ready to begin high school.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Maria S. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama y caballero como ser vestidos, blusas, camisetas, camisas de vestir, blumers, sostenes, calzoncillos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo a un precio accesible para mi comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos que estan por ingresar al colegio.

loans.use: To purchase dress clothing and underwear for men and women.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ana Eduvigues

texts.en:
My name is Ana A. and I sell breakfasts, lunches and snacks such as tacos, tortillas with cheese, bread with beans, Honduran tacos, burritos, and enchiladas. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because I am located near a bus station. My goal is to expand my stock because as of now I cannot meet the needs of my customers, and also to have higher sales and with the earnings I make I will remodel my store, buy tables and seats, but most importantly, feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas como ser tacos, tortillas con quesillo, pan con frijoles, baleadas, burritas, enchiladas. tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi negocio esta ubicado cerca de una estacion de buses, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios porque no cubro con las necesidades de todos mis clientes, asi mismo tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, comprar mas mesas y sillas y lo mas importante alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase tortillas, cheese, butter, beans, bread, chicken and pork, tomatoe sauce, vegetables, sodas

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
My name is Mauro Z. and I drive people by taxi. I have had my business for 3 years and I have an excellent clientel because I am located at a taxi stop by the National University of Honduras. My goal is to repair my taxi so I can give a better service to my customers and they can sit comfortably while I drive them. With the additional earnings I make I will buy auto-parts in order to repair my taxi myself and to feed my family and to give a private education to my son.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Mauro Z. me dedico a transportar personas en mi taxi tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que estoy ubicado en un punto de taxis de la universidad nacional de honduras, mi meta es arreglar mi taxi para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes que se sientan comodos cuando los transporto, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar repuestos para arreglar mi taxi asi mismo alimentar mi familia y darle un buen estudio privado a mi hijo.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Braulio Ramon

texts.en:
My name is Braulio R. and I am a welder, I also make doors for the home, and iron gates. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientele who appreciate the quality of my work. I intend to remodel my business with the additional earnings I make, buy myself a new welder and most importantly, to buy food for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Braulio R. me dedico a la soldadura, tambien hago portones, puertas de hierro, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de mi trabajo, mis intenciones con las ganancias que obtenga son poder remodelar mi negocio, comprarme una soldadora nueva y lo mas importante de todo llevar el alimento a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase iron, fences to weld, plates, laminates.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Benita Obex

texts.en:
My name is Benita G. and I make and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 4 years and I have the help of my daughters in the production and distribution of my product. My clientel is good as I distribute my tortillas in different markets in our area as well as grocery stores and we also make tortillas by order for reunions and parties. My goal is to increase my sales and with the earnings I make, hire another person to help us with production, as well as be able to feed my family and give a good education to my daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Benita G. me dedido a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para la produccion y reparticion de mi producto, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que rapartimos mi productos en diferentes mercaditos y pulperias que estan cerca de nuestra localidad, tambien producimos para reuniones y fiestas, mi meta es incrementar mi volumen de venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder contratar una persona para que nos ayude con la produccion de mi producto asi mismo poder alimentar a mi familia y darles un buen estudio a mis hijas.

loans.use: To purchase corn flour, lime, salt, firewood, matches and coal.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Alma Georgina

texts.en:
I have had my business for 5 years, selling food I make myself to my community. My store is installed during the afternoons outside of my home, and I have a good location on a street that is heavily trafficked. By having it near my home I have the opportunity to watch for and care for my children. I know that I can earn more if I invest more capital and by doing so, improving our standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Me dedico desde hace cinco años a la venta de comidad que yo misma preparo. Mi negocio lo instalo por las tardes fuera de mi casa, ya que tiene buena ubicacion y esta calle es bastante transitada. Por tenerlo frente a mi casa me da la oportunidad de cuidar a mis hijos y atenderlos. Se que puedo lograr mas si invierto mas capital asi voy a mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase tortillas, cheese, meat, potatoes, condiments, butter and other items.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.en:
My name is Sandra V. and I sell used clothing for men and women. I have had my business for one year and I have an excellent clientel because I sell my clothing at reasonable prices. My goal is to increase sales and with the earnings, I will be able to put a small store in my home, to buy shop windows and shelfs as well as be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es sandra V. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada para dama y caballero, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mis clientes son excelentes ya que vendo mi ropa a un precio muy accesible para nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder poner una pequeña tiendita en mi casa de habitacion, comprar vitrinas y estantes asi mismo darles el alimento a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Evy Enrique

texts.en:
My name is Evy A. and I make doors for the home, gates and balconies from iron. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clintel because they know I offer them a high quality product at a low cost. My goal is to increase production and sales in order to remodel the area where I work(my home) and to buy new machinery but most importantly, to be able to feed all my family on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Evy A. me dedico a la producciones de portones, puertas y balcones de hierro, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les ofrezco un producto con muy buena calidad y un bajo costo, mi meta es tener mayor produccion y ventas para poder remodelar mi lugar de trabajo (casa de habitacion) y comprarme nueva maquinaria y lo mas importante de todo darles el alimento diario a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase iron, plates, laminates and bars to weld.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.en: I have worked selling clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, household goods, etcetera for four years. Through the years I have established a fixed clientele that comes to me to order any appliance or personal items they need. With my income I have been able to support my children and help them throught school. Now I would like to invest in clothing since I have very little and need to satisfy my clients’ needs.

loans.use: Purchase of body creams, lotions, stockings, underwear, tanners, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Brenda Yamileth

texts.en: My name is Brenda Z. and I have been making and selling baked goods such as pies, cakes, pastries and quesadillas for three years. My clients are very good since I distribute my product to small supermarkets and grocery stores. I also do special orders for meetings, parties, birthdays and weddings. My goal is to increase production to increase sales. With the earnings I would be able to hire someone to help me with production as well as pay for private schooling for my daughter and feed my family.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, salt, food coloring, artificial flavors, sugar, eggs, butter, oil, milk and water.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Roberto Orlando

texts.en: My name is Roberto R. and I have been selling parts for and repairing sewing machines for three years. I have great clients from the tailor near my house and from the surrounding area. My goal is to increase my parts inventory, and with the profits I will be able to feed my family.

loans.use: Purchase of thread, needles, oil, bands, spools of wool, sewing machine motors, pins, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: My name is Jorge C. and I have been selling dairy products for 3 years. I have a great clientele who loves the taste of my product. My goal is to increase my inventory to improve my sales. With the profits I will be able to feed my family and help my grandson who is about to start school.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese, butter, cream cheese, cottage cheese, curd cheese, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter has worked in markets since he was 15 when he helped his aunt out in her store. Once he was older he decided to start his own business with the help of his father and a brother. After working for several years with his brother, Wilmer decided to start a bakery on his own. He used the money he had saved from his previous business and a loan he received from his father to get things going. He is now very happy to have a business of his own. He is very dedicated to the enterprise as he often works from 6 am until 10 pm. His wife also contributes greatly to the business.

Wilter is requesting a loan because he wants to begin selling beverages. He would like to upgrade his refrigerator and also make some other improvements to the business.

Wilter is 25 years old, is married and has one son who is in school. Thanks to hard work and a successful business, he owns his home and his bakery. With the extra profits he plans to make improvements to his house and possibly his business.

loans.use: Begin selling soft drinks, juices and other beverages

texts.en:
Mr. P. has plans to grow his business. He aims to improve his business and establish a strong reputation in his neighborhood. His dream is to someday grow from a general store to a mini grocery store. He says, "My objective is to progress in the business and in the future, transform this general store into something greater. I am asking for A $1000 loan to buy merchandise in bulk."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. P. tiene planes para la ampliación de su negocio su inquietud es cada vez mejorar sus ventas y lograr cierto reconocimiento dentro del sector donde habita, su ilusión es algún día convertir su tienda de abarrotes en un mini súper. "Mi objetivo es progresar en el negocio y a futuro transformar mis abarrotes en algo mayor mi petición es por $1,000.00 dlls. para comprar mercancía en abundancia.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Hello, my name is Marina. I am a merchant, and I own a grocery store called “Pulpería MANI” (Grocery Store MANI). I have been doing this type of work for several years, and it allows me to take care of my family and earn an income to help cover the household costs. Due to the location of my business, sales have increased. However, I don’t have the capital to increase my inventory to be able to offer my customers a greater variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, butter, corn, beans, rice, flour, chicken, dairy products, deli meats, beverages, candy and various brands of juice.

texts.en:
Kleber is a tailor who runs his workshop out of his home. He makes shirts, pants and school uniforms. He is requesting his second loan with Kiva and Mifex. Kleber was able to invest his first loan very effectively. As he planned, he bought new fabrics and many more materials. This allowed him to be more creative in his business and gain some new customers. Also, he has been working very diligently recently because of the upcoming school year. The demand for uniforms is at highest point in the year. Thanks to the profits that Kleber yielded from his first investments, he has been able to invest in the necessary materials to make a good amount of uniforms.

Now that Kleber has sufficient materials, he is looking to improve his efficiency. He hopes that with a second loan he will be able to buy a new sewing machine and a cutting machine. His two sons are doing well and Kleber has already registered them for the new school year.

Mrs Hoa is married to Hung. He was wounded during the war and cannot do any hard work. He only can earn money as a day laborer, and he finds work about 6 days per month. They have only a small hut and 2000 square meters for growing rice. They have two children of 9 and 5.

So much depends on Hoa selling fruits at the village market. She has already repaid 3 loans in full and this improved their income by $1.6/person/month. Hoa wants to borrow again for expanding her sales and to buy fertilizer for her paddy field.

Esther has a small store where she sells many different types of products for the home. She started her business by borrowing from informal lenders who charged very high interest rates. She is happy that she is now dealing with a financial institution after receiving her first loan with Kiva and MIFEX.

Once she had the money, Esther immediately began investing in many different products. She is now selling clothing and children’s toys from her store. These items have helped her increase profits substantially. She used part of the loan and part of the profits to improve her store as well. She has made her storefront about double the size it was before. She also paved the floor in her home and her store which were dirt before.

There has not only been a noticeable change in the physical appearance of Esther’s store, there has also been a change in Esther’s view about the future. She is now thinking bigger as she plans to begin selling domestic appliances from her store. Her daughter will start studying at the university in the next couple of months and she hopes she can continue to help her.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a door-to-door saleswoman who offers cosmetics and home products. Jenny is hoping to receive her second loan through the Kiva and Mifex program. With her first loan she was able to invest in cosmetic products that were of better quality and allowed her to make more profits. With part of the loan and the profits she bought a glass case where she could display her products. She is optimistic about taking the next step in her business and setting up a store in her home so she can have her clients visit her. It is difficult for her to sell only door to door because she can only show a limited amount of items. After setting up her store at home, she hopes she can safely invest in a wider variety of goods, such as expensive cooking appliances and televisions. Jenny is optimistic about the future and is very grateful to the people who helped her receive her loan.

Jenny is 42 years old and has many years of experience as a saleswoman. She has used this business to help her husband support their three children. She hopes that increased profits will guarantee the education of her children and even allow her to accumulate some savings.

loans.use: Set up her business at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a new point of sale

texts.en:
Silvia B. and Todor Belev make up this husband and wife team. Their small business, Norma, started in February, sells firewood in Sliven, Bulgaria.

Wood burning stoves is the medium many Bulgarians use to hear their homes and cook with, as it is substantially cheaper than electric or gas powered appliances. Silvia and Todor buy pre-cut wood in the hills around Sliven and truck it down into town. They are attempting to generate regular clients, who will receive scheduled deliveries and add an element of predictability to their business. However, right now, most of their business comes from individuals noticing their truck and purchasing wood on the spot.

Silvia and Todor have one child, an eight-month old baby.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jerusha intends to buy hybrid maize seeds, fertilizers and beans for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Catherine would like to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy intends to buy high quality maize seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah intends to buy good quality maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys Wangari Maina intends to buy good quality maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy Muthoni Mwangi intends to buy purchase high quality maize, spinach, carrot and bean seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia Wahithe Kamau intends to buy good quality maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah Wanjiku intends to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
My name is Florentina Maria M., and I am a native of Bela-Vista in the district of Matutuine. I am 41 years old, a married mother of two, and a daughter of a polygamous father. I grew up in a large family with nearly 22 siblings; thus, obtaining an education was difficult. For survival, I learned how to fish at a young age, and, because of my talent for sewing, my father decided to enroll me in a sewing school at the age of 18. To purchase sewing materials, I would sell horticultures. At the end of my sewing courses I worked as a waitress in a tavern because of my lack of experience. After a year, I acquired a sewing machine and began to work from home. Right now I have 4 sewing machines, one machine to make buttonholes, a tailor’s workshop, and 3 employees (two women and one man). With the current loan I intend to increase the volume of my business and transform the tailor’s workshop into a sales boutique where we would sell appropriate materials and diverse fabrics—right now I only work with fabrics provided by my clients.

Florentina’s business’ impact on the community is great; currently there exists no dressmaker with the same quality of service who also offers greatly reduced costs to visitors to Maputo seeking a dressmaker. Florentina’s services are thus in great demand.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina Maria M., natural de Bela-Vista distrito de Matutuine, de 41 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhos, filha de pai polígamo, cresceu numa família numerosa com cerca de 22 filhos, dai as dificuldades em ter uma educação condigna, para a sua sobrevivência dedicava desde criança a pesca artesanal e dada a sua vocação de corte e costura o pai decidiu aos 18 idade matricular-lhe na escola de costura. Para a compra de material de costura sempre vendeu hortícolas, e no fim do curso trabalhou numa botequim como servente pois não possuía nenhuma experiência prática. Passado um ano adquiriu uma máquina de costura e tendo desde ai começado a fazer trabalhos em casa. Actualmente conta 4 maquinas de costura e uma de furar botões, uma alfaiataria e 3 empregados sendo duas mulheres e um homem. Com o presente crédito pretende ampliar o volume de negocio e transformar a alfaiataria em boutique pela compra de todo material próprio e diversos tecidos pois actualmente tem trabalhado com tecidos trazidos pelos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto bastante grande pois no local onde desenvolve a actividade não existe modistas com a mesma qualidade dos serviços que oferece reduzido assim em grande escala os custo de deslocação aos utentes à cidade de Maputo a procura dos mesmo serviço, resultando deste modo numa maior procura dos seus serviços.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret intends to buy high quality seeds.

loans.name: Maria Adelaide Macha

texts.en:
My name is Maria AdelaiD. Machava D. C., and I am a 44-year-old single mother and a native of the city of Maputo. I grew up under the care of my parents; however, the family’s financial situation did not allow me to study pass the 7th graD.. Since 1997 I have assumed full administrative responsibilities for the family business and owned a commercial establishment at the 16th kilometer of the Boane district. Currently my business serves as the source of income for myself and the other members of my family (3 siblings and 2 children); the revenues help support familial and educational expenses. With this loan, I intend to buy property and expand the production of ornamental flowers and inoculated fruit trees, thus responding positively to client demands.

Maria’s business’ impact on the community is great because beyond providing employment to herself and 5 other people she offers ornamental flowers and fruit trees to the clients of Boane and the cities of Matola and Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria AdelaiD. Machava D. C. D. 44 anos D. idaD., mãe solteira, natural D. cidaD. D. Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidades dos pais, a situação financeira da família não lhe permitiu estudar para além da 7ª classe. DesD. 1997 vem assumindo na integra a gestão D. negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial no km16 distrito D. Boane. Actualmente o seu negocio serve D. fonte D. rendimento para ela própria e outros membros da família 03 irmãos e 02 filhos. Com a renda do negocio suporta os encargos familiares e as despesas escolares D. 05 filhos . Com o empréstimo D. 30.000,00 mt pretenD. comprar um terreno e aumentar a produção D. plantas D. ornamentação e fruteiras enxertadas D. forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes. A sua actividaD. tem um impacto maior na comunidaD. porque além D. providenciar emprego para ela própria e mais outras cinco pessoas, coloca plantas ornamentais e fruteiras para um universo D. clientes D. Boane e cidades da Matola e Maputo.

loans.use: To increase the production of plants and flowers

texts.en:
Nikolay K. is a member of the gypsy, or Roma, minority in Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma are a highly marginalized group concentrated on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe.

Nikolay has a small café where he and his wife serve a simple lunch menu in the Roma neighborhood. In addition, Nikolay is a musician and plays a variety of instruments in local bands. Recently, Nikolay was hired onto a Mediterranean cruise ship as part of their entertainment for employment during the summer of 2007. Although auditions were a $10 bus ride away in Sofia, Nikolay needs to pay his own fare to the port of departure in Italy. Proceeds from this loan will do two things:

- Provide working capital for the café, including a cushion to hire help when Nikolay leaves.

- Enable Nikolay to join the cruise ship, where he will be able to make an income approx. 17x greater than the average Bulgarian wage.

Lenders who are interested in learning more about the Roma culture should check out "Bury Me Standing", by Isabel Fonseca.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
Angel A. Angel is an exceptional guy. He came to us originally about a year ago in search of a loan to start a small bike repair shop in the Roma ghetto in Sliven, Bulgaria. He was one of our first clients and has turned out to be the one in which we have the most pride. The Roma are viewed by most ethnic Bulgarians as lazy, shifty and entirely untrustworthy; Angel has completely upended that stereotype.

When we met, Angel had worked at a bike repair shop in the commercial center of Sliven for close to 15 years. Upon the shop’s closing, he aimed to strike out on his own and start a shop within the Roma ghetto. 20,000 Roma live in the neighborhood in conditions that are shockingly below the European average. Biking isn’t the leisure activity it is for many in the West; rather, for many it is the only affordable way to get around. For the most part, bikes that the Roma ride have only one gear on a small frame.

After being denied his loan by six banks, Angel heard about our nascent program. With a loan of $850, Angel turned a part of his concrete home into his workshop, purchased metalworking tools and bought the supplies he would need. After a busy summer of work, his business slowed in the late fall with the turn in weather. However, Angel figured out a way to put his metalworking tools to work and began repairing and making doors and window frames for neighborhood clients. Six weeks ago, some of his tools broke and he needed to purchase new ones for which we made him a supplemental loan. In the process, he impressed the metalworking sales agent to the point where he became a leasing agent for the company.

Angel now has three lines of business. His achievements are remarkable and have been featured in national newspapers. Angel is a great role model for many in his neighborhood. This loan will be to cover his new equipment and provide a new line of working capital to all three of his lines of business. Angel's original posting is here:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=274

The photo here shows Angel in front of his shop. The sign behind him, translated literally, reads "Metalworking tools, services of leasing."

Client History: Irma has a kiosk where she sells all types of products: sweets, cookies, cigarettes, soft drinks, perfumes, cleaning products, cards for cell phones, etc. She lives in the Llojeta zone and her sales kiosk is located behind the San Pedro jail. She is 60 years old and inherited her business from her mother. She has 1 daughter who remains dependent on her.

She does not have employees since she tends to the kiosk with her daughter. Additionally, her business is nicely profitable since she buys her products from wholesalers in order to then sell them retail.

She has worked with Impro since April 2006. Her case history with our institution classifies her as "Client 1", that is to say, with excellent fulfillment of the repayment of her loan. The loan for which she is applying will be used to buy more products in order to satisfy the needs of her clients.

Irma's previous history and her source of repayment allow her access to this loan, since she has experience in her business and lots of clients who know her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La cliente tiene un Kiosco donde vende toda clase de productos como ser: dulces, galletas, cigarrillos, refrescos, perfumes, productos de limpieza, tarjetas de móvil, etc. Vive en la zona de llojeta y su puesto de venta esta ubicado detrás de la cárcel de San Pedro. Ella tiene 60 años y su puesto lo heredo de su madre, tiene 1 hija que depende de ella.

La cliente no tiene empleados ya que atiende su Kiosco con su hija además su actividad es netamente comercial ya que agarra sus productos de los mayoristas para venderlo al detalle.

Trabaja con Impro desde abril del 2006. su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente de pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado a la compra de mas productos para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Sus antecedentes y fuente de repago le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y mucha clientela que conoce su kiosco en la zona.

Client History: Monica works weaving sweaters, ponchos and jackets for men and women. Her workshop and home are located on Ismael Zeballos Street in the Vivienda Obrera (Worker's Housing) Zone of La Paz. She is 27 years old and has been self-employed for 4 years. She is single and does not have children.

She has 2 employees who work for her out of their own homes. She sends the sweaters to them so that they can finish the sewing and add decoration.

Monica has been an Impro client since 03/03/05. Her case history in our institution classifies her as "Client 1", that is to say, with excellent fulfillment of the payment of her loan. The loan for which she is applying will be used to buy a weaving machine and wool.

Her work and her previous credit history with Impro allow her access to this loan, since she has experience in her business and the capacity to repay the loan with her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La cliente se dedica al tejido de chompas, ponchos y sacones de varon y mujer. Su taller y domicilio estan ubicados en calle Ismael Zeballos Zona Vivienda Obrera. Tiene 27 años trabaja por cuenta propia hace 4 años es soltera y no tiene hijos.

La cliente tiene dos empleadas a domicilio es decir que les envía las chompas a su domicilio para que ellas puedan terminarlo en la costura y demás adornos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el 03/03/05. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación, el monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una maquina de tejer y la compra de lana.

Su trabajo, antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crèdityo, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y la capacidad de fuente de repago.

Client History: Señora Romualda works weaving blankets, shawls and scarves. Her workshop is located in the Llojeta Sector Calamarca area of the city of La Paz. She has a sales stand on a street in the central part of the city of La Paz. She has 5 children, 4 daughters and a son. Three of her children help her in the production, distribution and commercialization of her products. She is 59 years old and has been self employed for more than 25 years.

Her sales are retail, to individual customers. She doesn't work with other employees since her daughters help her in the business as a means of paying for their university studies.

She has been an Impro client since 04/02/98. Her case history in our institution classifies her as "Client 2", with regular fulfillment in the repayment of her loan. The loan for which she has applied will be used to buy wool and thread.

Her work and previous credit history with Impro allow her access to this loan, since she has experience in her business. That experience will bring her the earnings with which to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Romualda se dedica al tejido de mantas, mantillas y chalinas. Su taller se esta ubicado en la zona de Llojeta Sector Calamarca, de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un puesto de venta en el pasaje Nuñez del Prado la Zona Central de la Ciudad de La Paz, tiene 5 hijos, 4 mujeres y 1 Varon, tres de sus hijas le ayudan en la producción, distribución y la comercialización de su producto. Tiene 59 años y trabaja por cuenta propia mas de 25 años.

Sus ventas son al detalle en su puesto de venta no trabaja con otros empleados ya que sus hijas le ayudan para poderse solventar sus estudios universitarios.

Es cliente de Impro desde el 04/02/98 su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 2, es decir con cumplimiento regular en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de lana e hilo.

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

Norma has been making school uniforms for five years. Her husband’s income wasn’t sufficient and the lack of money to satisfy the family’s needs was one of her motivations to dedicate herself to this occupation. She started out with one sewing machine making just a few uniforms, but little by little she sold more and got more clients. Eventually she was able to buy another sewing machine and now she employs another person to help her meet the demand from her clients.

Now Norma requires a loan in the amount of $475, which she will use to buy more industrial sewing machines. With these new machines she hopes to quicken her production and continue growing as a small business owner. She needs your help, you can contribute to the growth of this business. She thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cinco años, la señora Norma se dedica a elaborar uniformes escolares, el salario que su esposo recibe era insuficiente y la falta de recursos para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia fue uno de los impulsos que la motivaron a dedicarse a este oficio, ella empezó con una sola máquina y haciendo pocos uniformes, y poco a poco fue vendiendo más y consiguiendo más clientes, después le fue posible comprarse otra máquina y ahora tiene la ayuda de otra persona pasa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Norma requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizara para comprar máquinas de coser industriales con las que espera agilizar su producción y continuar creciendo como microempresaria, ella necesita de tu ayuda, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

Mrs. Blanca Lidia is married and has two sons and one daughter. When she decided to start selling cosmetics twelve years ago, her family was experiencing some difficult economic times. They were paying for their house and tuition for their three children—university for the oldest son and preparatory school for the other two. She began by selling to her friends and family members and her number of customers grew. The income she has earned from her job has helped her to help out with family expenses and she has also reinvested in her business.

Hard work and dedication are what have kept Blanca going during so much time in this business. At this time she needs a loan in the amount of $325.00, which she wants to use to buy products for the summer season in order to be ready for her customer’s demand. She needs your help, it is in your hands to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca Lidia es casada y tiene dos hijos y una hija, cuando ella decidió dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, hace doce años, su familia atravesaba por momentos muy difíciles económicamente, estaban pagando su casa y los estudios de sus tres hijos, la universidad de su hijo mayor y la preparatoria de sus otros dos hijos. Ella inició vendiendo con sus amigas y familiares y sus clientes se fueron incrementando, el ingreso que ella obtenía de su trabajo le ha ayudado a colaborar con los gastos familiares y a reinvertir en su negocio.

Esfuerzo y dedicación es lo que ha mantenido a Blanca durante tanto tiempo en este negocio, en esta temporada ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 325 dólares que quiere utilizar para comprar productos de temporada de verano para estar preparada a la demanda de sus clientes, ella necesita de tu ayuda, en tus manos está el poder ayudarla.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

texts.en:
María is married and her husband cannot continue working because he is ill. Because both of them are elderly, and it is impossible for them to find jobs, their children used to help them with the household expenses. However, when they got married, it was almost impossible for them to continue helping their parents. This is how María came to sell shoes in the town of San Nicolás de los Garza, in the state of Nuevo León.

Her number of clients has increased since she began her business and she has worked hard to provide for herself and her husband. Right now she has many orders for shoes, since the new season is starting, and she doesn’t have sufficient capital to fill them. So, she is asking for a loan in the amount of $200.00. Now is the time to help someone who is in need; have no doubts, the power to help is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una mujer casada, su esposo por motivo de enfermedad no puede seguir trabajando, debido a la edad avanzada de los dos y la imposibilidad de encontrar un empleo, sus hijos los apoyaban con los gastos de la casa y de la alimentación de ellos, pero cuando se casaron les fue casi imposible continuar ayudando a sus padres. De esta manera es como hace tres años, en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza del estado de Nuevo León, doña María se dedica a la venta de zapatos.

Los clientes que ella tiene se han incrementado desde que inició y se ha esforzado para conseguir el sustento de ella y de su esposo, actualmente tiene muchos pedidos por la entrada de la nueva temporada y no cuenta con capital suficiente para surtirlos, por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo dudes más, en tus manos está el poder hacerlo.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
In the town of Santa Catarina, in the state of Nuevo León, Mrs. Ester sells groceries. This has been her only source of income for 36 years. She is married and because of her husband’s age, it is difficult for him to find work. He helps her out in her store, and through this business they have been able to provide for their family and get ahead. It was economic need and a liking for sales that motivated Esther to open her business back when they first moved to their current house.

Esther has dedicated herself completely to her business. In order for it to grow she needs a loan in the amount of $475, which she will use to stock her store with more merchandise and thereby offer more variety to her customers. She needs your help and is sincerely thankful to you for any support you can provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Santa Catarina del estado de Nuevo León, doña Esther se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, esto ha representado para ella el único ingreso desde hace ya 36 años, ella es casada y por la edad de su esposo le es muy difícil conseguir un empleo, y él le ayuda en atender el negocio, por medio de este trabajo han podido obtener el sustento para su familia y han podido salir adelante. La necesidad que tenían y el gusto por las ventas hizo que Esther se decidiera a abrir su negocio cuando en aquel tiempo se acababan de cambiar a ese domicilio.

Esther se ha dedicado por completo a su negocio, y para poder hacer crecer su negocio requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizara para surtir su tienda de mercancía y pode ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas darle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk for her store

texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Nelly is married and has a young child who is in school. Her husband works as a bus driver. However, the salary José receives isn’t enough for all the needs of his family. Blanca likes sales, so eight years ago she decided to begin her own business selling shoes from catalogs. She was able to help with the family expenses and take care of her son, which is the most important thing to her.

Blanca has noticed that shoe sales always increase in this month, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $457.00, which will be useful to fill the orders from her customers. She hopes to continue growing her business and you can help make this possible, decide to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca Nelly es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño que esa estudiando. Su esposo labora como chofer de un camión urbano, sin embargo, el salario que José recibe no es suficiente para todas las necesidades de su familia, a Blanca le gustan las ventas y se decidió por iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo calzado por catálogo, desde hace ocho años, ella podía contribuir con los gastos familiares y de esta manera no descuidar a su hijo, que para ella es lo más importante.

Blanca ha observado que las ventas de calzado se incrementan en este mes, por lo que solicita un crédito por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que le será de gran utilidad para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella desea continua creciendo y tú puedes ayudar a que sea posible, decídete y apóyala.

Alma Nelly has been selling electronics for 11 years. She has two children who help her in her business, which has been her only income and the only way to support and educate her children. She has the advantage of being able to travel to the United States and buy products there that she can then offer to her customers. Lately the demand for video games has increased and her customers have put in many orders.

In order to cover the demand from her customers, Alma Nelly requires a loan in the amount of $650.00. She plans to return the loan over a period of 4 to 8 months, because she trusts that the products she sells are of good quality and that her clients like them. Alma and her family need your generosity and support. They are sincerely grateful for any help you can provide them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alma Nelly se dedica a la venta de aparatos electrónicos desde hace once años, ella tiene dos hijos que le ayudan con su negocio, éste ha representado para ella su único ingreso y la posibilidad de poder mantener y darles educación a sus hijos. Ella tiene la facilidad para viajar a Estados Unidos y allá compra los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, últimamente la demanda de video juegos se ha incrementado y sus clientes le han levantado muchos pedidos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Alma Nelly requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares. Ella está dispuesta a devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses, porque confía que los productos que vende son de buena calidad y de agrado a sus clientes. Alma y su familia necesitan de tu generosidad y apoyo, y agradecen sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darle.

Maria Graciela is married and has two small children. It is very important to her to offer a better quality of life to her family. Maria is an enterprising and dynamic woman who, when she saw the needs she and her family have, and the difficult job situation in the country, decided to start her own business selling shoes. She is able to do this thanks to being able to travel to the city of Moroleón, in the state of Guanajuato, where she can get the products she needs at a lower price.

Demand for the products she sells has grown because she has worked hard in order to get more clients. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $650.00, which she will use to buy merchandise so that she can offer a greater variety and increase her sales. You can be an important part of this business. Your help will be of great use to this family, have no doubt, they will be very appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Graciela es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, para ella es muy importante ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, Maria es una mujer emprendedora y activa que al ver las necesidades que tienen y la situación difícil del país para encontrar empleo, decidió por iniciar su propio negocio, esto gracias a la facilidad que ella tiene de viajar hacia la ciudad de Moroleón en el estado de Guanajuato, donde puede conseguir este tipo de productos a un menor precio.

La demanda de los productos que ella vende se ha incrementado, porque ella ha trabajado mucho para poder conseguir más clientes, ahora ella tiene la necesidad de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ser parte importante de este negocio, tu apoyo será de gran utilidad para esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Enthusiasm, responsibility, and hard work are what characterize the work that Patricia has been doing for the last three years. She is married and has three small children. Selling shoes represents for her an opportunity to help out with the family’s expenses and to contribute to her children’s education. Paty has managed to increase her number of clients and orders of her products have increased.

In order to cover her customer’s demand, Paty has requested a loan in the amount of $325.00. This loan would be very useful to her because a good season for selling shoes is coming up. She is ready to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months, because she is sure her clients will respond. Patricia sincerely appreciates your support and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Entusiasmo, responsabilidad y esfuerzo es lo que caracteriza el trabajo que Patricia efectúa desde hace tres años. Ella es casada y tiene tres pequeños hijos, la venta de calzado representa para ella una oportunidad de apoya en los gastos familiares y de contribuir a la educación de sus hijos. Paty ha logrado aumentar el número de sus clientes y se han incrementado los pedidos de sus productos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Paty solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 325 dólares, para ella será de mucha utilidad este crédito porque se acerca una buena temporada para la venta de zapatos, ella está dispuesta a regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses porque confía en que sus clientes responderán. Patricia agradece sinceramente tu apoyo y generosidad.

Rita is married and has two small children. Her husband works in a recycling factory, but his income isn’t enough to cover all the needs of his family. Rita is a very dynamic and enterprising woman, and a year ago she decided to help out her husband by selling shoes. She has reinvested a part of her income in her business, because she has a great desire to get ahead; unfortunately, it is not enough to satisfy what her customer's orders.

At this time, Rita needs a loan in the amount of $375.00, which she will use to buy merchandise for the summer season. She plans to return it over a period of 5 to 10 months because she believes that with her job she can do it. She needs your support and warmth, she is awaiting this loan to continue with her business. You can help make possible a better life for Rita and her family. Decide to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rita es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una fábrica resicladora, pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. Rita es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora y decidió, desde hace un año, apoyar a su esposo vendiendo calzado, del ingreso que ella recibe ha reinvertido una parte en su negocio porque tiene enormes deseos de superación, lamentablemente esto no es suficiente para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Rita necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $375 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía de temporada de verano, ella confía en retornar éste en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses porque confía que con su trabajo podrá lograrlo. Ella necesita de tu ayuda y cariño, está en espera de este préstamo para continuar con negocio, tú puedes hacer posible una mejor vida para Rita y su familia, decídete a apoyarla.

A desire to get ahead and an enterprising attitude are what characterize Sonia. They are what inspired her to start her business in sales of natural products seven years ago. She has a daughter to whom she wants to give a better quality of life and a good education. This is her motivation for working very hard everyday. Since she began working, Sonia has gotten on well with her customers, of whom she keeps getting more and more.

In order to satisfy the demands of her customers, Sonia now needs a loan in the amount of $300.00, which she will use to by merchandise to fill her customer’s orders and thereby earn a better income. Sonia and her daughter need your support. It is in your hands to help them to have a better life. Your support will be an enormous blessing for this family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Los deseos de superación y la actitud de mujer emprendedora que caracterizan a Sonia la impulsaron a iniciar su negocio de venta de productos naturales, desde hace siete años. Ella tiene una hija a la que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida, y poder ofrecerle una buena educación, es su motivo para trabajar arduamente día a día. Desde que Sonia empezó ha logrado ponerse en el gusto de sus clientes que cada vez son más.

Para poder satisfacer las demandas de sus consumidores, ahora Sonia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 300 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cumplir con sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos. Sonia y su hija necesitan de tu apoyo, en tus manos está el que ellas puedan tener una mejor vida, tú apoyo será de gran bendición para esta familia.

loans.name: Astou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Dieuf Diauregnou association, led by Astou N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

«Our business consists of purchasing various food and household supplies in bulk at very good prices, and selling them at prices that are very appropriate in the local markets. Our business strategy depends on the regular refilling of our stocks of goods.

The members of the Dieuf Diauregnou group are very actives in FAFS of Diourbel [a village-based environmental protection organization] and very experienced in the retailing business. The lack of finance for investment has always been the obstacle for the strengthening and expansion of our small business. The group is also engaged in the retailing of traditional cloth skirts and other small clothing items, and this activity is very profitable. Our members will profit greatly from access to finance for investment, with a positive effect on the training of other sectors, such as traditional artisans.”

Business description from original French loan application:

« Contexte du projet : la pauvreté dans les ménages est aujourd’hui une donné incontournable dans la commune de DIOURBEL. Les conséquences au niveau du tissu social sont frappantes surtout du point de vue du développement de l’entreprenariat féminin de l’accès des femmes aux sources de financements. Les chefs de ménages les moins nantis éprouvent d’énormes difficultés pour satisfaire leurs besoins. Les femmes ( chefs de ménages ) sont les plus touchées par le mal. Cette situation poussent les femmes à partir dans les grandes villes comme DAKAR sans réellement de projets et souvent sans financement. Mais avec un peu de soutien matériel et un suivi les femmes peuvent sans sortir . Les membres ( FAFS de DIOURBEL ) sont des partenaires de l’ écovillage KEER GU MAG depuis de longues dates et se retrouvent dans plusieurs activités touchant l’environnement et la protection de la nature.

Objectif général : Améliorer les activités du petit commerce au profit des membres du groupement DIEUF DIAUREGNOU membre de la FAFS.

ACTIVITES : Activés 01 Il s’agira d’acheter dans un premier temps du matériel de consommations et divers articles à de très bons prix et les revendre avec des prix très adaptés dans les marchés locaux. La stratégie : elle repose sur le renouvellement des stocks périodiques des articles

Conclusions : le groupement sopeye sérigne Fallou S/c de DIEUF DIAUREGNOU est un groupe de femmes membres très actives de la FAFS de DIOURBEL est très expérimenté en matière de vente de petits articles divers, le manque d`appui a toujours été le frein pour le renforcement et l ’élargissement des activités du petits commerces. Le groupement s investit en même temps dans le petit commerce de pagnes et autres effets vestimentaires et cette activité est très rentable. Avec un peu d’appui les membres bénéficiaires tireront beau coups de bénéfices avec un effet entraînement. pour les autres secteurs comme l’artisanat. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of food and household supplies; transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio is an enterprising man, active and very hardworking. He has always wanted to have his own business and he made this happen four years ago when he started up his own grocery store. He is married and has two daughters. This business, apart from being his dream, is the way Leoncio can earn a living for his family and educate his daughters. Starting wasn’t easy, but with his and his family’s hard work, they have been able to get ahead.

Leo has put all of his effort into making his grocery store grow. He is just missing one little push, which is why he needs a loan of $475.00, which he will use to buy merchandise to stock his store. With this he hopes to offer a wider variety and better service to his customers, which is how he hopes to ensure that they will prefer his store. This will help him grow as a small business owner. You can be an important part of the development of this store, you can support Leoncio and his family. With your help, he can do great things.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Leoncio es un hombre emprendedor, activo y muy trabajador, siempre tuvo deseos de tener su negocio propio y se cumplió hace cuatro años que inició con su propio abarrote, él está casado y tiene dos hijas. Este negocio ha representado, además de su sueño, la manera en que Leoncio puede obtener el sustento para su familia y para la educación de sus hijas. Empezar no fue fácil, pero con el esfuerzo unido de él y su familia han podido salir adelante.

Leo ha puesto todo su empeño para que este abarrote pueda crecer, solo le hace falta un pequeño impulso, para lo que necesita de un crédito de $ 475 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y surtir su negocio, con esto espera poder ofrecer una mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes para obtener su preferencia, crecer como microempresario. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el desarrollo y crecimiento de esta tienda, tú puedes apoyar a Leoncio y a su familia, con tu ayuda él puede hacer grandes cosas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Lamo

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the eight women of the Kawral association, led by Lamo S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“ Our business strategy depends on the capacity of the group to stock enough farm products [e.g. millet, yams, peanuts] to establish our own fund dedicated to the periodic replenishment of our stock of quality food products at good prices, to be sold in the bi-weekly markets. Our business activities will consist of purchasing the goods when their price is very low (strong supply), store them, and sell them in the local markets.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte du projet : Avec toutes les conséquences néfastes liées à la production agricole inadaptée, la destruction massive des sols et autres phénomènes liés à la désertification ;le département de M’BACKE se retrouve avec un déséquilibre

Objectif général : Augmentation durable des revenus agricole

Objectifs spécifiques

• Lutter contre la pauvreté du milieu rural (communauté rurale de DENDEYE)

Stratégie

Elle repose sur la capacité du G I E à stocker assez de produits de première nécessité pour constituer un fond Propre destiné au renouvellement périodiques des denrées de qualités à bons prix destinées à la vente dans les marchés hebdomadaires (LOUMA)

Activités

Il s’agira d’acheté de la matière première au moment ou le prix est très bas. ( forte offre ) et de les stocker et d’organiser des actions de commercialisations dans les marchés locaux.

Activité 1 : achats matières premières

Activité : commercialisation»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of farm products; transportation to market for retail sale

texts.en:
Juana is a married woman, she has a ten year old son and two daughters, ages 7 and 3. Since the birth of her youngest daughter, there have been unforseen expenses, which have led to an increase in the family debt. To help out, Juana started selling cosmetics and jewlery and in this way, she's been able to improve the family's situation. She is very hardworking and responsible and she has dedicated herself completely to the sale of her products. She has been able to grow as a micro-businesswoman in the city of Escobedo in the state of Nuevo Leon.

It hasn't been easy for Juana and her family to overcome their challenges, but together they have been able to face them. Now, Juana needs a $750 loan which she will use to buy merchandise for the new season. She needs your help; you can help her business grow.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es una mujer casada, tiene un hijo de 10 años y dos hijas de 7 y 3 años, desde el nacimiento de su tercera hija, surgieron gastos imprevistos por lo que las deudas de la familia se incrementaron y para poder contribuir con algo, Juana comenzó a vender cosméticos y joyería, de esta manera ella ha podido salir adelante con su familia. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable que se ha dedicado por completo a la venta de sus productos, por lo que ha ido creciendo como microempresaria en la ciudad de Escobedo del estado de Nuevo León.

No ha sido fácil para ella y su familia superar todos los retos, pero con la unión de la familia han podido hacerlo. En estos momentos Juana necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 750 dólares que utilizará para surtirse de mercancía para esta nueva temporada. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, tú puedes colaborar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

My name is Chova-Chova Domingos B., and I am a 56-year-old native of Chilembene, Chokwe district, Gaza province. I grew up under the care of my parents; however, the family’s financial situation offered me few opportunities to attend school. I started working as a young boy at the age of 12. At 22 I began to work in South Africa as a miner. I worked there 3 years before returning to Mozambique in 1975. Since 1984 I have assumed the full administrative duties of the family’s business and owned a territory with more than 50 hectares. Starting in 2006, through some neighbors' suggestions, I met Hluvuku-Adsema and solicited information about obtaining a loan for the expansion of my business. My business is in horticulture; I sell cabbage, peppers and tomatoes at the principal market in the district of Boane and the city of Maputo. Currently I employ 4 valuable workers, and when I am in need of help I contract someone with potential. The revenues help me support my basic needs, including the education and health of 7 children. With the loan I intend to purchase fuel for a motorized water pump and agricultural seeds and fertilizers.

Chova-Chova’s impact on the community is great because outside of providing employment for herself and four others she places the product nearer to the client. Her business also supplies the nearby market of the city of Maputo with cabbage and other horticultures.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Chova-Chova Domingos B. de 56 anos de idade, natural de Chilembene, distrito de Chokwe província de Gaza, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, a situação financeira da família ofereceu-lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar, teve que começar a trabalhar ainda criança com 12 anos de idade. Aos 22 anos de idade começou a trabalhar na Africa do Sul como mineiro, apenas trabalhou 3 anos, tendo regressado a Moçambique em 1975. Desde 1984 vem assumindo na integra a gestão do negocio da família e possui um terreno com mais de 50 ha. A partir de ano 2006 por indicação de alguns vizinhos teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema tendo se aproximado para obter informações sobre as condições de acesso ao crédito para ampliação do seu negocio. A sua actividade é horticultura, produção de repolho, pimento e tomate, sendo principal mercado o distrito de Boane e cidade do Maputo. Actualmente conta com 4 empregados efectivos e quando necessário contrata pessoal eventual. Com os rendimentos suporta as despesas básicas, incluindo educação e saúde de 7 filhos. Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar combustível para motobomba e ínsumos agrícolas. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio e mais outras quatro pessoas, coloca o produto mais perto do cliente e fornece o mercado vizinho da cidade de Maputo com repolho e outras hortícolas.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
My name is Bertha Luis M., and I am a 35-year-old native of Matola, Maputo province. I grew up under the care of my parents; however, the family’s financial situation offered me few schooling opportunities. In 2001 I began working in a stand at kilometer 16. Since 2004 I have come to assume the full administrative duties of my family’s business, and I have also come to own my own commercial establishment. At the start of 2006, with the help of some female colleagues at the market, I met Hluvuku-Adsema and solicited information about the conditions of access to credit for the expansion of my business. Right now my business requires greater capital to respond to the ever-growing services of preparing meals. With this loan I intend to reinforce product stock, thus reducing the number of trips to the city of Maputo and diversifying my client’s menus.

Bertha’s business’ impact on the community is great because beyond providing employment for herself and her niece she prepares meal for more than 100 people who work in close proximity to her establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Luis M. de 35 anos de idade, natural de Matola, província do Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, a situação financeira da família não lhe ofereceu oportunidades para estudar. Em 2001 começou a trabalhar numa barraca em km16. Desde o ano 2004 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família e conta hoje com um estabelecimento comercial. A partir do ano 2006 por conselho de algumas senhoras colegas do mercado teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema tendo aproximado e solicitado informações sobre as condições de acesso ao crédito para ampliação do seu negocio. Actualmente o seu negocio precisa de maior capital para responder a procura cada vez crescente de serviços de confecção de refeições. Com o empréstimo de 10.300,00 mt pretende reforçar o stock em produtos, reduzindo deste modo o número de viagens para cidade de Maputo e diversificar mais o menu das refeições dos seus clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego a ela própria e sua sobrinha, confecciona refeições para mais 100 pessoas que trabalham nas proximidades do seu estabelecimento.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

texts.en:
Esmer is a 37 year old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. She is married and has a child. 
Her main source of income is farming where she grows vines.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought seedlings to begin vine-growing.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy fertilizers.

Aminata thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. She was able to add comfortable chairs and abstock of hairdressing materials.

She is now requesting a second loan with Kiva to strengthen her working capital. The loan will be used to add a stock of hairdressing materials, replacing worn-out hairdressing equipment, like steamers and driers, and to buy a TV set for entertaining customers who are waiting for service. A loan of USD 1000 will help her implement her plan.

Hadija runs a hairdressing salon. The salon is located in a busy area of Lumo in Dar es Salaam. She has two assistants in her business. On regular days she attends to fifteen to twenty customers.

Hadija thanks all her lenders of her first loan with Kiva. With the loan she was able to stock enough hairdressing materials for her hair salon business. She is now requesting a second loan. With the loan she wants to improve her business by adding comfortable chairs for customers to sit in while in queue, a TV set to entertain customers, and a stock of hairdressing materials. She is in need of USD 550 to implement her plan.

Rafik breeds calves in a private farm shed. With this business he meets the needs of his family.
He has run this business for 6 years. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 and bought 2 calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow.
Rafik is 49, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has a child.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a 40-year-old, very hard-working single mother of 5 children. She has twins aged 14 and the others are 19, 21, 24 years old. Mary also takes care of her aging mother and two brothers who are drug addicts. They all live in the Kibera slums of Nairobi.

Mary started her business in the year 2000 after getting lessons from her daughter, now aged 24 years, who was trained how to knit using a loom machine by a group of women in Kenya called Maendeleo ya Wanawake Organization. This group teaches women how to get into self-employment using locally available materials. Mary knitted two sets of tablecloths and took them to the offices of Maendeleo ya Wanawake Organization. Fortunately she got buyers and sold the sets of the tablecloths, and earned herself a cheque of Ksh 2000 (USD 29). Mary used this money to buy knitting wool, which she used to make 4 sets of tablecloths. Again she took them to the offices of Maendeleo ya Wanawake and all the 4 sets were bought and by the time she was leaving their offices, she had got orders from a number of people.

Mary’s business has continued to grow and for now she deals with tourists from Switzerland and they love her work very much such that every month she does at least 10 sets of tablecloths for them. Unfortunately, last year, Mary’s brother who is a drug addict took her money to buy drugs. For now Mary’s business is doing poorly due to a shortage of money to purchase materials for knitting.

Right now Mary has an order to make tablecloths worth Ksh 10,000 (USD 150) but what is drawing her back is the fact that she has no money to buy the materials needed. She has so far not managed to get access to any money to enable her to purchase the needed materials to accomplish her order.

Mary W. therefore requests for a loan of USD 150, which will be given in kind, to enable her purchase materials for knitting the tablecloths. The repayment for this loan will be 8 -14 months. Given this loan Mary will have an increased number of orders to make tablecloths which will generate more income. Mary promises to train at least three people from her community how to knit, and also employ two people to help with the increased workload.

loans.use: To purchase knitting wool, material and knitting thread

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa has 6 years of experience in this business.
He has transported  grass with a car, which is rented by him.
The first time he borrowed $600 and bought 4 wheels.
The second time he borrowed $800 and repaired the car. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy this car.
Isa is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in  Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has a child.

loans.use: To buy a car which he now rents.

texts.en:
Seymur has been a cattle breeder since 2005. He works very hard for the success of his children. He wants to improve his business and his revenue, which will result in better living conditions for his family.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought 2 calves.Now he applies for a loan of $1000 to buy a cow. 
Seymur is 40 years old,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.

Halima is married with one child. She lives in Tandika area in Dar es Salaam. Halima owns a food shop near her residence. She sells maize flour,rice, beans, cassava flour and other cereals.

Halima thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. She was able to a add stock of maize flour, rice, beans, cassava flour and other cereals. She is now requesting a second loan to improve her business. The loan will be used to add some dry food items which she does not have in her shop, like dengu, chooko, wheat flour, sorghum and sardines. She will also purchase some glass display cases for attractive display. She is in need of USD 550 to implement her plan.

Hassan is married and has four children. One of his sons is in Secondary school. Hassan lives in the Buza area of Dar es Salaam. He runs a fruit and vegetable stall outside his house. He has been in this business for more than six years now. Hassan grows vegetable himself and sells them in his stall.

Hassan thanks all his lenders for his first loan with Kiva. The loan was of much help to him. He was able to a add stock of insecticides and buy a spraying pump. Hassan is now requesting a second loan with Kiva to strengthen his business. The loan will be used to add more fruits and vegetables, which he does not produce himself, and to start selling some staple food items like wheat flour, maize flour and rice. A loan of USD 550 will help him implement his plans.

Shani lives in the Kigogo area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She runs a food vending business near her residence.

Shani thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. With the loan she was able to buy some hygienic food supply materials, cleaning materials and food packaging materials. She is now requesting a second loan with Kiva. With this loan she plans to add a stock of some food items like rice, beans and maize flour. She also needs to add chairs and tables to accommodate more customers, especially during peak hours. She needs USD 550 to implement her plan.

Mubariz has had his own auto repair business since 2005.
Before he did not have the necessary equipment and it was a problem for him. 
Then he decided to borrow $600 and he bought welding apparatus.
He has a lot of clients and he must buy spare parts for his work.
He has been able to support his family with this business.
He can not effectively meet the demands of his clients because he doesn't have the necessary spare parts. 
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy spare parts in order to be able to offer a better services to his clients and attract more clients.
Mubariz is 36 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has a child.

Gulebeste has had 2 years of experience in this business. She plans to expand the dairy farming in order to increase the milk.
She wants to raise her income level to be able to meet the needs of her family.
With her first loan she borrowed $400 and bought a meaty bull-calf.
This has enabled her to cover most of her household expenses.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to a buy milk cow in order to increase the number of dairy cows, which will enable her to sell more milk.
Gulebeste is an Internally Displaced Person, (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. She is married and has 2 children.

Djumshud is a married man with 2 children. He is 41 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. 
4 years ago he decided to be mini bus driver.
He has a lot of clients.
He wants to improve his business in order to provide better service to his clients and with the earnings to support his family.
Having borrowed $400 he repaired seats. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts.

Vaheddin is 41 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ahmedbeyli village. He is married and has 2 children.
He has run this business for 8 years.
This business has allowed his family to have a better income. 
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 2 meaty bull-calves.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson W. is 54 years old, is married and has 5 children. He also takes care of his two grandchildren, the children of his daughter. He decided to take up the responsibility of his grandchildren together with their mother (his daughter) since she had the two children out of wedlock. Rather than send his daughter away, he encouraged and cautioned her to take care of herself not to get another child until she is ready to take care of them. They live in Kayole, an informal settlement area within Nairobi. In addition, Mr. W. is a church pastor, and he also supports some of his church members.

Wilson has been a carpenter now for a period of four years and apart from that, he also does welding. He started by doing small contracts from schools within his community. It was not an easy start but he was driven by determination since he wanted to be involved in another activity besides being a pastor. He borrowed Ksh 20,000.00 (USD 285) from a friend and bought the basic items he needed in the carpentry workshop together with timber. He has been able to settle this loan with time and although he has had many difficulties, he has seen his business expanding through the many contracts he is getting. His major setback is the ability to deal with the growing number of contracts since his customers pay a minimal deposit, barely enough to enable him to make purchases for the requirements. He is now intending to make a set of desks and chairs for two schools within his community before schools reopen for the second term.

A loan of USD 900 is Wilson’s plea to enable him purchase a drilling machine, timber, block board, and the backs and seats for the chairs.
