These will go a long way in enabling him to make a wide range of quality furniture for his customers in order to attract additional customers, and to retain the existing ones, especially from the nearby schools. This will also enable him to gain additional income that will help him to support both his family and members of his church better. The repayment period of the loan is 15 – 18 months.

loans.use: Purchase of a drilling machine and carpentry materials

texts.en: Before receiving a loan, Ayubjon made cooking batteries from an aluminium sheet. They were sold directly to clients and in part sold in markets. As raw materials were scarce (160 kg. Aluminium), he  produced in small numbers (45 cooking batteries per  month). As aluminium steel cost a lot (3 somoni per 1 kg.), Ayubjon did not have enough capital for wholesale purchase of raw materials. Receiving the first loan, he bought up raw materials from different building materials sales. Ayubjon has increased the volume of manufacture, and his clients have already started to order. Step by step he now has the opportunity of wholesale purchase of raw materials. Ayubjon has put all his profits into active capital and gradually has increased the volume of production. To output cooking batteries he has added two more kinds of production.  Now there are about 2.5 tons of raw material and his factory shop works without days off. The basic change to his business is that Ayubjon can buy raw material in large amounts and plans to increase the range of goods to  create additional profits. The current request for a $1000 loan is to increase the commodity circulation.

Eloglan has been engaged in this business for 5 years.
He is a very active and responsible person.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 2 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
Eloglan is 36, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Mahmudlu village. He is married and has 2 children.

Kamala has run this business for 4 years. She is 47 years old,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village. She is married and has 2 children.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought 2 calves. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves.
With this business she meets the needs of her family.

Nadir is an honest and hardworking person. He is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village.
Three years ago he purchased a car and became a taxi driver.
This business is the only source of his income.
Having borrowed $400 he bought spare parts.
Now he needs a loan of $700 to repair his car in order to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.
He wants to repair his car because everyone wants to travel in a smart and comfortable car.

Rafik is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 2 years. He enjoys looking after calves. 
Having borrowed $600 he bought 3 calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow.
He is 54 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.

This 37-year-old man is a taxi driver. He has been in this business for 3 years. He has a problem with his car. This car is broken very often and it doesn't allow him to improve his business. This business is the only source of income for his family.
Having borrowed $400 he bought 5 wheels.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to repair the engine of his car.
This loan will help him to improve his income.
Mirza is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.

Alovsat started his own small business 3 years ago. This is his only source of income.
He wants his children to be able to finish school and to have their incomes from work help his family.He needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves.
This 50-year-old man is a father of 4 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village.

Danina is divorced and has one grown son. She and her son own a small precision glass-cutting and dicing workshop located in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Close proximity to busy train and bus stations makes this a very favorable location for business growth. Danina and her son use both thermal and score and break methods in their work to cut glass that is used in a variety of applications. They have about $4,000 of working capital in the business and their monthly gross revenue amounts to $1,000. Danina has been working in this business for 10 years. Originally, she started her entrepreneurial activity as a grocery retailer. However, later she joined her son in operating their glass-cutting and dicing workshop. Hard-work and tenacity have helped this family enterprise reach sustainability and success. Danina would like to get a loan for $1,200 to buy sheets of glass which are 3mm or less in thickness for her workshop. The extra supply of glass will help her and her son produce more material for architectural and design applications, as well as for tile, signage and lighting uses. Danina is hoping that increased sales activity will generate the necessary funds to sustain their business as well as to meet her family’s needs.

Даніна – розлучена, в неї є дорослий син. Вони з сином тримають майстерню з нарізки скла в центрі Івано-Франківська. Зовсім недалеко знаходиться залізниця та автовокзал, а це, в свою чергу, сприяє розвитку бізнесу. Даніна використовує різні методи обробки скла, яке потім використовується в різних сферах підприємствах. Зараз в них приблизно 4000 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісячний дохід складає 1000 доларів. Даніна займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Починала свою підприємницьку діяльність вона з торгівлі харчами. Однак, пізніше Даніна приєдналася до свого сина в його майстерні з нарізки скла. Наполеглива праця та цілеспрямованість допомогли цьому сімейному бізнесу стати стабільним та успішним. Даніна хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати скло товщиною не більше 3мм для роботи майстерні. Додаткові запаси скла допоможуть Даніні та сину виготовляти більше матеріалів для різних гілок підприємств. Даніна сподівається, що збільшення обсягів продажу допоможе їй отримати необхідні кошти для того, щоб розвивати бізнес та забезпечувати потреби власної родини.

Ekaterina loves candy. This is essentially what led her to start her business selling candy and baked goods. She runs a small kiosk at the local market that has quickly acquired a reputation for high quality service. After 5 years in business, Ekaterina’s business has blossomed due to her entrepreneurial skills and the kindness she shows to her customers. Today her business yields $2,000 a month in gross income with an investment of $3,000 in inventory. Ekaterina has requested a loan for $700 to purchase candy and baked goods in bulk. This amount will enable her to purchase 230 kg of sweets, paying only around $2-6 per kg. She believes that broadening her product line will increase her income and allow her to improve the well-being of her family. Ekaterina is raising her 5 year old son by herself. She would like to invest some of her earned income to have a natural gas pipeline put into the house where they currently live so they can enjoy cheaper hot water and heating.

Катерина дуже любить солодощі. Саме це й спонукало її почати власну справу з продажу солодкого та кондитерських виробів. Катерина – власниця невеличкого кіоску на місцевому ринку, який швидко здобув гарну репутацію завдяки високоякісному обслуговуванню. Цим бізнесом Катерина займається вже 5 років. Він став успішним завдяки її завзятості та ввічливості у роботі покупцями. Зараз в неї 2000 доларів щомісячного доходу, в товар вкладено приблизно 3000 доларів. Катерина просить про позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб оптом закупити солодощі та кондитерські вироби. Ця сума дасть їй можливість придбати 230 кг цукерок, заплативши лише приблизно 2-6 доларів за кілограм. Катерина вважає, що збільшення асортименту товарів збільшить її прибуток та сприятиме покращенню рівня життя її родини. Катерина сама виховує 5-річного сина. Вона планує використати частину отриманого від торгівлі прибутку для того, щоб прокласти газовий трубопровід у власній оселі, завдяки якому в неї з’виться гаряча вода та опалення.

Eynulla has run this business for 4 years.
He wants to offer all this children an education that allows them to continue their own life and to be an honest and hard-working people.
He needs to work very hard every day to cover family expenses.
Having borrowed $600 he repaired this car.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy this car, which he has rented.
Eynulla is a 40 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is marriedand has 3 children.

Elena is a widow and has one grown daughter. She sells clothing in a little vending kiosk at the local market in Melitopol. Elena has a reputation as a hard-worker and goal-oriented person. Whenever she can, she strives to sell her merchandise at lower prices to create a competitive edge over other retailers. Elena has had a positive relationship with Nadiya Ukraine, which is her hope for future business development. Her 15 years of experience in clothes retailing give her confidence that her income will continue to rise and enable her to financially assist her daughter and grandson. Today Elena is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase 30 women’s skirts. She believes that by updating her inventory she will be able to maintain previous customers and hopefully attract new ones.

Олена – вдова, в неї є доросла донька. Вона торгує одягом в одному з невеличких кіосків на ринку в Мелітополі. Олена – дуже працьовита та цілеспрямована. Вона намагається встановлювати помірні ціни на свій товар для того, щоб мати певну перевагу поряд з іншими підприємцями на ринку. В Олени склалися дуже гарні стосунки з „Надією України”, вона сподівається і надалі розвивати власний бізнес завдяки доступним кредитним послугам. Олена займається продажем одягу вже 15 років. Вона має надію, що її прибутки зростатимуть і надалі, а це, в свою чергу, надасть їй можливість фінансово підтримувати доньку та онука. Зараз Олена просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб придбати 30 жіночих спідниць. Вона вважає, що урізноманітнивши свій асортимент, вона зможе зберегти клієнтуру та привабити багато нових покупців.

Mr. Willy G. and his wife, Mrs. Martha Elena Mamani Ramos, work manufacturing metal frames and moldings for furniture. They later sell their products to artesan carpenters. Their workshop is located in their home in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz. They are both 35 years old. They have one son, and have worked in this business for 10 years.

This is the fourth time that they have come to Impro to apply for a loan with which to buy tools and improve their earnings. Their history in the institution classifies them as "Client 1", since they have been punctual making their monthly payments. They have also shown advances in the manufacture of their products. The loan for which they have applied will be used to buy iron, the raw material of their work.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Willy G., junto con su esposa,la señora Martha Elena Mamani Ramos, se dedican a la elaboración de molduras y agarradores metálicos para muebles que luego venden a artesanos carpinteros. Su taller de halla ubicado en su domicilio ubicado el la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Ambos tienen 35 años, tienen una hija y trabajan en este rubro hace 10 años.

Esta es la cuarta vez que recurren a Impro para obtener un crédito y con los que compraron herramientas y mejoraron sus ingresos. Su historial el nuestra institución los clasifica como clientes 1 al ser puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales y mostrar avances en la elaboración de sus productos. El monto solicitado estará destinado a la compra de fierro que se constituye en la materia prima de su actividad.

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios en nuestra institución le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir el préstamo.

Igor S. is married with two daughters. He has a small business selling children’s clothing in the local market. The business, which he has had for nine years, has been the only source of income for his family. Presently, he has about $4,000 of working capital and his monthly net profit amounts to $1,200. Ivan has proven himself to be a responsible, determined, hard-working business owner. Previous loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped Igor expand his business, open a second vending facility and improve his family’s living standards. Eventually, he hopes to have a third vending facility in a different location. Igor has requested a loan for $1,200 to increase his inventory. He is planning to purchase a supply of jeans, skirts, and light dresses. A good assortment of clothing items will help him serve more clients, handle tough competition and further expand his business. Profits generated will promote the continued growth of Igor’s business and provide a good income for his family.

Ігор Слабий – одружений, в нього двоє донечок. Він займається бізнесом з продажу дитячого одягу на одному з ринків міста. Ігор став підприємцем ще 9 років тому. Його бізнес є єдиним джерелом доходів для його родини. Зараз в Ігоря приблизно 4000 доларів робочого капіталу, його щомісячний прибуток складає 1200 доларів. Ігор – дуже відповідальний, наполегливий та працьовитий. Завдяки позикам від „Надії України” Ігор зміг розширити торгівлю, відкрити другу торгову точку та покращити рівень життя власної родини. В майбутньому він сподівається відкрити третю торгову точку. Ігор просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити свій асортимент. Він планує купити джинси, спідниці та легкі сукні за оптовими цінами. Широкий асортимент товарів допоможе йому обслужити більше клієнтів, подолати велику конкуренцію й розвивати власний бізнес і надалі. Отримані прибутки сприятимуть розширенню торгівлі та забезпечать стабільний прибуток для родини Ігоря.

Nataliya is married and has three children. For awhile she worked as an employee in a store. However, Nataliya has always wanted to be self-employed. Five years ago she started a little business with only a small kiosk selling children’s clothing and shoes in the local city market. Today her business is doing well. She maintains around $1,400 of working capital and her monthly gross income amounts to around $800. Nataliya is a focused, hard-worker. Many weeks she will work without days off to make sure her family members have everything they need. Because of her cheerfulness and customer-friendly service her total number of customers is constantly growing. Sixteen loans that she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” have also assisted the growth of her sales. Nataliya would like to get a loan of $1,200 to increase her available stock. She is planning to purchase 50 sweaters and 100 pairs of shoes that will re-supply her inventory and encourage more customers to come and buy from her. One of Nataliya’s long-term plans is to open a new vending facility. She believes that this loan will help her succeed in her business endeavors and boost her economic activity.

Наталія – одружена, в неї троє дітей. Вона певний час працювала продавцем у крамниці. Однак, Наталія завжди хотіла працювати на себе. П’ять років тому вона відкрила невеличкий кіоск з продажу дитячого одягу та взутті на одному з місцевих ринків. Зараз бізнес Наталії успішно розвивається. В неї приблизно 1400 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісячний дохід складає 800 доларів. Наталія – наполеглива та працьовита. Вона часто працює без вихідних для того, щоб забезпечити своїх рідних усім необхідним. Завдяки привітному та ввічливому обслуговуванню кількість її постійних клієнтів увесь час зростає. Шістнадцять позик, які Наталія отримала від „Надії України”, сприяли збільшенню обсягів продажу. Наталія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів. Вона планує закупити 50 светрів та 100 пар взуття, щоб урізноманітнити вибір одягу та спонукати клієнтів приходити до неї по покупки. В майбутньому Наталія планує відкрити нову торгову точку. Вона вважає, що позика сприятиме розвитку торгівлі та допоможе їй досягти успіху.

Ofelya is 51 years old. She is married and has a child. She provides for her family by selling milk, cheese and cream. In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought a meaty bull-calf.
This business is the only source of income for her and her family .
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow in order to improve the production of cheese, milk, cream.
She has runs this business for 15 years. 
Ofelya is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ahmedbeyli village.

Tatyana’s family consists of her husband and two grown sons. Nearly 10 years ago she decided to open a little wall-paper kiosk, a business she says was her calling. She was able to purchase a kiosk in the very center of the market that is easily accessible to many shoppers. Today, Tatyana’s business yields $450 a month in profit with an investment of $2,000 in inventory. Tatyana sees a great opportunity for business grown as spring approaches. Wall-papering is a very popular way to decorate in Ukraine and many people are ready to begin remodeling work after the cold and wet winter months are past. Tatyana’s expertise in quality wall-paper is greatly appreciated by her customers. Her desire to assist clients and her entrepreneurial spirit are part of what makes her business successful. On a personal level, Tatyana desires to invest her earned profits into her son’s college education. Tatyana has requested a loan for $1,000 to broaden the assortment of wall-paper she offers at her kiosk so she will be ready for the busy season. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. We believe that this loan will be a big help to Tatyana as she looks for ways to increase her business activity.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих синів. Майже 10 років тому вона вирішила відкрити власний бізнес з продажу шпалер, відчувала, що це – її покликання. Вона викупила кіоск в центрі ринку, завдяки зручному розташуванню з’явилося багато покупців. Зараз Тетяна отримує приблизно 450 доларів прибутку щомісяця, в товар в неї вкладено 2000 доларів. Тетяна розуміє, що навесні торгівля буде збільшуватися. Навесні, після холодного зимового періоду, багато людей роблять ремонт у власних оселях, використовуючи для цього різноманітні шпалери. Тетяна знається на своєму товарі, це дуже цінують її покупці. Бажання допомогти кожному клієнту та талант підприємця сприяють успіху її бізнесу. Тетяна піклується про потреби родини, а, отже, планує вкласти частину отриманого від торгівлі прибутку у навчання сина в університеті. Тетяна просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент шпалер та підготуватися до весняного сезону. Вона – дуже надійний клієнт, давно працює з „Надією України”. Ця позика допоможе Тетяні досягти своєї мети та розширити власний бізнес.

History of the Client: Mr. Martín P. Quispe works in car maintenance, fixing springs and brake shoes. He lives in Sud Lipe Street in the city of El Alto. His workshop is located on Buenos Aires Avenue in the city of La Paz. He is 36 years old with 6 children, all minors still under his care.

Mr. P. has one employee. The loan will be used to buy tools and raw materials in order to satisfy the demand for his services from his clientele.

This is his third credit with Impro. His history with this institution classifies him as "Client 1", that is to say, with excellent fulfillment of the payment of his obligation.

His previous credit history allows him access to this new loan, since he has experience in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: El Sr. Martín P. Quispe se dedica al mantenimiento de vehículos (Arreglo de muelles y balatas). Vive en la Calle Sud Lipe de la ciudad de El Alto, su taller se encuentra ubicado en la Av. Buenos Aires de la Ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 36 años y 6 hijos, todos menores de edad y bajo su dependencia.

El Sr. Martín trabaja con un empleado; y el destino del crédito será para compra de herramientas y materia prima para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda de clientela.

Es su tercer crédito en Impro, su historial en nuestra institución califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente de pago de su obligación.

Sus antecedentes crediticios le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

Elena is married and has one child. She successfully manages a little shop where she sells a variety of non-perishable grocery items such as mayonnaise, ketchup, and canned goods. Elena has been involved in this type of business for more than 6 years. Through her perseverance and hard-work she has been able to reinvest profits into her business and see it develop. Today her total net income amounts to $400 a month and she has about $1,200 invested in inventory. Elena’s enthusiasm and the relationships she has built with her customers show that she is doing what she does best – cheerfully serving others. She has created a loyal base of customers that will always try to stop by and purchase from her shop. She is a warm and communicative woman, who looks forward to what the future holds. Her desire is to be a help to her husband as they both strive to support and raise their child. Elena is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase variety of grocery items in bulk. She believes that this will eliminate the need for her to buy products as often and therefore save her some money on transportation and unloading.

Олена – одружена, в неї одна дитина. Вона – власниця успішного бізнесу з продажу товарів харчування, а саме, майонезу, кетчупу та консервованих продуктів. Олена займається цим бізнесом вже більше 6 років. Завдяки наполегливій праці її прибутки постійно зростали, вона вкладала отримані гроші в подальший розвиток бізнесу і досягла успіху. Зараз чистий прибуток Олени складає приблизно 400 доларів, в товар в неї вкладено 1200 доларів. Ентузіазм Олени та добрі, дружні стосунки, які склалися в Олени з її клієнтами, підтверджують, що вона займається своєю справою, привітно обслуговуючи покупців. В Олени є свої клієнти, які завжди приходять по покупки до неї. Вона - дуже привітна та комунікабельна жінка, завжди з оптимізмом дивиться в майбутнє. Олена усіма силами намагається допомагати чоловіку, вона працює для того, щоб підтримувати родину та забезпечувати дитину усім необхідним. Олена просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб оптом закупити велику партію продуктів харчування. Вона вважає, що закупивши достатню кількість товарів одноразово, вона зможе зекономити кошти на транспортних витратах та розвантаженні.

Ibolya is a widow lady and lives by herself. All of her children are grown. After she retired she was forced to find ways to sustain herself and she wanted to help her family. That is how she started as market vendor selling groceries in the central market. Later she changed the type products she sold and moved her business to a different location. Currently, Ibolya runs a kiosk selling slippers, underwear and plastic bags. She has been in business now for 10 years. Her daily sales revenue is about $30-40. Ibolya is always very affable and polite with her customers. Her good managerial skills help her keep expenses to a minimum. The new market where Ibolya works is the only one in the neighborhood and there are no other entrepreneurs offering the same type of goods. This is another reason for Ibolya’s high sales and the success of her trade. Ibolya is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her inventory. She is planning to re-stock her kiosk with household items and slippers to boost up her sales. Being a good steward of the money she receives, Ibolya will manage this loan efficiently and repay it on time.

Іболя – вдова, живе одна. Усі її діти вже дорослі й самостійні. Після виходу на пенсію Іболя була змушена шукати можливостей забезпечувати себе та ще й допомагати рідним. Отже, вона вирішила піти торгувати на ринок, почала продавати харчі. Пізніше вона змінила тип товарів, почала торгувати в іншому місті. Зараз в Іболі є власний кіоск з продажу капців, білизни та пластикових пакетів. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Щодня вона заробляє приблизно 30-40 доларів. Іболя – дуже привітна та ввічлива з покупцями. Її вміння розпоряджатися грошима допомагає їй звести витрати до мінімуму. Новий ринок, на якому працює Іболя, єдиний в районі, до того ж там немає інших підприємців, які торгують аналогічними товарами. Ці фактори також сприяють збільшенню обсягів продажу та успіху торгівлі. Іболя просить про позику в 200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити свій асортимент. Вона планує збільшити кількість товарів та розширити торгівлю. Ми переконані, що вміння розумно витрачати отримані кошти обов’язково допоможе Іболі вчасно сплатити позику без жодних прострочень.

Ivan runs a business selling women’s clothing and shoes in the local market. He decided to start his own business because he believes it is the only way to sustain a family in the present economic situation in Ukraine. He has been in this business for five years now and sees about $1,000 in gross revenue per month. Ivan is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” that have helped the expansion of his business. Last year Ivan opened two new vending facilities which have promoted solid growth in his sales. Ivan is requesting a loan of $500 for several reasons. He is planning to re-supply his inventory and purchase seasonal items which he can get at wholesale prices. It will also give him the resources to open another vending kiosk. The loan will be beneficial for Ivan’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for Ivan and his family.

Іван займається бізнесом з продажу жіночого одягу та взуття на місцевому ринку. Він вирішив почати власний бізнес, тому що вважає це єдиною можливістю забезпечувати родину в тих економічних обставинах, які на сьогоднішній день склалися в України. Іван займається цим бізнесом вже 5 років, його щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 1000 доларів. Іван – дуже цілеспрямований та наполегливий. Він цінує доступність кредитних послуг від „Надії України”, які сприяли розширенню його бізнесу. Минулого року Іван відкрив дві нових торгових точки, що, в свою чергу, прискорило розвиток торгівлі. Іван просить про позику в 500 доларів через декілька причин. Він хоче поповнити асортимент товарів, придбати сезонний одяг за оптовими цінами. До того ж він планує використати отримані кошти для того, щоб відкрити ще один кіоск. Позика допоможе бізнесу Івана залишатися конкурентноспроможним та сприятиме подальшому росту торгівлі, що, в свою чергу, збільшить прибутки Івана та покращить фінансове становище його рідних.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a single mother with two children. She runs a small business selling flowers in downtown Uzhgorod. Nataliya does special decorating of cars for weddings, makes bridal bouquets and creates the finest floral arrangements for various special occasions. Her flower business has been the only source of income for her family. Nataliya has been in this business for ten years. Her friendly, prompt service brings back many repeat customers. Currently, she makes around $40-80 per day in gross revenue. Nataliya is a very enterprising lady. She believes she is nowhere near the limit for her business and is planning to open a unique flower storehouse unlike any other in the city. Nataliya is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase some equipment she will need for her flower storehouse. She’d like to buy a self-contained floral refrigeration system and condensate evaporators that will help keep her plants fresh and fragrant. Nataliya would also like to buy a variety of spring flowers such as daisies, tulips, carnations, daffodils and roses for further retail sale. Being a plant-lover, Nataliya knows that an assortment of flowers will brighten up many people’s hearts after the long, gray winter. She believes that with financial assistance and her commitment to provide the highest quality fresh flowers at competitive prices, she will not only be able to meet the needs of more customers, but she will also be able to provide a better livelihood for her family.

Наталія сама виховує двох дітей. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу квітів в центрі Ужгорода. Наталія прикрашає весільні машини, виготовляє весільні букети та створює прекрасні квіткові композиції для подарунків з будь-якої іншої нагоди. Її бізнес – єдине джерело доходів для її родини. Наталія займається цим бізнесом вже десять років. Завдяки її привітному та пунктуальному обслуговуванню в неї з’вилося багато постійних клієнтів. Зараз вона заробляє приблизно 40-80 доларів за день. Наталія – дуже заповзятлива жінка. Вона не хоче зупинятися на досягнутому, в майбутньому планує відкрити унікальну квіткову крамничку в своєму місті. Наталія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати необхідне обладнання для своєї крамниці. Вона хотіла б придбати облаштування для підтримки необхідного температурного режиму та розприскувачі води для того, щоб зберігати квіти свіжими. До того ж Наталія планує оптом закупити різноманітні квіти, а саме, ромашки, тюльпани, нарциси, троянди, тощо для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Наталія сама дуже полюбляє рослини, а, отже, вона сподівається, що широкий асортимент квітів в її крамниці зігріє серця багатьох людей після довгої сірої зими. Вона також вважає, що фінансова підтримка та відданість своїй справі допоможуть їй придбати найкращі квіти за помірними цінами, задовольнити потреби покупців та покращити рівень життя її власної родини.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her flower shop

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
For Zoya, selling sporting goods has been a family business. She and her husband have successfully operated two sales kiosks for nearly eleven years, one located in a market and another at a nearby shopping center, that offer a variety of sports related clothing and equipment. Zoya and her husband have sought to create an atmosphere that encourages customers to come back to their stores. One of the ways they have tried to accomplish this is to consistently replenish their stock with newer products. Their current net profit amounts to around $400 per month. Zoya is an entrepreneur who is full of life. Her ability to accomplish her goals makes her a solid client with Nadiya Ukraine. Her entrepreneurial spirit and good relationship with customers has helped place the business in a favorable position to grow. Ensuring growth for the business will allow her to see her daughter receive a college education upon her graduation from high school this year. Zoya has requested $1200 in order to purchase spring items such as shorts and t-shirts and some additional sports equipment. She and her husband want to be prepared for what they hope will be another busy and profitable sports season in the Ukraine.

Бізнес з продажу спорттоварів, яким займається Зоя, давно став сімейним. На протязі останніх 11 років вони з чоловіком володіють двома кіосками: один з них знаходиться на ринку, інший – в торговому центрі. Торгують вони спортивним одягом та супровідними товарами. Зоя доклала багато зусиль для того, щоб створити привітну атмосферу, яка спонукає покупців повертатися до її кіоску знову й знов. Цьому сприяв також й широкий асортимент товарів, який можна знайти в їхньому кіоску. Зараз її щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 400 доларів. Зоя – дуже життєрадісна жінка. Її здатність досягати своїх цілей допомогла їй зарекомендувати себе як відповідального клієнта в роботі з „Надією України”. Заповзятливість та привітність у роботі з покупцями дають їй певну перевагу серед інших торговців на ринку. Подальше розширення її бізнесу сприятиме отриманню стабільного прибутку, що, в свою чергу, допоможе Зої заплатити за навчання її доньки в університеті цього року. Зоя просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб закупити весняні товари, а саме, шорти, футболки та додатковий спортивний інвентар. Вона хоче придбати усе необхідне для того, щоб підготуватися до ще одного прибуткового спортивного сезону в Україні.

loans.use: Buy sports equipment and seasonal clothes

loans.name: Santos Mercedes

texts.en: My name is Santos Mercedes, and I work making piñatas and selling birthday party items. My clients keep coming back for the beautiful piñatas and good prices. Currently, I need to prepare for the Children’s Day celebrations by making piñatas beforehand and working to be able to sell them without any delays.

loans.use: Purchase of colorful paper, glue, wire, newspaper, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en: My name is Ana, and I work selling roasted meat at night in my area. Normally, people in my area eat out during the weekends, so I use the weekends as an opportunity to sell meat, yucca, pastries and pupusas. With the income earned, I am able to help support my children and give them an education.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal, meat, condiments, firewood, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 34, and her husband Quang is 36. They have one child who is a student in junior high school. They have no land, but have rented 7,000 square meters from a neighbor. Hai's husband cultivates the papaya trees daily, plus a few kinds of vegetables. Hai is in charge of selling them at the local market.

At the present time their current papaya crop is ready for harvest. Their main income from produce is about $9 per person/month. Now they plan to expand and improve their papaya production, so they need a loan of $75 in order to buy the papaya seeds and some fertilizer. After they learned about the Kiva program from the staff of Mekong Plus, they hoped that they would B. given a loan so that they could initiate their plan. They promise to repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase papaya seeds and some fertilizer in to expand and improve their papaya productivity

texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy A. works selling children's shoes. She has worked in this field for more than 30 years. Her sales stand is located in Graneros Street in the city of La Paz, a popular commercial street where all types of products are sold. She lives in her own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area. She lives alone. The income from her business allows her to cover her living expenses. She has one employee with her in the business.

Mrs. A. has worked with Impro for 10 years and with her existing credit history she is able to access another loan, since her experience in her business will give her the earnings with which to pay back her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Nancy A., se dedica a la venta de calzados para niños, trabajando en esta actividad hace mas de 30 años; su puesto de venta esta ubicado en la calle Graneros de la ciudad de La Paz, una calle de comercio popular donde se comercializan todo tipo de productos. Vive en casa propia en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, y vive sola, esta fuente de ingreso le permite poder cubrir sus gastos de subsistencia. Para el desempeño de su trabajo cuenta con una empleada.

Trabaja con Impro 10 años, y de acuerdo a su antecedente crediticio puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

I have been a traveling vendor of creams, lotions and makeup. My major clients are women in offices who purchase my products for themselves and their children. With this business I have been able to support my family, and I need to increase my inventory to improve my income.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Dunia Guadalupe

texts.en: I buy and sell new and used clothing since having more options causes my customers to buy more. I need capital to be able to stock my inventory and increase my income so that I can help and support my children and keep them in schools that will give them a good education.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing to sell: jeans, tee-shirts, skirts, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Etilma Candelaria

texts.en:
For the last three years I have dedicated myself to selling fried chicken on the outskirts of the city of Choluteca. This is a good spot since it's on the freeway, and a lot of drivers heading to El Salvador or other places stop here on their way. I need capital to invest in prime materials (beverages, chicken, water, tortillas, etc.), which will allow me to raise my income and help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace tres años me dedico a vender pollo frito en las afueras de la ciudad de Choluteca, este es un buen punto ya que esta en la carretera y se paran a comer viajeros hacia el Salvador o de otras comunidades. Necesito capital fresco para inventir en materia prima y de esta manera incrementar mis ingresos para ayudar a mi familia.

loans.use: Buy beverages, chicken, water, tortillas, etc.

loans.name: Isaura Esmeralda

texts.en:
My name is Isaura, and I run a bottled drink warehouse. I have dedicated myself to supplying businesses like refreshment stands, minimarts, restaurants and other neighborhood businesses. My husband helps me deliver to homes in other neighborhoods as well. As it gets warmer, my sales increase and I supply all types of businesses. All the products I distribute I get from the bottlers. Thanks to my business we have been able to help our children and now we are finishing building our home and extending the warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Isaura y tengo un deposito de refrescos de botellas, yo me dedico a surtir negocios como pulperias, mercaditos, comedores y otros negocios de mi comunidad. Mi esposo me ayuda entregando a domicilio en otras comunidades. En esta epoca de calor mis ventas aumentan ya que surto toda clase de negocios, los camines de las embotelladoras me entregan todo el producto para que yo lo distribuya. Gracias a mi negocio hemos podido ayudar a mis hijos y ahora estamos terminando de contruir nuestra casa y ampliar la bodega.

loans.use: Buy bottled drinks to sell to stores.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
My name is Gloria and I have dedicated myself to selling fresh seasonal fruits. I run my business in front of my house, and I also sell churros, drinks and candy. With this new income I can help my husband with family expenses, support my children's education and tend to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Gloria y me dedico a la venta de frutas de temporada, mi negocio esta frente a mi casa, tambien vendo churros, refrescos, dulces. Con los ingresos que percibo puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la familia, tambien apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios y me tiempo para poder atender mi casa.

loans.use: Buy fresh seasonal fruit, candy, churros, drinks, etc.

texts.en:
Married with six children, Mrs. Fonglo has thirty years of experience in the business of selling fruit, but has never had access to more than fifty dollars worth of capital. She sells mango, orange, and pineapple, depending on the season.

According to her experience and her needs in the fruit market, we think that increasing her sales by 100% will be a good business move for the beginning. With the money Mrs. Fonglo receives, she will be able to host a good fruit market once a week, and supply a portion of needs in the fruit market for the nearly 1000 people in her area.

With the loan of $100, she can count on buying bananas, pears, and oranges, purchasing at least $25 worth of each type of fruit.

payments.comment: Thank you  for your patience  which allowed us to  be on track. Fonglo was able to pay 22 dollars  as of today August 16 th and she is better  instruted from now going how she should  deal better with her repayement issue. Again thank you for helping her  to move forward her business.

Thank you so much for your support to my business 
Be blessed
"Thank you so much. I am done with my payment  and I thank you very much for your support. I look forward to  your further support  to increase  my business.Again thank you." She said

texts.en:
Maria Susana is married with three children. The oldest works to help the family and the younger two attend school. Her husband is a mechanic, however, his salary was not enough to provide for the family needs and the education of the three children. So three years ago, Maria started selling shoes. She began selling to her friends and family and now she has many clients. To satisfy the demand of her clients, Maria needs a $750 loan which she will use to offer better service and variety to her clients. You have the power to help this family and your support would be a great blessing.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Susana es casada y tiene tres hijos, el mayor de ellos trabaja para ayudar a la familia y los pequeños asisten a la escuela. Su esposo es mecánico, sin embargo, el salario que recibe no es suficiente para proporcionarle lo necesario a su familia y para darles educación a sus tres hijos. Razón por la cual Maria se decidió a iniciar con la venta de zapatos desde hace tres años, inició vendiendo entre sus amigos y familiares y ahora tiene muchos clientes.

Para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus productos Maria necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de 750 dólares que empelara para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y una mayor variedad. En tus manos está el poder ayudar a esta familia, tu apoyo será de gran bendición.

Maria de los Angeles is a very hardworking and responsible woman who started her own business to help her husband with household costs and the education of their children. Nine years ago she began selling vitamins and cosmetics in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. She is totally dedicated to her work and she has been able to maintain her business for so long because of her sales skill. Now, she needs a $750 loan to buy merchandise. She hopes that her clients will respond well to the new products and she promises to pay back the loan in 6-12 months. She needs your help, without a doubt. You have the power to give this family a better life.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

María de los Ángeles es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, que inició su propio negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y en la educación de sus hijos, hace nueve años que se dedica a la venta de productos vitamínicos y cosméticos en la localidad de Escobedo del estado de Nuevo León. Ella se dedica por completo a su trabajo y ha logrado permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio por su capacidad para las ventas.

En estos momentos ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $750 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, ella espera que sus clientes reciban de buena manera los productos y se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, no lo dudes, en tus manos está el poder darles una vida mejor a esta familia.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana sells candies and sodas in her neighborhood park. The majority of her clients are children. She says, "I have been coming to this park 9 years now and I put everything that I sell on a little table. I think it's time now to exchange my table for a well equipped little cart so that I can offer greater variety. To do this, I need an $800 loan."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Adriana se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos sus instalaciones son el parque de la colonia donde ella vive la mayoría de sus clientes son los niños. "Tengo ya 9 años viniendo a este parque y sobre una mesita pongo todo lo que vendo creo que ya es tiempo de cambiar mi mesa por un carrito bien equipado y así poder tener mas variedad para esto necesito una ayuda de $800.00 dlls

loans.use: To buy merchadise and a cart to sell candies/sweets.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau was born in 1979. Giau's wife is Nhung who was born in 1987. Now they have one child, aged two. Giau just left his parent's home for the first time, and he does not have enough capital to open a business.

Giau's family owns only a hut which is 30 square meters in area. He repairs bicycles and motorbikes from this home. The family income is about $8 per person/month. Giau needs a loan of $75 for buying tools and parts. Giau will repay monthly.

loans.use: To buy tools and parts for repairing bicycles and motorbikes.

texts.en: Gene is 41 year old mother of two.  She left her job as a teacher to set up a general store that retails household items in the area where she lives.  In addition, she is a full-time baker and supplies bread to local schools and to the general public.  Gene has gone through the 'TEACH' sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION.  She plans to utilise the KIVA loan to expand her store inventory and for additional baking supplies.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 55 year old mother of four children.  She has been selling charcoal in bags for the past seven years, and extends 30 days credit to her customers.  The rainy season is going to be starting soon, and she wants to use the facility to increase her inventory of charcoal so she can meet customers' demand during the major wet season.  She has completed the 'TEACH' sessions of KRABAN.  Hannah wants to use the proceeds of the KIVA loan to increase her supply of charcoal.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of charcoal to meet seasonal demands

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 41 year old mother four, some of whom are in still in school.  After her secondary education, she went to work since she was unable to finance her tertiary education. Presently, she retails ladies' wear and footwear in her community. Sarah is a graduate of the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions.  She intends to use the KIVA loan to secure a premises to display and sell her goods. She has already acquired a piece of land for that purpose using her meager resources.

loans.use: To acquire premises for a retail shop

texts.en: Aba, 24, is a young single woman without any children.  Without any schooling, she began her business at a tender age.  With the help of her older sister, she is sells ladies' footear.  Aba must travel over long distances by foot to service her existing customers, which is both very tiring as well as inefficient.  She intends to apply the KIVA loan to acquire a shed to sell her wares and to allow her to start a family.

Ekua is a 65 year old  mother of four.  She operates  a very unusual business: selling very expensive specialized woven  men's clothes that are worn on  important festive occasions.  Ekua has built up a large client base over many years.  The market for these clothes is very promising especially with the country's golden jubilee in full swing through 2007.  She intends to use the proceeds from the KIVA loan to increase her inventory of material and supplies.

Grace is a 55 year old mother of seven children. With only a basic education, she served a three year apprenticeship in sewing. When she completed the apprenticeship, she set up her own sewing shop and began training other less fortunate ones. Along the way Grace has added a general provisions store which has the potential to grow.

As a 'graduate' of KRABAN'S 'TEACH' learning sessions, she plans to use the KIVA loan to expand the inventory of her store.

Rose is a 56 year old mother of five.  She operates a beauty shop in her community and also sells ladies fashion wear and footear.  She has recently acquired an enclosed store where the goods are on display.  However, she has used most of her resources to acquire the premises.  She plans to use the proceeds of the KIVA loan to procure goods to increase her inventory.  Rose is a 'product' of KRABAN'S 'TEACH' sessions.

Ophie, 36,is married and has 3 children.  She started her operations 4 years ago and sells household provisions in her community.  Items sold include canned foods,beverages,soft drinks and bread as well as sachet water.

Ophie has benefited from the KRABAN'S 'TEACH' sessions in February,2007.  She intends to use the KIVA loan to add more items to her inventory.

Faustie is a 21 year old single woman.  She completed her secondary education, but was unable to continue further due to lack of money.  She started a business baking bread, and has been able to acquire a gas oven for her operations from the proceeds of her business.  She intends to use the proceeds of the KIVA loan so that she can pay cash for her flour purchases rather than buying flour on credit. This will enable Faustie to increase her profit margin and allow her to sell more baked goods.

Juana Gerro has worked hard to get ahead in life with her son. She lives in a very poor area. The need for an extra income, in order to improve her standard of living, got Juana started selling products for the home and cosmetics 12 years ago. Now she has many customers and receives many orders but has difficulty in obtaining the products.

Juana needs a loan of $375 which she will use to purchase products. She needs your support and care and promises to return the loan in 6 to 12 months. Your partnership will help keep her working, thus improving her and her son's life. Please decide to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana G. es una mujer que ha trabajado mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo, ella vive en un lugar de muy bajos recursos y la necesidad de tener un ingreso extra, para así tratar de mejorar su vida, hicieron que Juana se dedicara a la venta de productos para el hogar y cosméticos desde hace doce años. Ahora Juana tiene muchos clientes y ha levantado muchos pedidos de sus productos pero se le dificulta poder adquirirlos.

En estos momentos Juana necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizara en la compra de mercancía, ella necesita de tu apoyo y cariño y se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tu colaboración podrá ayudar a que ella pueda trabajar y así tener una mejor vida para ella y su hijo. Decídete a apoyarla.

Mrs. Hortencia lives in a low-income area. The need to have an income to support her family and her partner’s unemployment situation made her decide to start selling kitchen goods and bed spreads. She has three daughters, who are 12, 11, and 6 years old, and a 9 year-old son. She lives in Unión Libre with Francisco Ibarra, who helps her sell products door-to-door. Little by little, sales have increased, and Hortensia has reinvested in her business yet she does not have enough to cover her clients demand.

Hortencia is requesting a loan in the amount of US$300, which she will use to purchase merchandise in order to increase her sales and income. She plans on paying back the loan in a 3-6 months term. You can help this family get ahead, now is the moment to contribute.

La señora Hortencia vive en un lugar de muy bajos recursos, la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para mantener a su familia y la falta de empleo de su pareja hicieron que ella se dedicara a la venta de productos de cocina y colchas. Ella tiene tres hijas de 12, 11 y 6 años de edad y un hijo de 9 años, vive en unión libre con Francisco Ibarra, quien le ayuda a vender sus productos casa por casa. Poco a poco las ventas se han incrementado y Hortencia ha reinvertido en su negocio, pero no le es suficiente para satisface las demandas de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Hortencia requiere de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 300 dólares que utilizara para la compra de mercancía, para incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos, ella palea devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, hoy es el momento de cooperar.

San Juana is 34 years old, she is married and has two daughters who are 17 and 15 years old, and a son who is 10. Her husband has a temporary job as a lathe operator, and makes industrial parts. The low-income he earns, and the probability of him losing his job motivated San Juana three years ago to start her business selling gifts and treats. She’s found a way to support her family’s expenses and her children’s education. She’s worked hard to see results, and improve her family’s quality of life.

San Juana needs a loan in the amount of US$250, which she will use to purchase merchandise, to be able to offer her clients a wider variety of products, and improve her service. You can be an essential part of the growth of this business. It’s up to you to help this family, don’t hesitate any longer.

San Juana tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas de 17 y 15 años y un hijo de 10. Su esposo tiene un trabajo temporal de tornero, fabricando piezas industriales, el bajo ingreso que recibe y la posibilidad que tiene de perder su empleo, impulsaron a San Juana a iniciar su negocio de venta de novedades y regalos, desde hace tres años. Ella ha encontrado esta manera de apoyar a su familia en los gastos y en la educación de sus hijos, ha trabajado mucho para que su negocio pueda dar frutos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ahora San Juana necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad, y mejorar su servicio. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio. Esta en tus manos apoyar a esta familia, no lo dudes más.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.en:
Norma is married, has two kids who are 9 and 12 years old, her husband is an electrician and is self-employed. Four years ago, Norma started her business of making and selling school uniforms, since her husband had no job at the time. In order to cover household expenses, and have an extra income, she started with this trade she was already familiar with. She received a loan, and was able to buy a sewing machine to start working.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$825, which she will use to purchase fabrics, threads, and raw materials she needs to make the uniforms. She is eager to get ahead. Her great work has allowed her to continue with her business, and have clients who like her work. Norma would like her business to grow, and she needs your help and affection. You can help improve her life and her family’s.

La señora Norma es casada, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, su esposo es electricista y trabaja por su cuenta. Hace cuatro año que la señora inició su negocio de elaborar y vender uniformes escolares, porque su esposo no tenia trabajo y para poder salir de los gastos del hogar y obtener un ingreso extra, ella empezó con esto porque ya conoce este oficio, consiguió un préstamo y así fue como compro una máquina de cocer para elaborar sus costuras.

En estos momentos ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 825 dólares que empleara en la compra de telas, hilos y la materia prima que necesita para elaborar los uniformes. Ella tiene enormes deseos de superación, su buen trabajo le ha permitido continuar con su negocio y ubicarse en el gusto de sus clientes. Norma quiere que su negocio crezca y necesita tu cooperación y cariño, tú puedes hacer que mejore la vida de ella y de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, and raw materials.

texts.en:
Maria de Jesus is married, has three kids, and they are from Guadalajara, Jalisco state. They arrived to where they are currently located, Juarez, Nuevo Leon, to try to earn extra income to help her husband with their children’s education, and improve their family’s quality of life. Here, Maria started her business of selling clothes. A year ago, she started selling clothes at home to her neighbors and friends, and has now gained a lot of clients.

Now she wants to grow, and invest in merchandise in order to get a stand in the town’s market. This way, she will increase her sales, and will be able to earn more money. Maria only needs a loan in the amount of US$200, which she will use for this purpose. You can contribute to this business’ growth. This family needs your help. With your support, they can achieve great things, don’t hesitate any longer.

Maria de Jesús es casada, tiene tres hijos y son originarios de Guadalajara, en el estado de Jalisco, y se vinieron a su actual domicilio, a Juárez, Nuevo León, donde ella comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa, por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con la educación de sus tres hijos y así mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia. Hace un año, Maria comenzó vendiendo la ropa en su casa a sus vecinas y amigas, y se ha ganado muchas clientes.

Ahora ella quiere crecer e invertir en mercancías para poner un puesto en el mercado, con el que incrementara sus ventas y le será posible obtener más ganancias. Maria sólo necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizara con este fin. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, esta familia necesita de tu ayuda, con tu apoyo ellos pueden hacer grandes cosas, no lo dudes más.

Rosa Margarita is originally from Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, and has a little boy. Recently, she and her family moved to the city looking for better opportunities, and found a land in Juarez, where they currently live. Her husband is a self-employed construction worker, so he does not have a steady income. Since they are paying off their home, sometimes his income is not enough to cover the family’s expenses. For this reason, Rosa decided to open her business of selling snacks, with which she can help to cover household’s expenses.

Rosa needs a loan in the amount of US$200, which she will use to purchase merchandise in order to grow her business, and improve the way her store looks. Rosa needs your help. She is willing to work hard, and commits to paying back the loan in a 3 to 6 months term. You can help Rosa, don’t hesitate. She and her family sincerely thank you for any support you can offer.

La señora Rosa Margarita es originaria de Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León, y tiene un pequeño hijo. Recientemente ella y su familia, en busca de mejores oportunidades, llegaron a vivir a la zona metropolitana y consiguieron un terreno en Juárez, donde es su actual domicilio. Su esposo es albañil y trabaja por su cuenta, esto le impide tener un ingreso fijo y como están pagando su terreno, en ocasiones no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia. Ante esta situación, Rosa se decidió por abrir su negocio de venta de snack, con lo que puede contribuir a los gastos del hogar.

En estos momentos, Rosa necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizara en la compra de mercancía para hace creer su negocio y darle una mejor imagen a su establecimiento. Ella necesita de tu colaboración, esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho y se compromete a regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Rosa, no lo dudes, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas.

loans.name: Kelin Marinela

texts.en: I have been offering secretarial, photocopying and editing services for three years. I have various clients, lawyers and people from schools whom I help with papers and other projects. I also have Internet access, which I rent by the hour. My business is profitable and it is the only one of its kind in this part of the city.

loans.use: Purchase of paper, printer toner, tape, typewriter, envelopes, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
I have dedicated myself to selling used clothing for a number of years, and I have clients who provide me with good clothes for a good price. At the moment, I don't have any clothes to sell, so I need to get a supply and increase my sales. With the extra income I can help my family, especially my children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me dedico a la vanta de ropa usada al por menor, son varios los años y clientes que tengo a quien les brindo buena ropa y precios. En este momento me estoy quedando sin ropa por lo que necesito surtir y mejorar mis ventas. Con los ingresos que obtendre podre ayudar a mi familia especialmente a mis hijos.

Choluteca is located in the southern part of Honduras, the hottest region of the country. So I have dedicated myself to selling sweetened cold drinks made from all kinds of fruits. The kids especially enjoy the chocolate milk that I sell. I started my business two years ago. It keeps me quite busy, but helps me to provide for my family. The income is getting better, and aside from that, I enjoy serving my clients, espeically the kids.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Choluteca esta ubicada en la parte sur de Honduras, y esta zona es la mas caliente del pais, por eso me dedico a vender charamuscas de toda clase de frutas, a los niños les gustas especialmente las de coco con leche. Mi negocio lo inicie hace dos años, aunque es bastante trabajoso pero me ayuda a sostener a mi familia, los ingresos son buenos y aparte de eso me gusta atender a mis clientes especialmente a los niños.

Mrs. Agnès L. is married and the mother of three children. She sells beauty products in her own store, and has been involved with her business for the past 12 years. Mrs. L. believes that by increasing her working capital, she will be able to make more profit and provide for the needs of her children. With a loan of $200, she can add more beauty products such as hair-cream (pomade), hair clips, soap and perfume to her product line. With increased profits, Mrs. L. will be able to buy the products she will need if one of her children falls ill, in the tough conditions her family has seen. Her family has endured hard socio-economic conditions.

Mrs. L. represents a HELP Africa solidarity group called "Hope", which has collectively applied for a loan of $600. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

payments.comment: Thank you for your patience. As for today August 16 th Agnes paid 100 dolars. She  understands better  now the payement system  and we will  that  up. Again thank you for helping  the poor people.
Many thanks .Wish you sucess in your business as well.

Thank you for your big support. We look forward to your continueing support  to  the small business sector.You support makes a lot of changes in many people's life 
Thank you

Thank you so much for your support to Agnes' small business. Agnes  has kept her promise and paid her loan as scheduled. With that loan,  she was  able to use part of her benefit to  take care  of her children. Again thank you so much and look forward to supporting here again.

texts.en:
Married and mother of five children, Mrs. A. specializes in the preparation of pulp that she has been selling for one year, after having been the beneficiary of her first loan from HELP Africa.

She sells the pulp each morning and night, along with beans, millet, etc.

Preparation is composed of three ingredients: • Millet-based pulp • Sorghum • Maize

Mrs. A. is very limited by her current channels, despite the demand for her product. Her first loan was $75. Her pulp-making business is called “Akassa,” because students buy it during their breaks. It’s a pulp made of sorghum or of millet that is very good for children in school who do not have a way to buy anything more expensive to eat.

With the loan money, she can establish a monthly stock of the afore mentioned necessary ingredients. She will buy sugar, sorghum, millet, etc.

Mrs. A. is a member of the HELP Africa solidarity group “Godwin”, which collectively has applied for a loan of $300. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

payments.comment: Abiba was able to pay as of today August 16 th  2007  fifty dollars. Thank you for your patience. She beter understands  the system now and she should be able to keep the payement  forward.Again thank you
You made  my life more enjoyable . I feel happy with your support

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou
Thank you so much for suypporting her  business. I look forward  to  more   support into her future businesses

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is married and the mother of three children. She has stocked, resold, and specialized in the business of cereals (beans, corn and sorghum) since 2003. She keeps the cereals in 200 liter containers to avoid insects destroying it (an appropriate way to keep cereals without using pesticide). Corn is the staple food for Togolese; each day, the domestic caregiver provisions corn for the family to make local daily food (akume, mutu) and other corn-based recipes.

She disposes quickly of her stock. It is this that permits her to quickly achieve benefits and be able to make a profit to provide for the needs of her family. With this loan, she can account for the entirety of the needed corn stock.

Mrs. K. is a member of the group “Patience”, which has collectively applied for a loan of $600. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

payments.comment: Thank you for  your patience. Therese  paid as of today August 16 th, 2007  one hundred dollars. She will be able to keep  the ball runs as she  understands better the system now. Thank you for helping her

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou
Thank you so much for supporting Therese business    by giving her this loan  which has changed her live and the lives of her children .Thank you

texts.en:
Married and mother of five children, Mrs. Prezi A. started her cereal and yam business in the month of September 2006, after having been the beneficiary of her first loan from HELP Africa. Corn is the staple food base of Togo.

However, she did not have time for her business. She was uneasy about selling as well because of the high demand. A $100 augmentation in her capital allows her to supply the necessary amount of corn stock.

Mrs. Prezi A. is a member of the HELP Africa solidarity group “Debora”, which collectively has applied for a loan of $300. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

payments.comment: Thank you for helping Amah. She was able  to pay  70 dollars as of today August 16 th. From now going she will be able to keep the ball runs because she understands beter the system  and HELP Africa put more staff  to help them in the system .Again thank you
Thank you so much. I am gald with my business because you help me . Thank you
We really appreaciate your support for her business.She was able to  fulfill her dream  and pay back on time.We look forward  to you continuosly support  to  grow more  than before

texts.en:
Mrs. E. is married and the mother of five children. She has been in the business of improving charcoal for the the last 12 months. She has been very successful as the business uses new technology and is environmentally-friendly.

Mrs. E. is part of the HELP Africa solidarity group "ARCB", which collectively has applied for a loan of $600. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

payments.comment: Thank you for helping Essohanam. She was able  to pay  100 dollars as of today August 16 th. From now going she will be able to keep the ball runs because she understands beter the system  and HELP Africa put more staff  to help them in the system .Again thank you
Many Thank . You are my saviors

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou

Thank you very much for giving her this loan. With your support , she  was able  to increase her business  and consequently the profit  which she has used to take care of her  family
Again thank you , you all who have supported her

texts.en:
Ms. Martha has one year of experience in the business of selling cosmetics. Her mother helped her get started two years ago after she separated from her husband. That difficult time was what got her started working, in order to support her children. Already she has been able to purchase a glass case to exhibit her products in her home. She works every day of the week from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

Martha wants this loan in order to be able to invest in her products in wholesale quantities, and in that way obtain higher profits.

Martha is a single mother. She is 29 years old and has 2 children, both still in school. Presently she lives with her mother, who is helping her take care of her children while she works. She hopes, with this business, to be able to save toward the purchase of a home site. In this way she will be able to give a better quality of life for her children. For their sake she has succeeded in moving forward and she hopes to continue providing for them.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Diana has 3 years of experience with her business. Before that, she sold food from the front porch of her home. She and her husband then decided to get into the office supply business, which they now work at every day of the week from 7:00 AM until 8:00 PM. Also, on Sundays, Diana cuts hair for people she knows, which brings more income into the home.

Diana wants this loan in order to invest in paper products. Right now the school term is beginning and she has a lot of demand for school supplies.

Diana is married. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are still in school. Her husband works doing maintenance for a hotel in the city. Diana hopes, with the income generated from her business, to be able to complete construction on her home. In this way she can provide a better life for her children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.name: Rooseweli

texts.en:
Mr. Fredy has 15 years of experience selling breakfasts. Before that, he used to live in the country, and his brother came up with the idea of moving to the city. He started out working for his brother, and little by little he saved his money. With those savings, he was able to buy a home site here in Isla Trinitaria. Along with his wife, he began selling breakfasts at a place near his home. He works from Monday through Friday from 4:30 AM until 10:00 AM. In the afternoon he also sells juice by the glass.

Fredy wants this loan in order to invest part of it in supplies for the breakfasts. The rest he will use to pave the floor of the part of his home where he prepares the breakfasts to sell. Right now, the unpaved floor is soaking up water and there are lots of mosquitoes due to the wetness.

Fredy is married. He is 36 years old and has 3 children who are all in school. His wife helps him prepare the breakfasts. He hopes with this investment that his business will create more income so that he can make his home adequate.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in food supplies and improve his location.

texts.en:
Ricardo has one year of experience in this business. He is a recent school graduate. He came up with the idea to create a computer center, and told his parents about it. There is no such thing in the are where they live. His parents helped him out with a loan, which he used to make a good place in the home and to buy a computer. Today, he has three computers. He works every day of the week from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM. He also works in a place where they sell food; when he goes out, his brother is in charge of the business.

Ricardo wants this loan in order to invest in office supplies for his business, and also to paint a sign on the outside of the building so that more people will know it is there.

Ricardo is single. He is 21 years old. Currently he lives with his parents. He hopes will this loan that he will be able to increase his income, so that in the future his can improve the floor of his location, which is very low.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Josefina has 10 years of experience with this business. She learned the business form her mother by working with her from a very young age. She liked the work, and obtained the capital to start her own business. She works every day of the week from 6:00 AM until 10:00 AM, at a location near her home. Josefina wants this loan in order to be able to buy a secondhand freezer to store her products. Josefina is a single mother. She has been separated form her husband for 5 years. She is 46 years old and has 5 children, three of whom still live with her. The two oldest help her out when she needs it. The children's father works as a taxi driver and he helps her support them.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has 20 years of experience in the photography business. From a young age, his friends encouraged him to take photos, and he liked it. At that time, he took out a loan with which he bought a camera and started his business. In addition to that business, he also sells chickens by the pound in the neighborhood where he lives. He combines the two activities. His work starts at 6 AM with the chicken sales, and it ends at 6 PM at one of the schools of the area, taking photographs. He works every day of the week.

Francisco wants this loan to be able to invest in the chicken business, since he has plenty of demand in the neighborhood. Also he wants to buy photographic supplies.

Francisco separated from his wife four years ago. He has 3 children who live with their mother, but he supports them financially. He hopes that, with the income he earns with his businesses, he will be able to remodel an area in his home for the chicken and photography businesses. He also wants to buy a freezer to store his chickens.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in his photography business, and also in his other business selling chickens

texts.en:
Three years ago, Julia used to work as a nurse in a medical center. Then she became pregnant, and her husband left her. With the help of her mother and some money she had saved, she decided to start a small business selling office and school supplies. She works there every day of the week from 9 AM to 8 PM. When she has to leave to make deliveries, she leaves her mother in charge of waiting on the customers at the shop.

Julia wants this loan in order to increase her working capital so that she can include more items in her inventory, such as clothes and electric items.

Julia is 21 years old. She is a single mother with one daughter. At present, she has her business in her mother's home. She also has her own small house made of cane, and she hopes that, with this investment, she can create a business that will let her remodel her little house.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Ms. Rosa has 15 years of experience in business. She used to work as a household servant, and also sold clothing to her friends. Little by little, she saved her money, until the time when she decided to start her own business. She bought a cooler and, with the help of her sister, started selling drinks, sodas, and juices. She works every day of the week from 6 AM until 12 PM. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Rosa wants this loan in order to invest in school supplies, because in her area there is no such business, and also to invest in her current business.

Rosa is married. She is 55 years old and has 7 children, of whom only the youngest one still lives with her. Her husband works at a lumberyard and helps her with the household income. Not long ago her house was flooded, and with the help of her entire family she was able to fix it. In the future she hopes to be able to remake it out of cement.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in drinks and school supplies

texts.en:
Maria started out working in a warehouse, which she had to leave because her daughter became ill. At that job, she already had some steady customers, whom she brought merchandise to and billed weekly. After that she started her own business, which she has been doing for 5 years. She works every day of the week from 9 AM until 6 PM.

Maria wants this loan in order to be able to buy wholesale, which will help her improve her income and her business.

Maria is a single mother. She has been separated for 5 years. She is 34 and has 2 daughters. She lives with her children and her mother. She has succeeded in getting ahead for the sake of her children, and she hopes to be able to complete her home for the benefit of her daughters and her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Virginia has 2 years of experience in this business. She used to work as a seamstress, and with the help of her children she has succeeded in starting a business selling school and office supplies. She works every day of the week from 7 AM until 9 PM. Her son helps her with the business and the sales.

Virginia wants this loan in order to be able to invest in school supplies, because the school term is starting here and there is a high demand.

Virginia is a single mother. She has 4 children, of whom only one still lives with her. The others have moved out, but they help her out when she needs it. Virginia has been separated for 10 years. She still has a good relationship with her children's father, and he helps support the youngest child. She hopes with this investment and the income it generates to be able to remodel a place in her home to display her merchandise.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmita has 2 years of experience with this business, which first belonged to her sister, who at first hired Carmita to run it, and later sold it to her. She started out making "encebollado" (a kind of fish soup), but she found that activity tiring. Then she began selling articles of clothing. At present she combines the two activities.
