When she has to leave to deliver merchandise, she leaves her daughters in charge of the store. She works every day of the week from 6:30 AM until 10 PM.

Carmita wants this loan in order to be able to invest in her little store, which is a bit lacking in capital. She would like to be able to include other products.

Carmita is married. She is 40 years old and has 4 children, one of whom is still in school and also works. He helps a lot with the household income. Carmita's husband works driving a three-wheeler at the local outdoor market. He makes a daily income. Carmita hopes to be able to improve her house with the income that her business will generate.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her little store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has 15 years of experience in business. She was encouraged to start by a friend and her mother-in-law. She has participated in many microbusiness courses, which have helped her to always be responsible with the loans she obtains. She works every day of the wek from 7 AM until 9 PM. On the weekends, she travels to the countryside, where she has some customers. Her parents also live there, and they help her out with the business.

Rosa wants this loan in order to be able to include other products in her inventory, especially school supplies. She will buy them wholesale, which will increase her profits. Rosa is a single mother. She has been separated for 6 years. She has 2 children. One no longer lives with her, and the other works and helps her out. Her wish is to be able to complete her house and to remodel part of it to accomodate her business, and in that way to increase her income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To diversify her inventory of school supplies

texts.en:
Don Néstor has had a woodvarnishing shop for the past 20 years and he specializes in making coffins. His experience began at the age of 14 when working with his brothers who taught him the trade, which they had made their source of income. He opened his shop with the help of his brother in law who lent him a small start-up capital, which allowed him to produce the coffins and offer them to clients in the city.

Don Néstor will buy: wood, nails, fabric, lacquer, and paint. He hopes to sell more of his product outside of the city since he has been recommended to funeral homes in other cities like Esmeraldas, Santo Domingo, Cuenca, and Milagro. With his loan he will invest more in raw materials and cover orders from Quito, pleasing his customers and increasing sales which will generate more income.

Néstor is a 41 year old married father of three girls. His wife helps him to upholster the coffins. The business is his sole source of income which has allowed him to acquire land where he’s building his house and workshop bit by bit. He hopes the business will keep growing and generate work, thus obtaining not only personal/ familial wellbeing, but also that of others.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Néstor tiene taller de ebanistería desde hace 20 años y su negocio especifico es la producción de cofres mortuorios. Su experiencia viene desde la edad de 14 años trabajando con sus hermanos que le enseñaron el oficio tomando este como su fuente de ingreso. Se inicio con su pequeño taller con la ayuda de su cuñado que le financio un pequeño capital en esa época en sucres que le permitió producir los cofres y ofrecerlos a sus clientes en la ciudad

Don Néstor comprara: madera, clavos, telas, laca, pintura. El aspira vender más sus productos fuera de la ciudad ya que como tiene buen acabado lo han recomendado a otras funerarias fuera de la ciudad como Esmeraldas, Santo Domingo, Cuenca, Milagro. Con el préstamo invertirá mas en materia prima y cubrir pedido de Quito satisfaciendo de esta manera a sus clientes e incrementar mas sus ventas que le generaran mayores ingresos.

Néstor tiene 41 años es casado padre de tres niñas, esposa le ayuda en el negocio con la Tapizada de los cofres mortuorios. El negocio es su única fuente de ingresos que le ha Permitido obtener su terreno donde poco a poco esta construyendo su vivienda y taller. Aspira seguir creciendo y generar fuente de trabajo y así no solo tener bienestar personal-familiar, sino también a otras personas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small laundromat which provides washing and drying services to the community. She opened her business four years ago with money saved up from her ceramics workshop since demand for ceramics had gone down. Maria decided to put her skills into a laundering service, but she still does ceramic work on the side and makes mementos for baptisms, weddings, 15th birthday celebrations, and graduations, all by order.

She needs the loan to repair her place of business and also to buy and use detergent, fabric softener, and chlorine for laundering. She wishes to improve her service and gain more satisfied clients. She will also use part of the loan to buy raw materials to make certain ceramic pieces she receives orders for. With all of this, Maria hopes her business will grow so that she can keep investing in hard assets (washing machines).

Maria is 43 years old, single and lives alone. Her family is from Manabí-Jipijapa and she came to the city determined to get ahead and help her family as much as she could. This has not been easy for her, she has had to cover her family’s expenses. She is an enterprising person who tries everyday to improve her family’s wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene una lavandería pequeña dando servicio a la comunidad en el lavado y secado de ropa. Su negocio lo inicio hace cuatro años con un capital ahorrado ya que tenía un taller de cerámica y por que la demanda de este producto bajo. Maria decidió invertir su utilidad en este negocio de lavandería. Pero Maria también sigue dando servicio de cerámica ya que elabora recuerdos de: bautizos, matrimonios, quinceañeras y graduaciones, por pedidos.

Ella necesita el préstamo para hacer adecuación en el local y dar y comprar: detergente, suavizante y cloro para sus lavados. Su deseo es dar un mejor servicio y tener más clientes satisfechos. También poder invertir su parte de su préstamo en compra de materia prima para elaborar ciertos productos de cerámica que le solicitan. con todo esto Maria aspira crecer mas en su negocio y así después poder seguir invirtiendo en compra de un activo fijo (Lavadora).

Maria es soltera tiene 43 años vive sola su familia es de Manabí-Jipijapa se vino a la ciudad con la finalidad de salir adelante y apoyar a su familia en lo mas que ella pueda. No ha sido nada fácil para ella, ha tenido que correr con todos los gastos de la familia. Ella es una persona emprendedora que lucha cada día por darle un mejor bienestar a su familia. Con todo esto Maria aspira crecer más en su negocio y así después poder seguir invirtiendo en compra de un activo fijo (Lavadora)

loans.use: Purchase detergent, chlorine, and fabric softener

texts.en:
Doña Cristina has had her bazaar for the past 7 years. Before this she ran a store which experienced decreasing sales because of competition. For this reason she began to invest in paper products and gifts. Currently her business is going well and demand for her products has increased.

Doña Cristina wishes to purchase products such as sneakers, pantyhose, and others to supply the demand from her customers. With the income she wishes to purchase more items for her business.

Doña Cristina is 60 years old but her age doesn’t stop her from working hard. On the contrary, it keeps her strong and active. She lives alone since her children are independent. She is certain that with the loan she can keep working in her small bazaar and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

p> Doña Cristina tiene su negocio de bazar desde hace 7 años anterior a este negocio tuvo una tienda que por motivo de otros negocios en el sector su tienda bajo sus ventas por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo en productos de papelería y regalos en la actualidad ella ha mantenido su negocio mas su demanda ha crecido.

Doña Cristina desea comprar productos como: zapatos de lona, medias, polines y otros para así poder cumplir con la demanda solicitada por sus clientes y con las utilidades generadas poder realizar más compras para el negocio.

Doña Cristina tiene 60 años indica que la edad que tiene no le quita que siga trabajando al contrario la llena de fortaleza y la mantiene activa. Ella vive sola ya que sus hijos son independientes. Ella tiene la confianza que con el préstamo podrá seguir manteniendo su pequeño bazar y también apoyar en algo a su familia.

Gladys has had experience in this business for the past eight years. With the help of a small loan she opened a store inside her home and started to add office and school supplies bit by bit. She had to dedicate more time to her newly born daughter and then to school. Currently Gladys works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day of the week.

Gladys wants to use her loan to buy school supplies to meet the demand of the people in the neighborhood. This will also increase her income and the wellbeing of her family.

Gladys is 28 years old and is married with two daughters, one of whom goes to school. Her husband is a collector for a company that sells home products outside of the city. He helps her with the business in his free time. They are a very united couple ready to work in order to give their children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys tiene una experiencia en el comercio desde hace ocho años. Con un préstamo pequeño que realizó inicio una tienda en su misma casa la cual tuvo que poco a poco fue incluyendo productos de oficina y escolares. Ella tuvo que dedicar más tiempo a su hija que recién nació y luego a la escuela. Actualmente doña Gladys labora desde las 7AM hasta las 22PM todos los días de la semana

Gladys desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de útiles escolares y así cumplir con las necesidades de la gente del sector. Además esto le significaría mayores ingresos para bienestar de su familia y seguridad de su local.

Gladys es casada tiene 28 años y dos niñas de las cuales una estudia. Su esposo es recaudador de una empresa de venta de artículos para el hogar fuera de la ciudad y en sus ratos libres el la apoya en su negocio. Ellos son una pareja muy unida dispuesta a trabajar para poder darles a sus hijos un mejor bienestar

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has had a wood varnishing workshop for the past three years. Her first business was to sell fruits. One of her sons learned wood varnishing while making dressers. This was an incentive for her to buy machinery and this was how Lilia opened her workshop. Currently she and a brother are in charge of the business which is open every day of the week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Lilia wants to buy a motor and a sander in order to provide better service to her customers and produce more dressers. This will make better use of her materials and create more jobs for people in the neighborhood.

Lilia is 44 years old and is a married mother of five children. Only two of them are still dependent on their mother, they go to college. Her husband is a fisherman on a tuna boat. He comes ashore every 15 or 21 days and helps her with her business, knowing that she is generating income for the home. The income allows them to continue improving their house, bringing more comfort to their family.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilia tiene un taller de ebanistería desde hace tres años. Se inicio en el comercio vendiendo frutas. Un hijo aprendió el oficio de ebanistería en la producción de cómodas y la incentivo a que ella invirtiera en la compra de maquinaria y fue así que doña Lilia emprendió su taller. Actualmente ella y un hermano están a cargo del negocio. El cual lo trabajan toda la semana desde las 7AM a 18PM.

El deseo de doña Lilia es comprar un motor y una lijadora con la finalidad de dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y producir mayor cantidad de cómodas ya que esto le generaría mayor utilidad por volumen y a su vez estaría creando una fuente de trabajo a personas del sector.

Lilia tiene 44 años es casada madre de cinco hijos y de ella dependen solo dos que están en el colegio. Su esposo es marino mercante de barco atunero. El llega a casa cada 15 o 21 días y la apoya en su negocio. Su esposo sabe que su esposa esta generando otros ingresos para el hogar. Estos ingresos permitirán continuar con la adecuación de vivienda brindando mejor confor a su familia. /p>

loans.use: Purchase a sander and other materials

loans.name: Faaea

texts.en:
Faaea is married with 7 children. Her family needs, including the education of her children, are barely met by the farm, which was her first business since she joined to the SPBD program.

She started with a small loan and she used it to buy the fertilizer, weed killer and the most needed equipment to improve the farm just to start off. In addition, she also has the talent for designing and doing elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics using carved designs) and decided to engage in another business. She has already started with some savings she got for her farm but she needs additional capital to expand her Elei Printing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics, carved wooden design board, stencils, paints

texts.en:
Victoria has had a bazaar for the past 25 years. She opened it with savings from her work in a warehouse where she had the idea of starting her own business. Her bazaar is located inside her home where her children help her attend to customers. She is open for business every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Victoria wants to use the loan to add more products to her store like candy and school supplies to meet the demand of her customers. With the added income she plans to invest in more products.

Victoria is 45 years old and is a married mother of two children who go to school. Her husband is a driver who works outside of the city. Victoria says the good thing about her husband is that when he’s home he helps her very much with the business, knowing that this is an extra source of income for the family, allowing them to continue improving their house.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Victoria tiene su negocio de bazar desde hace 25 años lo inicio con ahorros de su trabajo en almacén de productos de consumo masivo de donde le nació la idea de poner un negocio. Su bazar lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio donde sus hijos le ayudan en atender a los clientes. Su atención al publico lo hace todos los días desde las 6AM hasta 22PM

Doña Victoria con el préstamo desea agregar a su negocio mas productos como: colas, confites, útiles escolares otros para así poder cumplir con la demanda solicitada por sus clientes y con las utilidades generadas poder realizar mas inversiones.

Doña Victoria tiene 45 años. Es casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer labora fuera de la ciudad lo bueno de su esposo indica doña Victoria es que cuando esta en su hogar la apoya mucho porque sabe que esto le da otros ingresos que le van a permitir seguir adecuando la vivienda

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Mrs L. is married with 7 children. She’s a very talented lady in sewing and designing, but she preferred sewing as her business because she’s good at doing it and it is more profitable for her.

She joined the SPBD program to get a small loan to purchase a sewing machine. She still needs more help to build a special building for the business and buy more materials to sell to her clients, because she believes it’s more profitable for her.

loans.use: To construct a extension to her house where she can put her sewing business, and purchase additional fabrics.

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar is 41 years old,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 3 children.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $300 and bought instruments.
He has worked as electrician since 2002.
Now he applies for a loan of $800 to buy electric equipment.

loans.name: Cao

texts.en:
Cao is 31, Cao's wife is 28, and their child, who is a student at primary school, is eight. Cao's family has no land aside from their home. He has rented 2,000 square meters for cultivating rice.

Recently, a disease-spreading insect has affected his rice crop, so he has been unable to save money. He decided to change from growing rice to mushrooms. Cao's income is about $7 per person/month. This income is not enough for him to buy more rice straw and mycelium. Cao wants a loan of $75 so that he can continue growing mushrooms. Cao will repay monthly.

loans.use: To buy rice straw and mycelium for growing mushrooms.

texts.en:
This 50-year-old man is a father of 2 children,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village.
He saved enough money to set up his own business. 
This money was not enough for improving this business and he decided to borrow $400 and so he bought 2 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow. 
He has run his business for 2 years.

loans.name: Ruhim

texts.en:
This young man has sold soft drinks for 5 years. 
Having borrowed $400 he bought soft drinks. 
His shop is very small and it prevents him to improve  his business.
Now he applies for a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his shop.
Ruhim is an Internally Displaced Person, (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

texts.en:
Giyas wants to improve his sheep breeding.
He has been in this business for 6 years.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 and bought 4 sheep.
Giyas is 51 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has a child.This is his only source of income.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 8 sheep.

Mahnur opened this laborotory  5 years ago. 
Having borrowed $400 she bought a microscope for analysis.
39-year-old Mahnur is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. She is settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. She is single.
Now she needs  a loan of $800 to buy chemicals.

This 36-year-old man is a father of 2 children.He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region,Mahmudlu  village.
Tehran works very hard for the success of his children.
Having improved his business, he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 and bought 2 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
He has run this business for 5 years.

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en:
4 years ago this 55-year-old man decided to open a grocery store.
Having borrowed $400 he bought foodstuffs.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of his store.
Arzuman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village and is married and has 3 children.

loans.use: To expand the area of his store

texts.en:
Vilyet is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 5 years and it allows him to support his family. 
Having borrowed $600 he bought medicines for his sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep.
Vilyet is 53 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
3 years ago Alik decided to open a shop, where he sells clothes.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $500 and bought clothes.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of his shop.
He is 30, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

texts.en:
Ofelya has 2 years experience in this business. She is 48 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, now settled in Fizuli region Kayidish village. She is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 she bought 3 bull-calves.
With these calves she covered her family expenses.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a milk cow. She plans to produce milk, cheese and to improve her business.

Carmen has a store inside her home where she sells school supplies and paper products. She started her business with the help of her sister when she realized there was no such store in her neighborhood. She began by selling notebooks and various other items. Now she continues to sell these items along with candy and toys. Carmen will use the loan to buy products wholesale in order to make a bigger profit. She is 47 years old and a divorced mother of one son but is currently in a relationship. She hopes this loan will improve her family’s quality of life and stabilize the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen tiene una tienda en su domicilio donde vende útiles escolares y papelería. Carmen empezó su negocio con la ayuda de una hermana y al darse cuenta que por el sector donde vive no había una tienda. Se inicio vendiendo cuadernos y artículos varios. Ahora ella continúa vendiendo estos mismos productos junto con confitería y juguetes. Carmen usara el préstamo para invertir en mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. Carmen es madre de un hijo, tiene 47 años separada de su primer matrimonio y actualmente tiene otro compromiso. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.en:
Ángel sells tortillas and empanadas in downtown Guayaquil. He started his business with a start up capital of $100 selling tortillas to his neighbors and neighborhood schools. Now he still sells tortillas and other food items like filled potatoes.

Ángel will use the loan to change a part of his house into a store. He’s confident that this will enable his business to grow. Ángel is 53 years old and married, has one daughter and is raising two grandchildren because their mother died of leukemia.

He hopes that the loan will improve his family’s quality of life and allow his business to continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel se dedica a la venta de tortillas y empanadas en el centro de la ciudad. Ángel empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital de 100 dólares. Se inicio vendiendo tortillas a sus vecinos y a las escuelas del sector. Ahora el continúa vendiendo tortillas y bolones junto con mochines y papas rellenas. Ángel usara el préstamo para invertir en adecuar un local en su propia vivienda . El tiene la confianza que con este nuevo servicio su negocio crecerá. Ángel tiene 53 años, esta unido tiene una hija y esta criando a dos nietos ya que la madre murió de leucemia. El tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Change part of his home into a store

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana has a beauty salon in her home. She opened her business with the help of her sister who taught her the trade and gave her some start up capital. At the beginning she only did men’s haircuts. Now she still offers this service as well as skin cleaning, manicures and pedicures. She would like to make improvements to her salon and is certain that with the new service her clients will be happier and her business will grow.

Mariana is 32 years old, married and has four children who go to school. She is convinced that the loan will improve her family’s economic condition and allow her to continue to grow her business to save money and give her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana tiene un gabinete de belleza en su domicilio. Mariana empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana quien le enseño la profesión y le facilito el capital para que emprendiera su negocio. Al principio solo se dedicaba a los cortes de cabello para caballeros. Ahora ofrece este mismo servicio junto con limpieza de cutis y manicure y pedicure. Ella aspira adecuar su gabinete. Ella tiene la plena seguridad que con este nuevo servicio sus clientes se sentirán contentos y va ha tener crecimiento. Mariana esta unida. Tiene 32 años tiene cuatro hijos que estudian. Ella esta convencida que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia y seguirá creciendo en el negocio para ahorrar y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Make improvements to her place of business

texts.en:
Maria distributes rice to stores and markets. She started her business with the help of her husband who gave her $200 in start-up capital so she could have her own business. At the beginning she only sold rice retail but now sells it wholesale. María wants to sell other basic foods such as sugar, oil, and beans. She will use the loan to purchase the products at wholesale prices to make a bigger profit.

Maria is married and has one son. She is 37 years old and depends on her business to support her family and save money for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria se dedica a la distribución de arroz en tiendas y mercados. Maria empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito 200 dólares para que emprendiera su propio negocio. Al principio solo vendía arroz por menor. Ahora ofrece este producto al por mayor. Maria aspira vender víveres de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite y fréjol. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. Maria esta casada tiene un hijo. Ella tiene 37 años, depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is the owner of a tailoring shop, where she creates shirts, pants, and suits. She opened her business with help from her parents, who provided her with equipment. She began by doing repair work on various kinds of clothing. Now she manufactures suits, shirts, and pants. Sara hopes to grow her business and to be able to hire on other people. She will use the loan to investment in the purchase of an industrial sewing machine. She has faith that with this new service her business will grow and her economic stability will improve. She lives with a man and has three children. She is 30 years old and she depends solely on her business to support her household. Sara is sure that the loan will give her security and will allow her to save for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara tiene un taller de costura donde confecciona camisas, pantalones y ternos. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de sus padres que le facilitaron las maquinas. Al principio solo hacia arreglos a toda clase de ropa. Ahora confecciona ternos, camisas y pantalones. Sara aspira crecer en su negocio y poder dar empleo a otras personas. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una maquina industrial. Ella tiene la fe que con este nuevo servicio su negocio crecerá y su estabilidad económica mejorara. Ella esta unida tiene tres hijos. Tiene 30 años y depende solo de su negocio para el sustento de su hogar. Sara esta segura que este préstamo le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.en: Wilfredo has a store where he sells ice cream and other snacks and items. When he first borrowed from Kiva and Mifex his business grew slowly, but in the last several months it has been reaching new heights. Wilfredo now employs 5 people who sell his ice cream on the streets. He has significantly increased his revenue; expanding his business by adding employees. He has also bought two new freezers in order to boost his capacity. His business is doing quite well now and he is very grateful for his first loan. He hopes that he can continue to grow with the support of international Kiva lending community. He plans on investing in tricycle carts so that his employees can cover more ground and he can continue to improve his sales. Although Wilfredo is divorced, he is still very committed to both helping and spending time with his three children. He hopes to continue to save for their future.

loans.use: Buy tricycle carts and a freezer

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia sells peanuts, garlic and tamarind. She began her business with savings that she was able to take from a harvest of potatoes that she had on her land. In the beginning, she only sold peanuts. Now she continues to sell that product along with beans, lentils, garbanzo beans, and a variety of dried grains. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices in order to be more competitive in the market and to increase profits. Delia hopes to purchase another stand in the market to sell vegetables. She has faith that this with this additional product her business will grow and she will have economic stability. Delia is 30 years old, and she is sure that this loan will give her security and will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia vende maní, ajo, tamarindo. Empezó su negocio con un ahorro que obtuvo con un sombrío de papas que tenia en su tierra. Al principio solo vendía maní. Ahora vende este producto junto con fréjol, lenteja y garbanzos y una variedad de granos secos.. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería a precios de mayoristas para así ser mas competitivos en el mercado y poder tener mejores ganancias. Delia aspira comprarse otro puesto en el mercado para vender legumbres. Ella tiene la fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá y tendrá estabilidad económica. Delia esta casado tiene tres hijos dos de ellos estudian. Tiene 30 años, esta segura que este préstamo le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices

texts.en:
Margarita works selling clothing and cosmetics door to door in rural areas. She has a portfolio of fifty clients. Margarita’s business started out of necessity when her husband suffered from a 6 month illness. Her relatives helped her with 200 dollars in funds to undertake the opening of her business. In the beginning, she only sold clothes for children and women. Now, in addition to those products, she offers men’s clothing, and cosmetics. Margarita hopes to begin offering small appliances such as toasters, mixers and rice cookers – as these are the products most frequently requested by her clients. She has faith that with these new products her business will grow. Margarita is married, with two children in school. She is 44 years old. Support for her children and their education comes solely from her business. Margarita is confident that this loan will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos puerta a puerta en la provincias teniendo una cartera de cincuenta clientes. Margarita empezó su negocio por la necesidad de que su esposo estuviera enfermo por el lapso de seis meses. Sus familiares la ayudaron con un capital de 200 dólares para que emprendiera el negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa para niños y damas. Ahora sigue vendiendo este producto junto con ropa de caballeros y cosméticos. Margarita aspira vender pequeños electrodomésticos como tostadoras, batidoras y ollas arroceras que son los que mas le solicitan sus clientes. Ella tiene fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá. Margarita esta casada tiene dos hijos que estudian. Ella tiene 44 años. Ella depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a la educación de sus hijos. Margarita tiene la confianza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.name: Ziyaddin

texts.en:
Ziyaddin is 42 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Almali village. He is now settled in the Khirdalan settlement and is married and has 3 children.
He has his own shop. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 140 sacks of cement. The second time he borrowed $1000 to make repairs to his shop.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to increase variety of building materials.
He has run this business for 3 years.

loans.use: To increase variety of building materials

texts.en:
Shakir has 2 years of experience in this business.
Having borrowed $400 he bought 2 calves.
He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village.
This 49-year-old man is married and has 2 children.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.

Tevekkul opened dental clinic for 3 years ago. In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 to purchase some basic dentistry tools.
He wants to improve his dental clinic in order to improve the quality of services to his clients.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy medicines.
Tevekkul is 39 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. Tevekkul is married and has a child.

Teyyar is 32 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village. He is single.
Teyyar saved enough money to set up this business.
Having borrowed $500 he bought 2 calves and fodder.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.

Afag has been in this business for 3 years.
This business allows her family to have a better income.
Having borrowed  $600 she bought medicinal preparations for her cattle.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a milk cow.
Afag is 36 years old , an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region. She has settled in the Fizuli region, Ehmedbeyli village. Afag is married and has a child.

This 57-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.

Having borrowed $600, Ahad repaired the medical clinic. He opened this clinic 15 years ago. Now Ahad needs a loan of $1000 to buy medicines and equipment.

Ahad is a doctor (general practioner). Patients come to him and complain about their pains: belly-ache, chest pain, back pain, abdomen pain, etc. and Ahad does a general patient examination.

Sadagat wishes to increase her earnings by offering new products in high demand in her area in order to increase her income.
Having borrowed $600 Sadagat bought 3 calves.
She breeds calves and cows.
Sadagat plans to increase he number of dairy cows, which will enable her to sell more milk.
She supplies milk in the village and nearby markets. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.
She has been in this business for 6 years.
Sadagat is 56 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region Mahmudlu 2 village. She is married and has 4 children.

Elkhan has worked as a taxi driver for 3 years. In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 to repair this car.
He is 50 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy a car.

Saadat is 32 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ehmedbeyli village. She is single.
You can see in the picture a woman, who is Saadat's sister. She helps Saadat to improve cattle breeding.
Saadat has run this business for 5 years.
In the beginning of her business, she borrowed $400 and bought 2 calves.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
Saadat plans to raise her income level.
She intends to do this by increasing the number of cattle.

Fakhraddin has run this business for 5 years.
Having borrowed $400 he bought wheels and spare parts.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to do capital repairs. 
This 38-year-old man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fizuli region. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
8 years ago Allahverdi set up his business. He has transported building materials with a car, which is rented by him. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 4 wheels.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start setting up sale of building materials.
Allahverdi is 30 years old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjavend region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has a child.

loans.use: To start setting up sale of building materials

loans.name: Gozal

texts.en:
Gozel is 43 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, Abutalub village, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. She is a widow and has 3 children.
One day she decided to set up her own business.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 to buy foodstuffs.
The second loan of $800 she spent to buy scales and foodstuffs.
Now Gozal needs a loan of $1200 to buy a refrigerator and ice-cream apparatus.
She has been in this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and ice-cream apparatus

texts.en:
Maxim is an enterprising young shoe salesman from Nikopol, Ukraine. He runs a successful business selling men’s and women’s shoes from a small kiosk in the busy central market in Nikopol. The nice selection of dress and casual leather shoes that he offers are very popular and sell well. Maxim has built his business rapidly. He has been in business for about 4 years and maintains around $4000 worth of available inventory. Typically he will purchase about $600 worth of shoes three times per month to renew his supplies. Right now he makes around $600 in net profits every month. Credit services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have been a help to Maxim as he has developed his trade. Financing has enabled him to buy products in bulk, minimizing his purchasing and shipping costs. Extra funds have also helped add stability to his business by providing a cushion for those times when sales have been down. This loan for $1200 will also help Maxim continue to expand by increasing his available capital. Eventually he would like to open additional kiosks which will significantly increase his sales. We would like to continue assisting him with each step as he works hard to build a successful business.

Максим – молодий підприємець з Нікополя. Він займається бізнесом з продажу жіночого та чоловічого взуття на одному з місцевих ринків. Ошатне та повсякденне шкіряне взуття, яким торгує Максим, користується великим попитом. Бізнес Максима існує вже 4 роки, він дуже швидко розвивається. В товар у Максима вкладено приблизно 4000 доларів. Три рази на місяць він робить закупки на суму в 600 доларів, таким чином він поповнює асортимент товару. Зараз Максим отримує приблизно 600 доларів чистого прибутку щомісяця. Кредитні послуги від „Надії України” сприяли розвитку бізнесу Максима. Фінансова підтримка допомогла йому закупити товар за оптовими цінами, зменшуючи власні транспортні витрати. Додаткові кошти також сприяли стабільному росту бізнесу, особливо за часів, коли показники продажів були досить низькими. Позика в 1200 доларів допоможе Максиму й надалі розвивати власний бізнес та збільшити робочий капітал. Врешті-решт він планує відкрити ще декілька кіосків та збільшити обсяги продажів. Ми плануємо і надалі підтримувати Максима, щоб допомогти йому досягти ще більшого успіху в бізнесі.

For nearly nine years, shoppers at the busy Centralnie Rhinok, or central market, in Nikopol have been able to purchase a variety of household and personal cleaning products from Margarita S.. Not that long ago, many of the cleaning supplies that Margarita now sells were not available in the Ukraine. Since the fall of the rigid Soviet system and the resulting freedoms, a tremendous amount of new products are manufactured and sold here that were once unheard of. Margarita has been able to take advantage of the changing markets and influx of new goods and position herself as a reliable supplier of quality products. Margarita has developed a reputation as a smart, hard-working and honest entrepreneur. She has a sharp business mind, and understands how to match her product to her customers. Like many working adults in Ukraine she has a very high education with a college degree. Unfortunately, a lack of available good paying jobs makes it hard for people to find work in their field of training. Margarita has been able to make ends meet through her business, however. She is a single mom and provides for herself and her two children. She has requested a loan for $1200 to add to her available capital. She tries to buy new inventory about three times a month. This loan will assist her in keeping a good supply of products on hand so she can keep up with sales.

На протязі останніх 9 років покупці Центрального ринку приходять купляти різноманітні господарчі товари та побутову хімію у Маргарити Стафієнко. Ще зовсім нещодавно товари, якими торгує Маргарита дуже важко було знайти в Україні. Після краху жорсткого радянського режиму запанувала певна свобода, на ринках з’явилися нові продукти та товари. Маргарита скористалася новими можливостями, закупила нову продукцію та почала торгувати якісними товарами. Маргарита зарекомендувала себе, як розумний, працьовитий та порядний підприємець. В неї – дуже чіпкий розум, вона знає, що необхідно кожному покупцю. Маргарита має вищу освіту, як і переважна більшість дорослих людей в Україні. На жаль, багато хто з них не може знайти роботу за спеціальністю. Однак, Маргариті вдається забезпечити себе й родину завдяки її бізнесу. Вона самостійно виховує двох дітей.

Ludmila thoroughly enjoys meeting the needs of many women for quality, stylish footwear. With the help of her son she manages two sales kiosks at the Angolenko market in Zaporoshie where she sells a variety of shoes and boots. Her extensive 15 years of experience in this area of retail have given her much credibility as well as popularity among buyers and her fellow merchants. Ludmila’s biggest desire is to efficiently provide for her two sons who she was left to raise on her own. Through her business venture she has been able to provide an education for her older son. Now she would like to provide a good education for her younger son. Ludmila is even willing to downsize her home if necessary and move from a house to an apartment in order to be more conservative with finances. Ludmila recognizes that spring is a very active sales time when many women look to purchase a new pair of shoes. To meet this demand, she needs to exchange her winter inventory for a spring one. She has requested a loan for $750 that will allow her to buy a spring collection of shoes in bulk in order to provide a nice selection during this busy season.

Людмила з радістю займається продажем якісного та стильного жіночого взуття, задовольняючи потреби покупців. Її син допомагає їй з торгівлею, вони мають дві торгові точки на ринку Анголенка в Запоріжжі, продають туфлі та чоботи. Людмила торгує вже 15 років. За цей період вона змогла заробити гарну репутацію серед колег-підприємців, в неї з’явилося багато покупців. Понад усе Людмила прагне дбати про своїх двох синів, яких виховує самостійно. Завдяки власному бізнесу вона змогла дати своєму старшому сину можливість навчатися в університеті. Зараз її наступна мета – дати таку можливість і молодшому. Заради цього Людмила навіть готова зменшити житлоплощу та переїхати з власного будинку у квартиру, щоб зекономити необхідні для цього кошти. Людмила розуміє, що весняний сезон – це період активної торгівлі, взуття продається дуже гарно. Отже, вона прагне розширити асортимент товару напередодні весняного сезону. Для цього Людмила просить про позику в 750 доларів, яка надасть їй можливість закупити багато взуття за оптовими цінами та задовольнити попит покупців.

This 37-year-old man is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village.
5 years ago Ilgar decided to start cattle breeding .
Having borrowed $600 he bought 3 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves and improve his business. 
His business success will allow him to cover his family expenses.

Gulsafa has been engaged in this business at home for 5 years. She has a lot of clients. She sews sheets, slipcovers and curtains.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought a sewing-machine and cloth. The second time she borrowed $800 to buy a lot of cloth.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to build a sewing-shop in her own yard.
Gulsafa is 28 years old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. She is married and has 2 children.

Vazir has 6 years of experience in this business. He is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Mahmudlu 2 village.
Having borrowed $400 Vazir bought 4 sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.name: Intizar

texts.en:
Intizar is a widow who has 4 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement.
Having borrowed $400 she bought a refrigerator.
For the second loan she borrowed $800 and bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to start the sale of all types of industrial goods and to buy necessary equipment for the store.
She run this business for 4 years ago.

loans.use: To start the saleof all types of industrial goods and to buy necessary equipment for a store

texts.en:
2 years ago Alik decided to start this business.
Having borrowed $400 he bought 4 sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 8 sheep.  
Alik is 34 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
Alik is married and has 2 children.
X.

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en:
Kifayat is 50 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Karadjanli village, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. She is married and has 6 children.
Having borrowed $500 Kifayat bought building materials and other household goods.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to increase the variety  of materials.

loans.use: To increase the variety  of materials

texts.en:
This 52-year-old man is a father of 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village.
In the beginning of his business Allahverdi borrowed  $600 and bought a meaty bull-calf.
He has been in this business for 4 years.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 2 meaty bull-calves.

loans.name: Famila

texts.en:
Famila is 38 years old,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Milli village. She is  settled in the Khirdalan settlement Famila is a widow and has 3 children.
She has been engaged in sale and production at her own home for 5 years.
She sews and sells clothes, slipcovers and sheets.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $300 to buy a sewing- machine and cloth.
For the second loan she borrowed $800 to buy 5 cloth bales.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 electric sewing-machines and cloth

loans.use: To buy 2 electric sewing-machines and cloth

texts.en:
Soltan is a 37 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is  settled in the  Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village and is married and has 2 children.
He has been in this business for 15 years.
Having borrowed $400 he bought wheels for his taxi
Now he needs a loan of $800 to do capital repairs.

Besti is a mother of 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region , settled in the Khirdalan settlement.
Having borrowed $300 she bought fodder for her cattle.
The second time she borrowed $800 to buy a cow.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to set up a butchery business.

4 years ago Rasim decided to start this business. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $600 and bought welding apparatus.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy materials.
This 42-year-old man is anInternally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region Mahmudlu village. He is married and has 3 children.

This 61-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 Valeddin bought a meaty bull-calf. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 3 meaty bull-calves.

loans.name: Mezahir

texts.en:
Mezahir has been in this business for 2 years.
He has his own grocery store.
This 31-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region who is settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 he bough foodstuffs.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start to sell all types of industrial  goods.

loans.use: To start the sale of all types of industrial goods

texts.en:
This 31-year-old man is a hard working person.
He has worked as a taxi driver for 6 years. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 and repaired his car.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy spare parts.
Mubariz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has a child.

Mohubbat enjoys looking after calves. He has been in this business for 2 years. 
Having borrowed $600 he bought 3 calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow. 
Mohubbat is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region who is settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village,which is built for IDPs.
Mohubbat is married and has 2 children.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif has his own shop, where he sells wooden materials.
He is 33 years oldand an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region Kurdlar village, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed  $500 he bought wood for making doors, windows,and floors.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start selling iron armatures.
He has run this business for 3 years.

loans.use: To start sale of iron armatures

texts.en:
Khasay is 38 years old, anInternally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
Having borrowed $400 he bought 2 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves.
He has been in this business for 2 years.

This young man is a very kind and a responsible person. 
He is 48 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children. 
Having borrowed $400 he repaired his gas station.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy new apparatus.
He has run this business for 4 years.

I'm an owner of a taxi, helping transport people to different parts of the city. I work Monday-Saturday. At the moment, I need to repair my car so I can provide better service to my passengers. With the income, I can help with family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me dedico al sector del trasporte, soy dueño de un taxi en el que traslado a personas a distintos sitios de la ciudad, trabajo de lunes a sabado, en este momento necesito reparar mi vehiculo para dar un mejor servicio a mis pasajeros. Con los ingresos que percibo ayudo a mi familia con los gastos.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.en:
For the past five years I have dedicated myself to selling a local style of fried fish accompanied with fried plantain slices. The fish sells very quickly because our customers like it for its taste and health benefits. My business helps generate income to be able to help cover family expenses and pay my employees.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace cinco años me dedico a la venta de pescado frito estilo lago de Yojoa, son fritos acompañados de tajaditas de platano verde, este pescado se vende rapido ya que nos gusta consumir bastante pescado por lo saludable y sabroso. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder atender a mi familia en los gastos y pagar a mis empleadas.

loans.use: Buy fresh fish, cabbage, onion, plantains, oils, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Dunia Aracely

texts.en:
I have a small food stand in my neighborhood. My sales are consistent. Currently I don't have enough products to offer my clients, so I need capital to supply my business and increase my sales so I can help my family with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo una pequeña pulperia en mi colonia, mis ventas son regulares ya que no tengo tanto producto que ofrecer a mis clientes, por lo que necesito capital para surtir mi negocio e incrementar mis ventas, asi como ayudar a mi familia en sus gastos.

loans.use: Buy drinks, bread, eggs, milk, sugar, churros, candy, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
I've dedicated myself to selling bottled drinks. I also sell snacks and churros. The drinks sell the most since there are businesses close by that sell food and they always buy their drinks from me. Currently I need capital to be able to add more supplies to my business and increase my income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me dedico a la venta de refrescos de botella, tambien vendo golosinas y churros. Los refrescos los vendo al por mayor y detalle ya que cerca tengo negocios que venden comidas y siempre comprar sus refrescos en mi negocio. Ahora necesito capital para poder surtir mejor mi negocio y poder mejorar mis ingresos.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Estebina

texts.en:
I have dedicated myself to selling candy, drinks, water, juice, cookies and the the like for four years. My business is located in the suburbs near one of the country's public hospitals. It's for this reason I need to add more supplies to my business, since there are a large amount of visitors daily, and that will help me generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me dedico a la venta de dulces, refrescos, agua, jugos, galletas desde hace cuatro años, mi negocio esta ubicado en las cercanias de uno de los hospitales publicos de nuestro pais, es por eso que necesito surtir mi negocio ya que a diario los visitantes son bastantes, esto me ayudara a mejorar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Buy candy, water, fruit, churros, cookies, juice, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
I have dedicated myself to making and selling corn tortillas. My clients are my neighbors and other people who enjoy eating my product. I need to buy ingredients to make more tortillas and increase my profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz, mis clientes son mis vecinas y otras personas que les gusta comer tortillas. Necesito comprar materia prima para hacer mas tortillas y mejorar mis ingresos.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
Matilde and her family are from San Luís de Potosí but left that city to look for better opportunities elsewhere. They came to Juárez in the state of Nuevo Leon, where they were able to get some land. Matilde's husband works for a bricklayer. Their economic situation was quite bad when their second daughter was about to be born and they realized they couldn't afford another baby. That was when Matilde decided to make and sell tamales, which helped her buy necessary things for her child. Five years later, Matilde has three daughters, aged 2, 5, and 7.

Matilde needs a loan of only $200 which she will use to buy a tamale steamer to increase her production of tamales. This will help her business grow and allow her to sell in more areas. You can be an integral part of the growth of her business, this family's wellbeing is in your hands, they will be very grateful.

Matilde y su familia son originarios de San Luís Potosí, salieron en busca de mejores oportunidades y llegaron a Juárez, en el estado de Nuevo León, en donde consiguieron un terreno. Su esposo es ayudante de albañil y la situación económica en la que se encontraban era muy escasa. Cuando estaba por nacer su segunda hija, y ellos no se encontraban en posibilidades de pagar los gastos de un bebé, ella decidió empezar con la elaboración y venta de tamales, lo que le ayudó a comprar lo necesario para su hija, ya hace cinco años de esto, Matilde tiene tres hijas, de 2, 5 y 7 años de edad.

En estos momentos, Matilde necesita de un préstamo de solo $ 200 dólares con los que espera comprar una vaporera para poder incrementar su producción de tamales y así tener más oportunidades de hacer crecer su negocio y extender su área de ventas. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, en tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Ana Ruth is married and has three children. Her husband is a laborer whose salary wasn't enough for all of their family's needs. To increase their income Ana began to sell used clothing, but reinvested her profits to purchase new clothing, which she now sells along with shoes. She has had this business for five years and now has a store outside her home.

Ana and her daughter who help her at work have high hopes for their business, for which they need a $200 loan to buy merchandise in order to increase the variety of their inventory and customers. Be a part of this business and grow with Ana. Your contribution will be of much help to Ana and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Ruth es casada y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo es obrero y la familia tenía muchas necesidades que con el salario de su esposo no podían ser satisfechas. Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos Ana empezó vendiendo ropa usada, pero reinvertía las utilidades y así pudo cambiar sus productos a ropa nueva y después incorporar la venta de zapatos. Ya son cinco años desde que empezó y ahora ya tiene su establecimiento afuera de su casa.

Son muchos los deseos de superación que tiene Ana y su hija que le ayuda con el negocio, y quieren que su negocio pueda crecer, para lo que necesitan de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y así incrementar la variedad de sus productos y sus clientes. Forma parte importante en este negocio, y crece junto con Ana. Tú contribución será de mucha utilidad para Ana y su familia.

Amalia is married and has a young daughter. When her husband lost his job at the factory because of job cuts, they didn't have money to support themselves. With his severance pay, they bought a sewing machine which Amalia began to use for business. She makes uniforms and other items of clothing. She has now been doing this for 15 years and demand for her services has grown significantly.

Amalia needs a loan of $250 which she will use to buy the necessary materials to keep doing her work. You can be an integral part of this business by helping Amalia grow with her business. She will be very thankful for your support and care.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amalia es casada y tiene una hija pequeña, cuando su esposo fue despedido de la fábrica por recorte de personal, ellos no tenían de donde obtener los recursos que necesitaban como familia, y con la liquidación de su trabajo compraron una máquina de cocer con la que Amalia empezó a realizar costuras y poco a poco fue ganando clientes, ahora cose uniformes y vertidos, entre otras prendas. Ya son 15 años lo que Amalia tiene en el negocio y la demanda por sus servicios se ha incrementado significativamente.

En estos momentos Amalia necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que empleara en la comprar de materiales que necesita para seguir haciendo su trabajo. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental de este negocio, ayuda a Amalia a poder crecer con su negocio, ella agradece sinceramente de tu apoyo y cariño.

Maria Leticia is married with four children. Three years ago, she began selling food from a stand in front of her home. Her husband helps her after he gets off of work, as does their 16 year old daughter. They began the stand to earn extra income to improve their quality of life and to pay for the education of their children.

It hasn't been easy to maintain their business, but together they have been able to succeed. Now they need a $825 loan for food preparation and to buy tables, chairs and utensils to improve the look of their stand. You can help this business grow. Maria and her family extend their sincere appreciation for whatever help you can provide.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Leticia es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, hace tres años que empezó con la venta de comida instalándose en la tardes después del trabajo de su esposo porque recibe la ayuda de él, y de su hija de 16 años, tienen su puesto afuera de su casa. Lo iniciaron para obtener un ingreso extra y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y para financiar los estudios de sus hijos.

No ha sido fácil para ellos mantener su negocio, pero con la unión de la familia ha podido salir adelante, ahora ellos necesitan de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 825 dólares que utilizaran en la compra de insumos que se necesitan para la elaboración de los alimentos y también para la compra de mesas, sillas y utensilios, para mejorar la imagen del establecimiento. Tú puedes colaborar con el crecimiento de este negocio, Maria y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darles.

Hardworking and responsible are the two words that describe Rebeca. She is married and has three children. Because of the unemployment rate in Mexico, her husband has never had a steady job. He is a bricklayer and works independently. The need for income to support their family made Rebeca decide to start a business selling ceramic figurines and underwear over a year ago. This work has helped her support her family and provide an education for her kids.

Rebeca needs a loan of $200 which she will use to complete current orders from her customers, and promises to pay back the loan in 3 to 6 months. You can help Rebeca, she will be very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabajadora y responsable es como se puede definir a Rebeca. Ella es casada y tiene tres hijos. La falta de empleo en el país ha contribuido a que su esposo nunca tenga un trabajo formal, él es albañil y trabaja por su cuenta. La necesidad de tener un ingreso para sostener a su familia hizo que Rebeca se decidiera a iniciar su negocio de venta de figuras de cerámica y ropa interior desde hace más de un año. Este trabajo le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia y a ofrecerles educación a sus hijos.

En estos momentos, Rebeca necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares con los que espera cumplir con sus clientes que están en espera de sus pedidos, ella se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Rebeca, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

Juana is married with three children. Her husband is the town mayor, but his salary is not enough to cover the family needs and the education of their children. Juana started selling food in her own home, but as her business grew, she had to look for a new location. She recently moved to a new space in front of a school near her home. Juana has worked hard for her business to grow, and more so now that she has moved to a new location. She needs a $200 loan to buy food preparation products and utensils. She hopes to improve the appearance of her business and attract more clients. She needs your help. You can be a part of this growth. Don't doubt it, decide to help.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es intendente, pero el sueldo que recibe no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia y la educación de sus hijos. Por lo que Juana empezó vendiendo comidas en su propio domicilio y ante el incremento de la demanda de sus clientes, ella buscó un lugar para establecerse y recientemente su negocio se ubica enfrente de una escuela, cerca de su casa. Juana ha trabajado mucho para que su negocio pueda crecer y más ahora que esta en un nuevo domicilio.

Ahora ella requiere un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares con los que quiere comprar insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos, utensilios y mejorar la imagen de su establecimiento, para atraer a los clientes. Ella necesita de tu colaboración, tú puedes formar parte de este crecimiento, no lo dudes y decídete a ayudarla.

Juana Isabel is married and has three kids. Her family went through an economic crisis after her husband Juan de Dios had an accident, but Juana began to sell ceramics and jewelry. This helped her family deal with the problem and pay for the children's education. She started her business two years ago and now has many customers. Demand for her products has also increased, which is why she requests a loan of $200 to buy merchandise and complete the orders from her customers.

Hardworking, responsible and dedicated are words to describe Juana. She has worked hard to resolve her family's economic situation and now she needs your support. Now is the time to help those who most need it, don't think twice and help Juana and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana Isabel es casada y tiene tres hijos. A raíz de que Juan de Dios, su esposo, sufrió un accidente su familia pasó una dura crisis económica, pero Juana inició con la venta de cerámica y joyería, esto le ayudó a la familia a superar sus problemas y pagar la educación de sus hijos. Hace dos años que ella empezó con su trabajo y ahora tiene muchos más clientes, la demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado. Por lo que ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizara para la compra de mercancía y para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes.

Trabajadora, responsable y dedicada, son características que pueden definir a Juana, ella ha trabajado mucho para poder solventar los gasto de su familia, en estos momentos necesita de tu apoyo. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo pienses más y ayuda a Juana y su familia.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
When Rosa Maria was single she helped her mother in a business selling hamburgers. Now she is married and has three small children but her husband's salary, who works for a bricklayer, is not enough to provide for their family. This is why Rosa Maria opened her own hamburger business outside of her house two years ago. It has grown bit by bit and recently she acquired a small stall which needs maintenance. For this she needs a loan of $200, which she will also use to make flyers to advertise her business.

Rosa's hopes for getting ahead have made her work hard to acquire the stall she now has. She just needs a little bit of help to improve her business and her family's wellbeing. You can be an integral part of the growth of this business, don't think more about it and decide to help.

Traslated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando Rosa Maria estaba soltera ayudaba a su mamá en un negocio de venta de hamburguesas. Ahora es casada, tiene tres pequeños hijos y el salario que recibe su esposo como ayudante de albañil es insuficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Ante esta situación, hace dos años, Rosa Maria inició su propio negocio, vendiendo hamburguesas afuera de su casa, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y recientemente adquirió un pequeño puesto, que necesita mantenimiento, para lo que necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares, así como para mandar a hacer volantes para dar a conocer su negocio.

Los deseos de superación de Rosa la han impulsado a trabajar muy duro y lograr tener el puesto que ahora tiene. Solo necesita de una pequeña ayuda para que ella pueda mejorar su negocio y la situación en la que vive con su familia. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudar.

loans.use: Maintenance work on stall and printing flyers to advertise

texts.en:
Mrs. Concepcion, or Conchis as her neighbors call her is a very hard working and active person. She is always busy with her family. She tries to help her husband cover family expenses because he recieves a very small salary as an assistant bricklayer. Conchis has four children that are currently studying and she would like them to be able to complete their studies. For this reason, she decided to start selling frituras outside of her house. This business has been growing little by little over the years.

Conchis needs a $200 loan in order to obtain a greater quantity and variety of goods in order to increase sales and help her family more. Today is the moment this family in needs it. They you thank for it sincerely.

La señora Concepción, o Conchis como le dicen los vecinos, ha sido una persona muy activa y trabajadora, siempre se ha preocupado por su familia y trata de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares como le sea posible, porque el salario que recibe su esposo como ayudante de albañil es muy poco, ella tiene cuatro hijos que continúan estudiando, y Conchis quiere que puedan llegar a consumarlos, por lo que ella decidió poner un puesto de venta de frituras afuera de su casa, que poco a poco ha ido mejorando desde hace un año que inició.

Conchis necesita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para vender en su puesto, ampliar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes para incrementar sus ventas y obtener un mayor beneficio para ayudar a su familia. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más y decídete a ayudar a esta familia. Ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia learned the how to be a seamstess with relatives who live in Monterrey, Nuevo Leo'n. When she returned to her present address in Forecastle in the state of Coahuila, she could not find a job and decided to open a business similar to the one of its relatives. This was five years ago while she was still unmarried. She began with making alterations for her neighbors and at the moment it has many orders of secretariales uniforms.

Now she is married and has two children. One is 2 years old and smallest was born on the 15th. The familiar expenses have increased with the arrival of the baby. Alicia wants to offer a better future to her children and is ready to work to obtain it. She currently needs a loan of $375 to buy materials to fill exisiting orders. Alicia wants her business to grow and sincerely thanks you for any aid you can provide.

Alicia aprendió el oficio de costurera con unos familiares que viven en Monterrey, Nuevo León, al regresar a su actual domicilio en la localidad de Saltillo del estado de Coahuila, no podía conseguir trabajo y decidió abrir un negocio similar al de sus familiares, esto fue mientras ella estaba soltera, hace cinco años, empezó haciendo pequeñas costuras con las vecinas y actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de uniformes secretariales. Ahora ella es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 2 años y el más pequeño sólo tiene 15 días de nacido, y los gastos familiares se han incrementado con la llegada del bebé.

Alicia quiere ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para conseguirlo. En estos momentos ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de materiales que necesita para la elaboración de las prendas que le han sido pedidas. Ella quiere crecer y necesita de tu apoyo, y agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darle.

loans.use:
Purchase fabric and thred

compra de telas e hilos

texts.en:
Doña Julia is from Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas. For the past 20 years, she's lived in Monterrery, Nuevo León. She is divorced and lives with one of her children, who helps her at her grocery store, where she has worked for 15 years. She started the business in order to provide for her children after her divorce. This business has grown gradually. They began with small quantities of merchandise and now are a store that can serve the entire neighborhood. Doña Julia is a very hard working woman, and on the weekends she sells tacos and hamburgers in her home.

At the moment Doña Julia needs a loan for $475, which she will use to buy merchandise so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of goods and increase her sales. Julia needs your support; please help her build up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Julia es originaria de Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, y desde hace 20 años vive en Monterrey, Nuevo León. Ella es divorciada y vive con uno de sus hijos que le ayuda a atender su negocio de abarrotes, en el que ya tiene 15 años trabajando, lo inició por la necesidad de sostener a sus hijos después de divorciarse. Este negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, comenzaron con pequeñas cantidades de mercancía y ahora es una tienda que puede cubrir las necesidades de todo el barrio. Doña Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora, y los fines de semana vende en su casa tortas, tacos, hamburguesas.

En estos momentos Doña Julia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizara en compra de mercancía para que su negocio siga creciendo, poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas. Julia necesita de tu apoyo y cariño, forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio y decídete a ayudar.

Diana is a member of the Roma minority in Sliven, Bulgaria.

Diana is a traveling sock saleswoman. She purchases inventory from five large producers based in Sliven and spends four days per week traveling to several regional, open-air markets. Her “sales territory” extends east to the Black Sea, south to the Turkish border, and west to Stara Zagora, in the center of Bulgaria. Diana charters a minivan with five other Sliven-based traveling merchants, who sell shoes, tracksuits and other apparel.

The unit economics of Diana’s business are fairly straightforward. She purchases socks for the local equivalent of $0.20-$0.30 and sells them at 2x – 3x their cost. Diana sells between 300 and 400 of pairs per month, with a gross profit of approximately $200. After paying out her share of the minivan, she nets around $150.

Diana has requested this loan for two reasons. First, she is looking to expand the breadth of her inventory. Right now, she only has money to carry some of the more basic sock styles, and believes she could sell more if she had a broader inventory. Second, Diana wants to purchase an overhead sign for her booth in order to attract more attention and develop a brand, as well as provide cover for her products when it rains. Currently, she covers her socks with plastic during inclement weather, but realizes that potential clients purchase more when they can easily browse merchandise; a plastic covering prevents that.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and a weighing machine

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
My name is Francia. I make and sell food from my home. I carry out my business near one of the largest hospitals in my country. I need more capital so that I can stock my business and improve sells and revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Francia y me dedico a la preparacion de alimentos y los vendo a personas particulares que compran alimentos en mi caseta. Mi negocio esta dentro de uno de los Hospitales mas grandes del pais, por lo que necesito capital para poder surtir mas mi negocio y de esta manera mejorar mis ventas e ingresos.

loans.use: To buy cheese, beans, meat, tortillas, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.en:
I have been selling children's, women's, and men's clothes for 3 years now. I like doing it because I get to meet new people. My clients order what they need, and I deliver it to them. I think my business is profitable and stable because I try to sell my products in response to clients' orders. My sells will improve if I am able to secure capital to invest and buy a greater variety of clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Me dedico a la venta de ropa para niño, dama y caballero, este negocio lo tengo desde hace tres años. y me gusta ya que he podido conocer otras personas. Mis clientes me piden lo que necesitan y se los entrego, considero que mi negocio es rentable y fijo ya que trato que sea mediante pedidos.
